Reviews.Title: Uses ~60GB of Bandwidth Each Month
Reviews.Author: Kerton
Reviews.Content: My review is focus on one aspect so as not to be too long, but still useful.  **Please note the updates at the end**The Dropcam is a very good, very easy to use device. Many of the top rated reviews here do an excellent job of listing the pros and cons. Also, the firmware has been updated since many of the negative reviews were posted, so there have been subtle improvements (not enough) with motion detection, and also the iOS and Android apps are now easy and great.The best use case of this camera, by far, is indoor remote surveillance of a kids room, a family room, or a workplace.Here's the real, overpowering negative about the device for me: it uses about 60GB of upload data capacity each month. The camera transmits its HD video feed to the DropCam cloud servers ALL DAY, EVERY DAY. The cloud service is what makes the user experience so easy, and what allows you to view your camera from multiple places, phones, tablets, all with just a userID and password. It's good in that you don't have to learn about firewalls, IP port forwarding and such just to make it work. But, that also means that it sends enormous amounts of video of a room with nothing at all happening in it. If your ISP has a quota or a limit to how much you can send per month, this camera WILL DEFINITELY USE A LARGE PORTION. In Canada and with some US ISPs, the limit is 50GB...i.e. less than this camera sends!- Lots of ISPs offer a quota of 250GB, so this camera won't put most US customers over their limit. Just know that this will soak up a good portion of your allotment.- Each additional camera will add to the bandwidth you use.- Consider that you are also downloading the video feed from your ISP, so if you are in the same place as the camera viewing it, it doubles the bandwidth used. Yep, that's right, your video goes up to the cloud server, then back down to you.- FYI, the upload rate is about 400-600 Kbps- The camera does use excellent compression, so the HD video is as compact as it can be in 2012.- If you have anything less than awesome Internet service, the camera will slow down your uploads of other stuff, like photos, attachments, etc. Upload speed is always much slower than download on consumer Internet service, and that's what this camera uses.So, take this important point into consideration. It may still be a great product for you, but you need to know the costs. For me, I planned on using this at a lake house with slow Internet, so it doesn't work for me. I'll have to find another use for it.****Update, September 2012The camera has just received a software update that lets you switch between SD mode and HD mode. All DropCams that are turned on and connected to the Internet will get the update automatically. The standard definition mode uses half the bandwidth of the HD mode. Overall, there is a big improvement regarding the problem I cited in my original review. The update has other benefits in motion detection, etc.As for me, the 30GB a month is still too much, so I will continue to use the available software switch to turn the camera on and off, and only enable it when I want to watch.****Update, May 2014Dropcam keeps on adding features that improve the camera. This is the upside of a cloud service. They can update features on the cloud, and then you get them, even on your older Dropcam. Lately, they've added ACTIVITY RECOGNITION, which is really great. This means that their servers storing your video can recognize certain patterns that tend to occur on your camera, and then distinguish those patterns going forward. An example would be a camera pointed at a front door with the street in the background. The Dropcam cloud might identify cars moving on the street as one activity, and a person walking up to the door as another, and a person walking away from the door as a third. You can then go into the web site, name the activities, and then set up alerts and search on each individual activity. Thus, you could quickly find all instances of somebody walking up to your door, or get a notification each time it happens. Or you could wonder "What time did the kids leave" and then filter only by people walking away from the door. Good stuff.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with my choice after researching (Easy to setup. Works as advertised.)
Reviews.Author: Seth Eatinger
Reviews.Content: I spent some time researching the different options (Logitech, foscam, dropcam, adt, x10, cisco, ...) in this product category.  I decided to try out a DropCam HD.  So far (3 days of use), I'm delighted.  The product does everything it promises.It took me about 5-10 minutes to complete the full setup process (open the box to getting video streams online).  In fact, it took me longer to figure out where I was going to put it.Other solutions require special software to be installed and/or a PC/Mac system to be running to capture the video.  I don't want to keep a computer on while I am away on travel + have to maintain/update the software.  The DropCam HD solution removes all this extra effort/time/pain.pros==== - easy to setup (5 minutes of work) - can view online or via android/iphone - can share your camera with friends securely - motion tags allow you to jump to interesting sections - no need for special software or a PC running to capture all the data - surprised by 2way audio feature.  Fun to use while you are away.cons==== - monthly dvr pricing for saved streams (free if you just want live views)still testing============= - low light/night video capture

Reviews.Title: My one complaint about this camera....unfortunately it was a DEAL BREAKER :-(
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Only buy this if you plan on purchasing the monthly recording service which costs $100 to $300/year!!  Without the additional costly recording service you can only view video live.  Other cameras like foscam will send you a large jpeg or short video clip right to your email for free when motion is detected.  Dropcam does have the option of sending a tiny thumbnail of an image to your email when motion is detected but the image is so tiny it is worthless.  This would be a much better product if dropcam would send a bigger image to capture details when motion is detected but Dropcam basically forces the buyer to have to purchase the monthly recording services.  For the buyer who does not buy the monthly recording service, the tiny thumbnail (80x40 resolution) shows so little detail it makes this camera not a good buy for those not wanting to pay an extra $100 to $300/year.  The dropcam company certainly could send a high resolution photo to customers emails when motion is detected.....but they choose not to because they want to make so much money pigeon holing people into buying the expensive additional monthly recording services.  I wish I had known this before purchasing.  I returned the dropcam and am very happy with my foscam camera since it does send me high resolution images for free when motion is detected.  If you do purchase the $300 yearly recording plan, then it works great! I hope this helps future buyers know the limitations of the dropcam when the extra monthly services are not purchased.

Reviews.Title: Great to watch the kiddos!
Reviews.Author: Jeanine
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I am loving this Dropcam! I put it in my living room to see when the kids are home from school. The setup process was done lickety-split, and  all I had to type in was my wireless password (which - admittedly - I had to hunt through a dozen post-its to find). Now I can see it on my iphone and also from my computer at work! Cool!Some details:1. I tried another camera like this before and it couldn't see the entire living room from its perch in the corner. On the other hand, the Dropcam can see almost my whole living room while sitting on the same bookshelf in the corner. Faces appear a little small, but I definitely like being able to see the kids whether they are on the couch or laying on the floor2. The night vision is a really nifty feature. I could just make out my husband on the other side of the room (about 20 feet?). We don't have a big use for it since our kids are older, but it would make a great baby monitor. I guess if somebody breaks in (eek!) we will have the video for America's Most Wanted!3. There's a little clicking noise here and there on the audio (not sure what that is?) but you can definitely hear what's being said ... I had to wear headphones to really make it out though because my laptop's speakers aren't too great4. The talking feature is already a family favorite - at least for Mom, that is ... let's just say I think a lot more homework is about to be done after school and before dinner time....5. It's bee-yoo-tee-ful! I really can't tell you how many of these electronic doo-dads are ugly as sin. It looks and feels like a little art sculpture sitting next to the other knick-knacks on the bookshelf, and the white cable blends in nicely with the wall.I think that's about it! I don't normally write reviews, but I just felt like this gem deserved it. Thanks Dropcam!!

Reviews.Title: 2nd time was the charm
Reviews.Author: Colleen B.
Reviews.Content: I pre-ordered this item 2 1/2 months ago, so I was very excited for its arrival this past weekend. However, upon setting it up, it worked for less than 15 minutes before it overheated & shut down. (Same problem another previous reviewer reported). I have been unable to get it to turn on ever since.I have submitted a ticket to customer service, over 48 hours with no response so far. I will update my review if they can make it right, however at the moment I am VERY unhappy.EDIT 4/20/12: I gave up waiting for an e-mail back and called customer service. Took about 10 minutes to get through, and after a series of questions, the agent agreed that the camera I had (or possibly the power cord) was defective. He sent me a prepaid shipping label to send it back to them, and immediately sent me out a new unit 2nd Day Air. So big kudos to their customer service team.I received the new unit lastnight, and spent some time playing with it to make sure it was not going to do the same thing as the first one. It seems to be working pretty well so far. My intent is to use this to keep an eye on my baby when he arrives this summer, but for now I am using it on my dog while I'm at work. I have been able to peak in at him a few times today. I really like that you can turn the camera off or on from the iphone app, so it doesn't have to stay on all the time. I also LOVE that the audio is two-way, that was an unexpected bonus that blew my husband and I away! It works very very well.That being said, the device is not perfect, there are definitely some kinks they need to work out. It takes a lot of patience to make any changes or turn the camera off, the settings on both the app and the website are pretty slow to come up. The video delay is only about 2 seconds though, which is what really matters in my opinion. The video is pretty darn clear too, and the night vision is impressive.Occasionally when I turn the camera on or off from the app, it "freezes" and I have to back completely out of it and go back in. Not a huge deal since it works once I go back in. Also, it'd be really nice to be able to control the panning/zoom from the app.I'm also stuck with two video feeds in my account now that I had two separate cameras, I went through every available option, and there's no way to delete the non-working one. Annoying.Overall though, as long as it continues to work, it's a pretty cool gadget, and will definitely come in handy with keeping an eye on our little one once he arrives!EDIT 11/19/12:I wanted to come back and update my review now that I have been using the Dropcam for 6 months, 3 months of which have been on our new baby. We absolutely could not be happier with the Dropcam. It stays on 24 hours a day, every day and has caused us no problems with overheating or anything. There have been several updates to the iphone (and now ipad!) apps, and website, and I find them all to be much more user-friendly now. We chose this in lieu of a traditional monitor, and we have no regrets. I especially love that we can leave the baby with a sitter and peek in on him no matter how far we are from home. We would obviously not have that option with a traditional monitor.My one (tiny) gripe is that it does tend to disconnect several times throughout the day and night. Every time this happens, I just have to exit out of the app and go back in. I believe this is more of an issue with our internet connection and/or router, but I wish there was something dropcam could do to make it automatically reconnect whenever this happens.EDIT 12/2/13:We have now been using our Dropcam for over a year and a half, and could not be happier with it! I actually had completely forgotten that the original one we got was defective, because we have never had a single solitary problem with the replacement. It has worked flawlessly as a baby monitor for us & I can't imagine not having it!In my last update here last year, I mentioned that the app would disconnect/reconnect intermittently, that has now been corrected. I don't remember the last time we had that issue. There also was an app update a while back that added an option to automatically turn the camera off/on at a certain time of day. We love that feature & now have ours set up to turn off on weekdays while we are at work.It is also now possible (and easy) to zoom via the app. Everything has become MUCH more user-friendly these last couple updates.So, I'm really glad we took a chance on the dropcam, and didn't give up after the first one was a dud. We LOVE being able to peak in on our little guy via our iPhones while we are out and he's home with a sitter. We have also added the app to Grandmas' phones and they enjoy being able to peak in on him from the comfort of their own homes!Thanks Dropcam!

Reviews.Title: Dropcam caught my home burglar
Reviews.Author: Rex C.
Reviews.Content: My home and at least three others in my neighbor has been the victim of repeated home burglaries over the last few months.  The police had a couple of suspects but no hard evidence.  Last week my wife and I went on vacation.  Before leaving I got two Dropcams and subscribed to the DRV service.  I set up my I-phone to receive alerts when the cameras detected motion.  Five days into our trip while driving down the interstate 800 miles from home I got an alarm.  When we checked it we were able to watch the burglar going through our belongings in our home.  I called the police and they caught him in the act.  Without Dropcam he may have never been caught and now the video evidence I was able to download and provide the police will be a key component to the trial.  I Love Dropcam!!

Reviews.Title: Best "IP camera" on the market
Reviews.Author: L. Fool
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a good "IP camera" for a long time now, and this is the first one that I won't be putting in the junk drawer. I've been reading a lot of the reviews and the comments from the company, and I think they are the first people to really "get it".Setup: They say 2 minutes, it took about 5-10 minutes, but who's counting when the competition doesn't even work without reconfiguring your router. The wall mounting took longer than the wifi setup, and even that was still pretty easy.Software: I have both an iPhone 4 and a Samsung Galaxy S2. The iPhone app is really good, the Android app is ... well, it works, but it's a little slow and needs some polish. The Dropcam folks have said that a new native version is coming out in some comments here, and the iPhone app has had a couple of great updates since I installed it, so I'll keep the faith going on Android ... I'm really tired of people who expect it to work on their multi-year old phones though, if you've got some crummy prepaid Android phone from Virgin mobile, blame Virgin not anyone else.Website: The website is really nicely designed, and if anything the mobile apps need to have more of the features that are available on it. Browsing the DVR is much more pleasant, changing settings is easier, and you also use the site to setup your camera in the first place, which is really easy. My only complaint is that I had to upgrade Flash, which is probably OK, I just wish it didn't use Flash at all.Camera: Camera pops out of the base a little too easily, but when I got it all finally positioned on the wall it stayed in place. Night vision works well, though you can see a faint red light from the LEDs. Microphone works OK, a little noisy at first but better when I adjusted the volume. Speaker was a lot louder after adjusting the Flash microphone volume, and now that works well too.Recording: I used to be a big do-it-yourselfer, but now that I'm a "grumpy old man" I prefer to compare the true cost of, say, running my own UNIX server in the basement vs just paying for the dang service. I've been using the trial for a couple of weeks, and the best thing is I don't have to keep anything on but the Dropcam and the wifi to get the recording. Some of the other cameras I've used required software running 24/7 on your PC, which is a non-starter if you have a laptop, and a big hassle to keep running all of the time. I've seen a lot of people complaining about the price ... my advice is don't be so cheap. I don't change my own oil anymore, why would I want to administrate a server?Overall I'm very happy, mostly because of the setup, software and service. It's not everyday that you just breeze through setting up a new and complex device like this. Bravo, 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: What they don't tell you....
Reviews.Author: BK63 "bklosens"
Reviews.Content: I wanted something to keep an eye on my house, and my dog when I was at work.  I have an alarm system but wanted to also look in when I wasn't there.  The wide angle on this camera provides more of a view than my old Linksys camera and the HD is much more clear of a picture.  I did a lot of research on the latest cameras before I bought this one.  What they don't tell you is the email alerts fire off only about once every 30 minutes, and NOT every time there is motion.  So if a car drives by and creates enough of a light difference I get an email alert.  If maybe 5 or 10 minutes later if somebody walks in the house, there is an event I can view, but it does not email you until about 30 minutes have gone by.  This camera will serve it's purpose well enough so I can check in, and the setup was simple enough.  Another issue I've seen, is several times in just the first few days when I went to login, the dropcam site was not available.  It was only down for about 10 or 15 minutes at a time but I've experienced this several times already.  If it weren't for that, and the email alerts, it would of got 5 stars.*******  I wanted to update this to 4 stars because I do like the fact that you can review everything that happens while this camera is on.  If I were to improve it, I would say add a feature to let people choose whether to get emails for every event, or one within a certain amount of time, like every 30 minutes.  Also the camera has no option to be hard wired, and there is no outdoor camera at the moment.  I look forward to seeing the companies improvements.Update* After a couple of months it does the job to monitor the house and the company seems to have fixed the issues with not being able to log in from time to time but the camera itself does disconnect from the wireless from time to time and has to be unplugged from power.  Today I'm at work on a Saturday and wanted to check on my dog and it says the camera is not connected.  The wireless access point is 10 feet from the camera.  No reason the camera should disconnect from time to time.  This is ok for "checking" on things, but I'm going to install a wired system that is more reliable.

Reviews.Title: Monthly subscription cost
Reviews.Author: C. K. Hedges
Reviews.Content: I had to go to the Dropcam website to find out, but here is what they say directly from them.You would think Amazon would require that it be posted with the listing.It is not.Dropcam DVRAccess footage and make clips of the past 7 or 30 days.7-Day Recording$9.95/month$99/year30-Day Recording$29.95/month$299/year50% off DVR pricing for additional Dropcams.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, quality product
Reviews.Author: spyre98
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a baby monitor and was intrigued when I read about Dropcam.Pros:- As advertised, the installation and set up was incredibly easy (I think it was three steps, and the first step was just plugging it into my computer).  I haven't done anything more complex (like trying to have it be viewable from outside my home) but for the basic set up it's great.  It's also really easy to download and configure the apps on PC, Android or iPhone (I tried all three).- The camera is extremely clear- It has pan/zoom features which are really nice, and decent audio.- Night vision (which automatically switches on when there isn't enough ambient light) works extremely well.- There is a notification feature which will send you an email if there is noise or if there is movement detected on the camera.  I haven't gotten it to function as expected yet because it requires that you set the sensitivity properly (which is just trial and error) but this feature is pretty useful particularly when used as a baby monitor.The Cons:- The unit gets extremely hot (not burning, but definitely not comfortable to the touch), even when it is off.  This is the part I don't get - why does the unit stay hot even when you set it to "off" in the app and there is no video stream?  I plan to leave it unplugged unless I'm using it, which is a bit of a hassle, but this is just precautionary for my own sanity.- There is a bit of a delay in transmission over wifi with the video/audio.  It's probably only 2-3 seconds of delay with a good signal, but in parts of my home where the signal isn't as strong, it can be up to 15 seconds.  This is not a showstopper for me but fair warning for anyone that is monitoring a situation where seconds matter.- The 'talk back' which allows you to speak through the mic of the camera (two way intercom basically) is good in theory but again the delay makes this hard to use.Overall I would highly recommend this product as it not only serves as a baby monitor but can be redeployed for other uses (as a security or nannycam for example).

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Will Cullen
Reviews.Content: 29yrs.  Business owner, early adopter.  This camera is awesome, easy set up, apps to view on your phone, picture is great, you can sign up for 7 days of DVR for 9.99 a month, pretty good price, you can name each camera, you can have one for your house, one at work.  You can set up push notifications when movement is detected.  Its pretty cool.  I will be buying additional cameras for sure.  You can even talk through the camera from your phone or computer.  Definitely needs wifi, dont care how much data it uses, unlimited plans everywhere.  Picture and sound are great.

Reviews.Title: THE best video monitoring camera!
Reviews.Author: GottagetGadgets "gadgets freak"
Reviews.Content: I have tried many, many wifi cameras to monitor my elderly parents at their home and this camera is, without a doubt, THE  one for my purposes.  Set up, indeed, was done in no time and no need to know about "port forwarding".  If you can plug in a USB cable to the USB port on your computer, you can set up this camera.The picture is clean, crisp, and the sound amazing.  I can read the newspaper headlines with this thing!Best of all is two-way audio without the need for an external speaker.  No....wait...better yet, best of all, this thing is less expensive than the other wifi camera's I've tried.  Want to watch your baby?  Get this camera.  Want to watch Fido?  Get this camera.  Want to be able watch and talk to your family when you arent there?  Get this camera!As for the bandwidth usage, for my purposes, I dont have the camera 'on' all the time but simply slide the button to 'on' when I want to check in.  My parents appreciate the fact that they can tell  whether the camera is off or on.

Reviews.Title: All I can say is "Wow!" A million thanks!
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Mahlstedt
Reviews.Content: After spending DAYS on the phone for "tech" support for the Motorola and Foscam video monitoring cameras and finally giving up because NO ONE in either company's "tech" support had any knowledge about their products and the FACT that they would NOT work unless I had a "static" IP....this Dropcam is a dream come true. It set up in seconds and works brilliantly from my PC, my iPad and my Samsung Galaxy S3. EVERYTHING works with ease....I set the timer to only (initially) monitor from 6-9 PM daily and it WORKS....I'm just giddy over the simplicity and beauty of this camera and all the features that are FREE plus the other features that I might someday pay for. The only thing I have to be careful about is exceeding my HughesNet satellite data limit. But with the feature that allows for timed monitoring, that shouldn't be a problem. LOVE IT. LOVE IT. (and, no I don't work for the company).

Reviews.Title: I bought one a month ago...
Reviews.Author: T. J. Daugherty
Reviews.Content: ..and I liked it so much I've ordered a second.First I'd start with the quality of materials and ease of set up.  This is a very well constructed little device - obviously made with quality materials and the brushed aluminun aesthetic you see with a lot of Apple products.  It has some heft to it and is most definitely not a plastic-y feeling piece of equipment.  Equally impressive is the setup - which is effectively plug n' play.  You need one of the available APP's and/or Website access to view your video.We're using these to monitor our house and pets while on vacation.  Our first experiment helped us discover which dog was getting up on the couch as soon as we left - although we were suspicious it was nice to see evidence.  While many states away we were able to go on the website or open the App on our phones/tablets and just check in on the house and pets.We have not utilized the recording service or DVR at this point, so can't speak to its effectiveness.

Reviews.Title: What all consumer grade nanny cams should aspire to be like.
Reviews.Author: big_art
Reviews.Content: This thing rocks.  I have three of them, and convinced my coworkers and friends to pick them up.  I can't get way Dropcam is the only guys that figured out how to do a good streaming camera service.  I've tried Belkin's Netcam and Logitech solutions, and this one is the best.Why?  It's less expensive the Logitech solutions and much easier to set up.  It has more features and reliability than the Netcam.You start to look for excuses to use it, and feel a little creepy doing it but somehow get used to it.  I use it to watch work in progress on my home remodel, and another one as a permanent surveillance camera in the front of my house.  I even mounted it outside under the eaves of the roof and it has weathered the winter rain and 100 degree heat in my home in the Hollywood Hills (CA).  It is not designed for outdoor use, but it works fine.  No issues at all.It has a two-way mic/speaker that is pretty nifty.  At first I thought it was an afterthought, because the speaker is so small - but it actually works pretty well.It has a nighttime IR mode which works very well.  You can supplement it with additional IR LED's and it picks those up too.  It does get a bit hot though, so be careful when handling it.The mic is very sensitive.  Quality of sound is not that great, but it can pick up everything.The stand is versatile when mounted, since it can be rotated or swung back and forth, with the camera able to rotate in it's mount as well.  The stand has some sort of rubber gasket so it will move but provide enough resistance to keep it fixed.However, it is not the all perfect solution, it does have some drawbacks.  HD quality is nowhere near true HD - it looks good, but it is grainy and has a lot of noise, distortion and artifacts.  Quality of video is not as good as Logitech's closed loop system.  This is something that will be an issue with most streaming solutions.  Also, it does not have an option to route locally through LAN, like Belkin's camera.  The signal ALWAYS goes through the internet, to server and then back down to your mobile app or through the web interface.  So there's several seconds of lag and performance issues, bandwidth hogging issues.  It also appears to have some issues with connectivity - mine tends to drop out from time to time, but can restart itself and keep recording.For the price of the cam and the optional DVR package, it is an excellent buy.  Just think, a few years ago, setting up a camera at home required all sorts of wiring, hookup to a recorder, power connection, etc and even then, very few systems allowed for a remote connection to a live feed.  Now it's just a single USB cable to a power source and a Wi-Fi connection and you're up and running.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable for the money
Reviews.Author: jackhammerliveaudio
Reviews.Content: This was talked about my Leo Laporte on the TWIT network. It installs in minutes, the Dropcam website is simple and works flawlessly. For $99.99 a year it will record for 7 days ( then it deletes this and starts another 7 days, they also have a 30 day option) to the Dropcam server so you can go back to see who had access. The notoifications on your phone when the motion detector goes off, or the camera loses power is instantaneous. The motion detector works perfectly. I get the Drop Cam android app giving me notifications in the middle of the night when a bug flies around my shop. This is the way to do security. The alarm companies are dirtbags, and the cops don't come when alarm goes off anyway, plus they charge you for false alarms which are often with a company, so this gives me the option to view my shop, and call the police if I think necassary

Reviews.Title: Dropcam saves the day
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I would happily endorse the Dropcam HD as a home security option for anyone with an unlimited broadband connection.I had some strange happenings in my back yard. Stuff getting knocked over, holes in my screen room, and BBs found regularly in the yard. We dealt with it for a few months. We just figured some kids were having some fun nearby and our house was caught in the cross fire. But once we put our birds out back to enjoy the summer air the damage to my property increased. My dog also got "stung" by something which left a large welt on his ass. Along with having a baby on the way this was my cue to look into a security solution and or baby monitor. Most systems were just too much hassle for what I needed.I heard about the Dropcam and it looked like a good fit. It's small, inexpensive, high quality, could be used a baby monitor. When I received the Dropcam and I was able to get it up and running in a few seconds. The only problems I encountered was that my WiFi signal on the far end of my house was too weak for the cam to produce a reliable stream. Fortunately, I was able to relocate my wireless router to my more central location in the house which is better for everyone. I then placed the camera in my laundry room window facing out my back porch. The wide angle lens does a great job of capturing the door to my screen room as well as the side yard and gate. Later that night I encountered the second problem which was that night vision doesn't work well at all through glass windows. But that isn't fault of the camera at all. It's just how inferred works.The Dropcam comes with a 14 day trial of the DVR service which I enabled immediately. A few days later we got a hit! We provided the video to the police and they saw it too. When I gave them a longer clip they even spotted a second shot that I didn't see. From their description I was able to go into my yard and find a BB right where they said! These shots were NOT accidental and the police are pursuing action! Needless to say, I now subscribe to the 7 Day DVR Service.I will be ordering another two Dropcams to add to my home. One I'll be facing out front of the house and a second one for the baby when it arrives. The only down side is the DVR service fee is per camera but you do get a 50% discount on additional cams. So I'll just add the second camera to the 7 Day DVR service and use the free live service for the baby monitor for a total of $15 a month.

Reviews.Title: awesome IP camera - fast setup and easy to use
Reviews.Author: rg
Reviews.Content: We recently took delivery of the dropcam, and it is remarkably simple to set up.  It took maybe 3-4 minutes to setup and within minutes, we were monitoring it from 3 iphones and 2 computers.  You can add text messaging to your phone for motion and sound if you know the e-mail of your text messaging (i.e. phonenumber@vtext.com).  The one downside is that if you close the iphone app, the sound stops so it may not be ideal for a primary baby monitor.  However, we are using it as a backup monitor so that the other parent or someone else can monitor if they're somewhere else in the house.  The picture though is much more clear than our very expensive baby video monitor.  It does what it says it does and we haven't had any connectivity issues like others.  I would highly recommend this IP camera if you're looking for one.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product - even better than I hoped for!
Reviews.Author: Richard Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought a dropcam from Amazon before we went on a 10 day vacation. I was hoping for 2 main things:1. Ease of set up2. Quality product and communicationThe actual product exceeded my expectations in both areas!The set up was super easy - no CDs to worry about - just plug in to computer and it automatically set up and found my wireless network. I was really impressed. It also worked flawlessly with my iphone 4GS after I had downloaded the free dropcam app from the app store.The dropcam unit came in nice packaging and is a very nice looking unit made out of brushed metal - not cheap plastic like most things nowadays. After connecting to my network the dropcam communicated video and sound to my Macbook and iphone. Video quality was pretty good and sound was very sensitive.We used the dropcam to keep an eye on our house while we were on vacation so I was able to check in to see the live video feed on my phone from 1,500 miles away! Dropcam can also be set up to send text messages if it detects movement. This worked and alerted me whenever my lamps (on timers) would come on or turn off. Thankfully that was the most excitement it detected.I am rarely super happy with tech products these days as they are often overly complex and a pain to set up but the Dropcam was the exception! I would recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Got great pictures of my Robbers..
Reviews.Author: James L. Jones
Reviews.Content: We got burgled last year, they backed a truck up to my workshop and walked out with $3000 worth of tools..Really made me angry. so I installed a video surveillance cameras.  The problem with those is that you have to know that you've been robbed in order to find that short piece of video to review.Dropcam, makes this much easier.  It notifies you when there's activity.the cops loved the video I got off dropcam of two young men trying to break in..  When the "guy in the hat" see's the dropcam, they take off running..It works, it's easy to install.  I can watch the video's on my phone or Ipad..love it..

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: cduke
Reviews.Content: I have been through my fair share of wireless security cameras, including the Archerfish (now CheckVideo) and the Astak Mole. They either would stop working, or had other problems which caused them to repeatedly fail. They were also extremely difficult to set up, even for an expert.ProsThe Dropcam is completely different by design and implementation. It's a brilliant product with setup that makes it so easy it's insane.- The quality of the video (compared to the previous cams I've had) is amazing, even in SD mode.- The two-way audio is a nice touch. Works like a charm. I already freaked my wife out while she was exiting the car by having my daughter say "Hi Mom" into my phone with the "push to talk" feature. She didn't know about the new cam and was looking around the garage for my daughter. She had no clue what was going on! :)- Mounting couldn't be easier. There were no screws supplied, so grab 3 of your own, drill them in and then the base of the Dropcam just snaps into place. Took me 60 seconds.- The software (the iOS app and the website) couldn't be better. The features are everything I need, and more.- I was pleasantly surprised at how fast and well the notifications work (the iOS app uses iOS's native notifications to alert you, which take you directly to the video event to watch). The location aware notifications system is a nice addition, although I haven't had time to test it.- The wide-angle lens on this thing is perfect. I have it mounted on the side in my two car garage, and it captures the entire space with a reasonable amount of distortion.- The USB cable included is very long! Actually for me it's a Con, because the outlet for mine is 2 inches away :)Cons- As many others have stated, there is some bandwidth usage for the DVR service. I did some tests using SpeedTest and here's what I found, using upload speeds as the basis of my tests. Each test was performed one after the other 1) Cam Off 2) Cam in HD mode 3) Cam in SD mode. The upload speeds are fairly consistent, showing the degradation. This is based off of a TimeWarner cable modem. I performed a series of the tests:OFF: 1.91, 1.92, 1.89 MbpsHD: 1.70, 1.73, 1.73 MbpsSD: 1.78, 1.78, 1.77 MbpsEven when in HD mode (using the most upload bandwidth), it didn't seem to affect other typical activities like browsing the web, FaceTime, etc. So while it's a concern, it's not a huge one. It's a necessary evil to have your video stored in the cloud, accessible anywhere, with such ease.- I've experienced intermittent buffering issues with the video streaming to the iOS app, even while at home. When this happens, the video freezes and you get a brief error message across the screen.- There's a Dropcam "logo bug" (watermark) which appears in the lower right hand corner of the screen. A nice marketing stunt by the developers, however no security cameras I've ever owned have done this and it's a bit annoying. An option to disable it in a future update would be greatly appreciated.- The back of the camera gets quite warm. We have 95F+ weather here during the summer, so I'm concerned about it overheating. Hopefully it can automatically shut off instead of exploding.- The night vision mode works well enough (again, in my 2 car garage space). It's nothing to write home about, but it's better than my Archerfish cams which didn't have any at all.- There's no outdoor version. According to their forums, they are working on it. You can always stuff it in an air-tight plastic box or pelican case with a hole big enough for the nose of the cam and another hole for the cable.In closing, this camera is so good at so many different things that the few things that aren't so hot are nothing to keep me from using it, and potentially buying a 2nd cam.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam HD - Not Perfect but  a very good option
Reviews.Author: LightSick
Reviews.Content: I've had my Dropcam HD for about a year now, since June 2012. And although I couldn't call it perfect, and there have been some annoyances, I've really been pleased with it overall. And I think whether or not one is pleased with it depends on what they hope to use it for (your expectations) and the quality and dependability of your WiFi network.  I would not recommend it's use for critical applications, life or death. For critical applications I would imagine a hard wired system or the need to pay much more for a wireless system.  However for general security, peace of mind and perhaps just broadcasting your life or interests to the world, I think it's a pretty damn good system to consider.  The Good (in my opinion of course);1) Ease of set up and use. After an initial connection with your PC or Mac, you're free to place your camera almost anywhere and begin using it immediately. The limitations are the need for power (DC adapter in 110 outlet, like a small iPhone charging block) and the limitations of your WiFi network (range and bandwidth). It comes with a 10' USB cable so you have some latitude in placement with regards to your outlet location.2) Your mobile / internet connectivity options. You can log in from any internet enabled computer. And mobile apps for either iPhone or Android phones make checking in and remote viewing very easy. I have an iPhone so I can't speak for the Android app. But my iPhone app works very well, even over cellular. It doesn't require a network / WiFi connection.3) The mounting platform(s) are well thought out. Not necessarily discrete but stable. You can simply set it on the table etc, or wall mount it.4) Video Quality. Very good. You have the option of HD (720) or not. The only reason I could think of for not shooting at HD might simply be your WiFi network is just not up to the task. And it's not a great task. I think the minimal required upload speeds necessary for HD use is ridiculously low. I just have a middle of the road level of internet from my ISP (Cox) and I have absolutely no issues with having the necessary bandwidth. You don't need a high end, blazingly fast, remote gamer type connection.5) Camera options control. I'm amazed at how much control options you have. HD or not, microphone on or not, sensitivity, speak remotely through the camera's speaker from across the country / world ("get out of my house", "Hi Honey how was your day", "Hi Honey don't forget tomorrow is trash day", "Hello Fluffy how was your day", you get the idea), IR night lights (on or off or auto), digital zoom in any of 5 zones (4 quadrants or center),"On" indicator light on/off, motion and/or sound notifications, recently added scheduled auto on/off, and of course the option of 1 week or 30 day DVR recording (I've got the week's worth and think it pretty slick).6) Updates, firmware and additional capability can be delivered, in the background directly to your connected camera. No downloads, re-connecting to your computer or any of that nonsense. Very convenient.7) I've found their customer support to be friendly and fast. I've never had any serious issues although I communicated with them reference #2 below. They were very interested and asked for video clips of the events. Much of the communication was via email which went very smoothly. I honestly believe they would like to develop the consumer "go to" solution and take seriously any input from you/me.8) I like the DVR option they offer. For me and my application it's ideal. I don't have to waste space on my computer or deal with added network complexities. It's just there for me to review when I want, as I need to. And although I've only got a week's worth of DVR recordings, constantly dumping old video for new video, I can easily save any video footage I may find of interest to me (or the police), even remotely.  The Bad (or maybe just annoying), again simply my opinion;1) Low light performance. The built-in IR lighting is not going to shock and awe you. After only a short distance it stops being particularly useful in my application. Since I'm using it generally for security purposes I don't even want the relatively bright IR illuminators to be seen and generally have them turned off and leave a light on in the room / hallway. But for other applications, where discretion isn't a priority, I'm certain the illumination may be enough.2) I have always experienced (sporadically) what I call a "camera blink". The "blink" does not affect the viewing or recording in any significant way. It's only a split second "blink" that's not even an on - off. It's simply a very momentary exposure change, a slight darkening then immediately the exposure returns to normal. My annoyance with the "blink" is because the camera interprets this as motion, and subsequently notifies me of a motion alert. Since no one else should be in the house I find myself logging in to see the "burglars". After a while it can be irritating if there are too many "blinks". The "blinks" are camera artifacts, not real conditions. But the same effect can be seen if there's a flash of reflected light or passing shadow. Better to be safe than sorry I guess but I'll hope the fine folks at Dropcam will fix this in some kind of update.3) Currently my one camera is near my computer / router etc, connected to my APS in case of loss of power (intentional or power outage). Certainly works fine from there of course. And as that's where my primary "burglar" concern is, that's just fine. I did play with placing it in the living room when I first got it. Tried to "hide" it amid stereo / TV equipment. I had spotty luck in that regard. Although my network provides streaming from any of the rooms in my house (like Netflix) I was a little surprised with what seemed like spotty performance by the Dropcam. I didn't really experiment thoroughly since I intended it to be in the bedroom from the first. Might have been my network (?) or it might have simply been it's being "nested" in the surrounding electronics that provided interference. So in all fairness this (#3) should be taken with a grain of salt since I really didn't conduct any thorough testing at all. Frankly I think it was the electronics surrounding it. Maybe I should just delete #3 but maybe there's some validity to cautioning against adjacent electronics (in my bid to "hide" the camera).  Alright, I shamed myself. Should never have brought it up. I just ran around the house with it and all rooms were easily within range and worked just fine.4) But perhaps #3 is a lead in for #4. There is definitely a lag in the video. As you're watching it remotely there is about a second delay. That's to be expected as signals zip back and forth over the network. But the lag is far more pronounced when turning it on. Enough so that you may believe it's not working. That may have been the case a year ago when I was trying it in the living room, amid the TV junk. Maybe it did work but I never allowed it enough time to turn on and connect remotely. I'm accustomed to the lag now. After turning it on when I leave in the morning for work, it will say it's "off" or "not connected". I'm accustomed to this now but it would drive me crazy before. I'd sit there, turn it on and off over and over, trying to get it to work, check the connections, etc. But it (at least mine) takes a minute or two to actually activate. Before I hit my car in the driveway I'll get the message (emails and notification) that Motion was detected. Seems to do that each time I turn it on. After a minute or so I'll get an email advising "Motion" detected. Just it's way of saying "Hi, I'm finally awake and working".  So this, in my experience, is just the way it is. There's no instantaneous turning it on. If that's critical to your application then perhaps the Dropcam is not your device of choice. For me it's merely reality and as such I don't really think I can "ding" the Dropcam for it. Let this instead simply be a advisory.5) The camera does get warm over time, especially with the IR lights operating. I raise this issue for a couple reasons. The first, and perhaps most important, is potential for a fire if it's not allowed adequate ventilation. I'd really advise against stuffing this into Mr Biggs the teddy bear for covert nanny cam application. I don't know what kind of testing in this respect the folks at Dropcam may have done. I don't know if the camera simply shuts down (and therefore cools down) if it reaches some specific temperature. And I'm not sacrificing or abusing mine to find out. I'm just suggesting that I feel uncomfortable with that scenario and I'd hate to see a flaming Mr Biggs dropping down onto Junior like a comet entering the atmosphere.  The second reason is because I have left mine plugged in for extended periods of time (weeks) and of course it's warm (not hot) to the touch. But a few weeks back I noticed the video image was kind of polarized or solarized (not sure what may be the correct term). The image was there but there were patches of pixelated color, splotches if you will. If I remember it wasn't even "on", simply plugged in. When I turned it on I saw the patchy colored image. So now I've taken to unplugging it while I'm at home and not plugging it in until I leave the house. I don't actually "know" what caused the image degradation but it hasn't repeated itself. Maybe it just needs to be unplugged every so often and allowed to "rest" and cool off. I know I do.  In reality I've had to nitpick a little to find fault with the Dropcam. Half the "Bads" really aren't bad, simply observations that I've made over time. I use it almost daily and for the greater part of the day. For my purposes and application I've been real pleased with the camera. To the extent that I am probably going to purchase another one in the very near future. Perhaps a more recently manufactured Dropcam hasn't any of these issues. I bought mine when there was a huge and long back order. What I'd really like to see is Dropcam HD ver 2.0.  I imagine the team at Dropcam is already contemplating a newer version that allows them to address issues that have been noted with the first HD version as well as add capability. That's also why I haven't already purchased a second Dropcam. I know as soon as I do there'll be an announcement that a new, improved Dropcam is shipping the next day.  One reason I've felt compelled to write this is because I've seen some rather flaming reviews in the Apple App store about the Apple app, if not the camera itself. Maybe I've just been lucky. But I have enjoyed the use and capability of my Dropcam HD, and any "downs" I've experienced and mentioned above are far outweighed by the upsides. I am less paranoid about someone breaking into my house (my primary reason for purchasing the Dropcam. And if they do, I'll have them on video which I can give to the cops if they don't get there in time to catch them in the act. And I can send the video clip(s) to them from anywhere and right away), And I like the versatility (like watching for a package to arrive and being able to call the neighbor and have them hang onto it until I get home, see whose dog in pooping in my yard (I hope it's the dog) and the list goes on.  Depending on your application, and your expectations, I think you'll actually like the Dropcam and appreciate it's usefulness. It's not high end, CIA / NASA technology but it's pretty damn good technology none the less.

Reviews.Title: Doggie Cam
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: After a few reports of my dog being noisy while I was at work, I bought this to see what was going on while I wasn't there.  It helped me understand the issue (a noisy door rattling) and fix it.  And, now I get to keep an eye on my pooch anytime I want.  It was so very easy to set-up.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!  - 04/04/2013
Reviews.Author: Kacey Rose
Reviews.Content: I have owned it for about a week now and it does exactly what its suppose to. I have it positioned at my front door and it literally catches everyone from the mailman, to the garbage collectors, FedEx and any unwanted guest!! It literally can shoot you an email whenever there is a motion detected on the camera with the link to view the footage. It is very convenient when you're not home (of course you would have to have email on your smartphone or iPad for real time alerts) It also has night vision which could be better but nonetheless gets the job done! You can also visit the supermarket and log in to the app to view a LIVE shot of your front door to see whats happening!! I can go on and on about this product but I don't wanna bore you  to death!!  = ) anyway a highly recommended product!! worth the price!! TRUST ME.

Reviews.Title: Good Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to watch the front of the house.  Setup took 30 seconds and was up and running.  Great little camera and nice interrogation into the iPhone & iPad App.Will purchase additional cameras for other areas of the house.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding technology
Reviews.Author: Mezzplayer
Reviews.Content: This is a great piece of technology!  Installed our Dropcam overlooking the baseball field at our local high school.  Now our fans can watch the games whenever they can't make it to the field (on their computers, tablets, or smartphones).I did quite a bit of research before settling on the Dropcam.  Chose the Dropcam becaused it didn't need a dedicated computer, it's wide angle lens, wireless capability (though it's not completely untethered), near HD quality, and above all, the ability for many people to watch all at the same time (well thought out apps). I couldn't find anything else on the market that had the same feature set.  I had the Dropcam setup in minutes, though getting it to work outdoors was a much greater undertaking and not an approved use by Dropcam.I built a weatherproof case and mounted it outdoor on the fence.  The weather in So. Cal is quite mild, so most of the time the camera is operating within it's temperature parameters. I probably would think twice if there were extreme temperature fluctuations.Some things to consider.* The Dropcam is only going to work as long as it can transmit a strong enough signal to your wireless router.  Even if you have strong wifi, the weak link is the signal from the camera. I had to move the router closer to establish a sold link.* You need sufficient upload bandwidth. With little activity, the Dropcam uploads around .2 MPS, jumping to around .5 MPS when the scene is changing a lot.  We're on dsl, so it does have momentary lapses in the picture when there's a lot of field activity.  Somehow the camera buffers video and transmitts when there's sufficient bandwidth so that there's no break in the video when watching on the DVR.*  It's on continuously, so be prepared to use around 60G a month.*  Lighting is the key to a great picture.  In low light, it will be grainy, however on sunnny days the picture is outstanding. Looks best when viewing on an iPad connected by wifi.*  Dropcam needs continuous power.  Though wireless, the camera needs power and so the placement is limited by the location of the outlet and the length of the power cord (~10 feet).* Nightvision is good indoors, say for monitoring your kids, but useless in your window to see outside at night.  The IR will reflect off the glass and obscure the view.For our purposes, it's worked great.  There are some short breaks in the video and occasional buffering issues, but that's part of the territory when using wireless and the internet. If you want to see how good the picture can be, go to the featured cams at Dropcam to see our field (listed as CdM Baseball).

Reviews.Title: Great product but SHAME ON AMAZON
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: Shame on Amazon.com for selling refurbished products and not disclosing it to people.Knowing several people who have dropcams and knowing how happy they are with their purchases, I recently decided to buy one.  I made the mistake of buying one from amazon.com rather than directly from the manufacturer.  When i recieved my dropcam I went to set it up but was unable to do so.  (i was getting an error message basically indicating that the camera did not belong to my account and was instructed to contact customer dropcam customer support.)I called dropcam customer support and spoke with Niel.  After explaining the issue to Niel and providing him with the serial# of the dropcam amazon.com sent me, Niel discovered that the dropcam amazon sent me was actually a used/refurbished product.  SHAME ON AMAZON for passing off refurbished dropcams at the same price as a new one.  SHAME ON AMAZON for not telling people they are buying used goods.Buy this great product DIRECTLY FROM DROPCAM to assure you actually get what you pay for......a NEW dropcam.

Reviews.Title: Great Product-Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I looked into many different systems before purchasing this product. My primary reason for purchasing this camera over others was the simplicity of setup. It took about 5 minutes to set up on my Mac computer. After that, I simply plugged it into the closest power outlet and I was done. While the system is "wireless" with respect to the internet connection, it still does need to be plugged in to a standard electrical outlet.I considered more complex DVR setups, but was not up for the task of hardwiring the power, plus there can be issues with some systems and a Mac computer.I also love the free app that is available for iPad and iPhone which I use regularly. The app notifies you any time there is movement near the camera. One issue I had was that the app will alert you when lighting conditions change. This means that I usually get an alert when the sun come up and when it goes down. All-in-all, it is still a great app though.

Reviews.Title: A versatile and useful solution for me
Reviews.Author: Drew Jusko
Reviews.Content: My car was stolen from my driveway a few months ago. This camera sits in a bedroom window looking down at the driveway, covered from behind with a shade to improve image quality. Obviously an indoor camera. I turned off sound and night vision. (Night vision will not work looking out a window BTW) Coupled with a sensitive motion detecting light outside, this unit picks up exactly what I need.I have not noticed any bandwidth hogging, although I did read previous reviews and agree this might use more bandwidth than you might want, as it will generally be looking at absolutely nothing.I love being able to 'peep in' remotely, from computer or iphone. I know when contractors or babysitters are in the driveway. I know if my wife has arrived home safely. I can look back a week on any events which were triggered and look at them. I see way more deer walking through my driveway at 3am than I thought were there.Excellent product. Would cost over 10X as much to do something equivalent for me through ADT. I made the effort to do the shopping after I bought the product and I'm happy I bought this.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: This was a good buy at $100. Easy to set up and I use it all the time. It's handy to use on the iphone and because it is portable you can move it around as desired. I use it to monitor my dogs and the two way communication is great. I wish I would have bought more while they were on sale.

Reviews.Title: works great for pet watching - update
Reviews.Author: Ruckle Ridge "climb on"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to spy on my cat when I am away.  all features work as advertised. amazing technology.  iPhone app works great for turning on and off.  it sends an email when motion is detected, and detects my cat.  night vision mode works great. during initial network setup, I got an error message indicating the camera had a problem . to resolve, I switched from using my wirelessly networked pc to my Ethernet connected iMac. camera connected flawlessly when using my iMac.  my best guess is that there was some sort of conflict when trying to connect this WiFi camera to the same WiFi that my pc was using.  I think if I would have connected my pc to my router with an Ethernet cable, setting up the WiFi camera would have worked fine.  camera has a heavy base and sits just fine on my cabinet shelf, very stable.  I did not need to use the include mounting kit.  camera has a speaker and Mic, worked great for talking with my pet sitter.  very thrilled with this camera!Update after about 5 weeks- just wanted to note that drop cam automatically recovers from a powerloss to both the camera and wifi router. Also, drop cam app for kindle fire works as flawlessly as the iphone app.

Reviews.Title: Stoked.... so far!
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet.LITERALLY, took less than 2 minutes to set this up.Picture/sound, for under $150.00, streaming over the web to my McBkPro, iPad & iPhone....fantastic with no issues whatsoever.They made things even better by making it very, very simple to set up. And a big plus for the not so savvy, what I would consider a very user friendly web site to monitor your live video & sound. (App is even easier)Time will tell.All is swell.Going to wait a week or two and if today's any indication of how marvelous this product is, I'm going to buy another.Well done. Dropcam!

Reviews.Title: Use with Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Rebecca N
Reviews.Content: I bought this on Black Friday, and had it working literally 2 minutes out of the box.  It is THAT easy.I also bought a Kindle Fire during the whole made rush of sales.  I installed the dropcam app on that, and it works really well too (you can get the free app through the appstore on the the kindle.  You can't use it through the browser because the browser access needs flash which the kindle browser doesn't have).  But regardless - 2 minutes to have this working.  2 minutes to install the dropcam app on your Kindle Fire, Ipad, or Iphone (I did all 3!) and you have the best monitor out there.  The picture is very sharp, and it performs amazingly in low light.  I am watching my daughter sleep in the other room, and it's not in night vision because there is some light in the room, but it appears much brighter than the room actually is.Overall just a fantastic buy, and so compatible with other devices you have.

Reviews.Title: Does what I need it to do.
Reviews.Author: Claudejer
Reviews.Content: I looked at several different options for an indoor wireless security camera. I ruled out professional installed systems due to cost and monthly monitoring fees. I looked at other wifi based cameras but they needed me to have more computer expertise. The Dropcam HD was the simplest and I think the best option for my needs.It is very simple to set up. Just plug it into your computer's USB port. It registers with the dropcam website and then you put it anywhere in your home you have a wifi signal. It constantly records/uploads to Dopcams site where you can view a live feed for free or pay a monthly fee for it to record and store your feed. We chose the 7 day dvr set up hat stores the past 7 days of recordings. You go to the dropcam website and can view the footage and save clips if needed to your PC/Mac.  It is 9.99 a month or $100 for 12 months prepaid.I really like the free iPhone app because it allows me to view the camera live from any location I have a cell or wifi signal. I receive email alerts when the motion detection is set off with pics.You have the option of hd or sd video. The sd takes up less bandwidth and is still of good enough quality to see what is happening on screen. The night vision is not bad but there is a bit of a glow to the footage.Overall, the Dropcam HD is worth the money and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for an inexpensive way to monitor your home.UPDATE 7/25/13:Recently, the mini USB port on my Dropcam HD broke as I was attaching the cord to it. It just popped off the camera. I called Dropcam support and was treated very well.  Because this happened within the first year of ownership, they shipped me a new camera and emailed me a link to download a prepaid FedEx label to ship my broken unit back to them. All of this was done at no cost to me.  Only thing extra I had to do was call support after I had set up the replacement camera so they could link it to my existing DVR account.Great product and great customer service.

Reviews.Title: My grandmother could set this up!  Perfect second home system.
Reviews.Author: Gary F. Lee
Reviews.Content: First off, its true. This camera ( The HD version)  was amazingly simple to hook up. Opening box to seeing video in under 3 minutes. Next, unlike the icam system in my other house, this one does NOT need to be connected to a computer to operate ( except for the brief set-up ). What is nice about this is that when the power goes out at my other house- with the other camera- thats it. Show is over, unless I can call and get a neighbor to go over and turn it back on. Not with the Dropcam!  I can confirm ( Thanks to hurricane Sandy) that when the power goes out, then comes back on, so will your live feed. Its great. The quality of daylight picture is great, the night picture - not so much. I called customer support twice and never stayed " On hold" longer than a minute or two. ( calls I made with general questions)  so customer support was fine. I am easily able to see, HEAR and make adjustments to the live feed on 2 ipads, an Iphone and a laptop, basically any device that can get a website. This is a well made, sleek looking camera that works amazingly well especially for the price. I will be replacing my old Icam with another one.UPDATE: The Dropcam people have put out an update to the Ipad App that is excellent. Very easy to navigate and much easier to use with more than one camera, which is in our near future. Great product and company.

Reviews.Title: XC lent
Reviews.Author: Stosh
Reviews.Content: Dropcam is the next thing closest to the iphone boom.... if you have a smart phone .... you can watch YOUR world... key word is YOUR world ... and smart phone access... just fix the realtime zoom capability...and the night vision

Reviews.Title: Works great, solution to connection problem
Reviews.Author: JCity
Reviews.Content: Read reviews, ordered w/ slight hesitation based on reported connection problems/poor customer service. Once package arrived, had same connection problem others reported. Called customer service, spoke with a tech after about 5mins wait, very helpful. Turns out camera ships w/ bad cable sometimes...works for powering device but bad connection to your computer. Tech suggested I try using a different micro-usb cable. After digging one out, camera worked perfectly. Very helpful support, camera is flawless, great addition to our home tech toys. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: R. Nelson
Reviews.Content: I think everyone has pointed out the pros and cons of this product. I've had mine about a month and it is such a user friendly product to use. We use it for a baby monitor. I can see it from my office on my Galaxy S3. My wife uses her iPad with it. I could not find another product that played well with both MAC and Android. My Mother and Aunt are able to log in and see/talk to the baby when I have it on. This is in itself is priceless. It is so much better than every monitor we looked at.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for video monitoring
Reviews.Author: Jaaboston "jaaboston"
Reviews.Content: I bought the original Dropcam more than a year ago and still works as advertised. i recently purchased the HD model and it works even better. I use it to keep track of my dog while we are away and the cameras work perfectly. I have not had any issues with the wireless signal dropping since I purchased them. You have to make sure that your wireless signal is good enough around the house, otherwise the signal will drop but it is not a problem with the camera. I had both of them running for 12 days two weeks ago and did not drop even once. The HD camera has night vision and you can also talk (I use my iphone and iPad and this features works well with both).  The set up is painless (I have had other wireless cameras in the past where setting them up have been more difficult). I use the apple extreme airport router with this camera and have had no issues at all. If you want a reliable camera, good quality and price this is for you. I pay a monthly fee for recording only when I am away for a few weeks, otherwise, you don't need to pay anything else (just seeing the  live video without recording is probably enough for a lot of us). Not having to buy special recording equipment, static IP addresses, etc is a real plus. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: After a not so easy setup, works great
Reviews.Author: Kevin Knoll
Reviews.Content: So far it works great. We plan on using it as a baby monitor when the kids come early next year. I've tested it on the cats and everything works as advertised. The IOS and Android apps are great, but I wish they had a Windows Phone 8 app since that's the type of phone I have. There is an unofficial one that works reasonably well, but it doesn't have all of the features of the official apps.The reason it has 4 stars is because the set up was not 60 seconds like advertised. It actually took quite some time to get the camera to connect to the WiFi. I have verizon fios and the camera would see my network, but whenever I tried entering the password it said it couldn't find the network. Dropcam's online help articles were not much help, so I had to do some searches elsewhere. I found something somewhere (I think another amazon review) that told me what to do and I was finally able to get it set up.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy - we have 3!
Reviews.Author: L. Melton
Reviews.Content: My kids (ages 8 and 13) get home about an hour before I do, so this is a great way for my husband and I to check in on them from our phones (he has an android and I have an iPhone.)  I tried several different webcams that had horrific set ups, and this was a welcome change.  We were set up and watching online within 10 minutes.  The ONLY downside to this was that if the power goes out and the modem loses power, you have to set up the camera(s) (we have 3) again....not a big deal though since it's such  quick set up.

Reviews.Title: The customer service won me over
Reviews.Author: Joshua D Brooks
Reviews.Content: I don't write many reviews, but I feel it was worth it.  The drop cams are extremely simple to setup and view.  The IOS app is nice and simple.  I was going to drop a star because I feel the price for the CVR is a bit high if you have more than 1 drop cam you'd like to record with(yes the second, third and fourth one is cheaper, but still $50/yr/cam adds up).  I chose not to reduce my rating because of the excellent customer service I received when one of the dropcams arrived and did not function.  I contact support via email and received a non generic response in a few hours requesting more information.  It was determined the unit was bad and needed replacement.  They mailed me a new dropcam before I was able to send the non-function unit back with a prepaid shipping label.  Then emailed me again to make sure I didn't have any problems with the new unit. WOW.  Customer service is a winner in my book and I will stay with those companies that do their best to stand by their product with out hoops to jump through.

Reviews.Title: Great doggie camera !
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: We love our dropcam camera and the only reason we purchased it was so we could keep and I on our dogs.  The other day I checked up on them and saw that they were all barking when usually they are all sound asleep.  Looked around and saw nothing was going on so I just told them all to be quiet through my phone.  The all perked up and looked around for me, rather funny but they did quiet down and when I check up on them again they were all sleeping.  This is a great camera and we are planning on getting another one soon.

Reviews.Title: Use your imagination! (Oh, now that you have this you don't have to imagine. . .)
Reviews.Author: Forbzilla "forbzilla"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant, but now having used this in several applications I'm sold.Use 1.  Creepy neighbor.  Set out in summer under porch eves to see if odd activity around my pooch.  None.  Lots of dog sleeping no molestation. Okay.Use 2.  Very sick friend. Chemo. The TV negated the sound event part, but the unit picked up motion and allowed us to see if she was asleep or needed attention.Use 3. Entry hallway of B&B.;  Catches exterior noise events if people are having trouble figuring out the door, records initial impression, which has been helpful.Keep in mind you have to subscribe for the upload after the first month ($10/month) and it must be near a very good wireless internet connection.The programming is some of the easiest I've encountered.  Unplug the cord from electric plug (a lot like your I-phone charging cord, but longer and more robust).  Plug it into your computer.  Program launches, you give the device a name (mine has obviously had three different ones) tell it the code to the wireless.  Get an application for your smart phone and you are off and running.  I'm not a tech geek.  Not, not, not.  I did it. No problem whatsoever.Keeping in mind the weather issues (not too cold, never wet and not through glass) I can think of a thousand uses for this product and remember many nights checking the mare for foaling every hour that this would have been really handy!

Reviews.Title: Coolest Purchase Ever!
Reviews.Author: Paige Ann
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest thing ever! It works great! However, the zoom function is not the best.  The video is distorted when you try to zoom in.  I use this camera to check on my dogs and it has eased a lot of my anxiety.  The camera has night vision and two way audio, so if I see my dog eating the drywall I can yell at him via an app on my iphone.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, lightning fast setup - make sure to have beefy router
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: SETUP:My new Dropcam just came in and setup was 8 min from the time I plugged in the cord for setup and accessed a live feed. For that I give it 6 stars. After setting it up on 2 different routers I've determined that a really beefy router optimizes functionality.LOCAL HARDDRIVE SAVING: the camera does not afford free local access to the video footage, but I have screen capture software, so I can still store my own video on my hard drive. The capture software offers motion detection, so when Dropcam picks up movement - my hard drive will automatically start recording the video feed. I have it set to stop recording after inactivity returns. This saves space on my hard drive. This option however, requires a pc be running during the times at which you might want to pick up motion-triggered activities, and you need a pretty big hard drive or external flash drive. I have 600Gig Seagate. I mainly would use this when I'm travelling and disable it when I'm at home so I don't run the PC all the time.ROUTER:I have Win XP Pro on my laptop and iPhone 5 (6.1 IOS) and have AT&T; DSL. I have a 2 story house and the router is located in the basement (required for satellite tv hookup). The camera is in the kitchen which is one floor above the router. I first hooked this up to my Netgear WGT624 108mbps and it connected briefly but I could never maintain a feed. It kept dropping every 30 seconds, regardless of what channel I used. However, I expected this would be the case which is why I bought a new router at same time as camera. I then installed my new Netgear Nighthawk R7000 600mbps, which is dual band 2.4/5.0 AC (same location). It resolved the issue.SPEED TEST:Router speed tests are the following: in 2.4Ghz I get Ping of 80, Download speed of 1.28Mbps and Upload speed of 0.21 Mbps at my camera location. That is far under the Dropcam recommended upload speed of 0.50 but they *do* say on their website a typical upload consumption is around 0.20 so I guess I just skim the border. My router is on the floor below the camera so I realize these results could improve if I moved the router closer or used a repeater/range extender.HD vs SD:HD setting still made it hiccup and say "Loading" as soon as motion entered the room. So I reduced to SD and it resolved the issue. On HD the delay is about 2 minutes. On SD the delay is 3 seconds. Every other device in my house, even in the far corner of the upstairs (2 floors away from router) connect perfectly. But not the Dropcam. I switched most of my other devices to run on the 5.0 frequency to reduce traffic over the 2.4. I imagine the Dropcam Pro would be even worse as it requires more bandwidth with its higher resolution.DELAY:iPhone viewing live and laptop viewing live are about the same delay and image quality. Microphone delay in SD is almost real time, maybe 1 second delay (when I spoke into my iPhone app using the mic feature). Although the response time (from the person speaking into the camera mic) is about 3 second delay. Picture in SD is just fine, colors are great, detail is very good, but details degrade drastically beyond one room in SD. I can make out people, but not face details. But in HD resolution is brilliant across rooms. Since I cannot effectively run in HD I give the camera a 3 stars - and I am running on what is considered one of the most powerful new routers on the market. Overall I am pleased as it does the job I needed. Not exactly how I wanted as I would prefer HD, but it does the job.ALERTS:I initially had trouble with motion alerts and thought perhaps it was because I do not have the paid CVR. But I have now been able to get them to work for free. The issue was my office at work and poor network coverage. Evidently 2 bars of signal on a 4G iPhone is not enough to allow incoming push notification from Dropcam (although oddly enough SMS messages all came in just fine) even when I could see the dog walking all over the place. But as soon as I exited the office, the Dropcam push notifications popped up. I guess there is a different technology for push notificatio transmission than SMS, and it apparently needs a very strong signal to work.In terms of motion alerts delay - I'm fairly pleased, now that I have it working. The delay time on an alert to my phone is about one minute. And email/text both shos up almost simultaneously.11/6/13 UPDATE: I logged a feature request on Dropcam.com.  Currently, you can use the mobile app to manipulate most of the camera settings. However, they still require you to log in directly into Dropcam.com to access certain key features that cannot be accessed from the mobile app.  The issue with this is that when you pull up the Dropcam.com destop app on your mobile phone browser and try to accss the General Settings box as they instruct you to do - it's nearly impossible!! The box will initially appear in the center of the screen but it is literally the size of a postage stamp! I couldn't check any boxes, even with my pinky. So when you pinch to zoom a bit, the box then repositions out of reach. Dropcam support responded within hours (very pleased about that) and said it is a known issue that the webiste is not optimized to be viewed over a mobile device and therefore the General Settins popup box keeps trying to reposition itself out of view and reach of your active view window if you try to zoom in on it in order to change the settings. It's like chasing that little on-screen puppy that moves when your cursor moves!! Maddening! If you're going to be making any remote changes to your phone, you better be sitting in front of a laptop or computer or you are out of luck. I have logged a ticket with them and they responded the same day - so I'm very pleased with response time. They confirmed their website is not optimized for mobile view.
