It's an easy fix, speaking as a former web developer, so I have high hopes this quick win will be addressed. They can change the popup box to fixed position (if mobile browser is detected). Support is currently addressing this, so I will give them 5 stars for their response time!!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY DROPCAM!
Reviews.Author: KrisPatt
Reviews.Content: We got this in preparation for our first child to be born to use instead of a traditional baby monitor. While the baby isn't here until December I have been using this to spy on my dog, housekeepers, the mailman, and anyone else unlucky enough to cross paths with my house while I am at work. The fact that I can watch, and listen, to a live feed on my iPhone, iPad, and computer is awesome but also love the idea that multiple people can watch what is going on at the same time. Coupled with the fact that you can talk through the camera to say, startle your dog awake from a dead sleep, is also amazing and it has night vision as well so I can see his reaction day or night when I wake him up. Based on what I have heard about traditional baby monitors, this was such a great choice because there is no range limitations and with the DVR option I can record every single movement of this child's life from the moment I bring it home from the hospital if I want to. Overall I think it is a great product and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Wow! Finally a video monitoring camera that works!
Reviews.Author: 1Pilgrim "1Pilgrim"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased several different brands and styles of home video monitoring cameras over the last several years trying to find something that is easy to use and that WORKS! This camera is amazing! Just plug it into your computer...add it....unplug it and plug it into an electrical outlet and you are up and ready to monitor a room of your home. Some are saying it's a bandwidth hog.....but I'm just using it for live monitoring---which is free---not storing video. They have a handy ap for the Iphone which loads quickly for free and now I just click on it and, pow!, there's my living room. Sight and sound. And the night vision really works! also. I'm sold. Probably going to order at least one more.

Reviews.Title: Outdoor Conversion
Reviews.Author: Shari
Reviews.Content: I built what looks like a bird house for outdoor application with a small hole for the lens to look through, works great and the dropcam is snuggled inside waiting for the next car burglar.....With dropcam, you never know whose looking so I recommend you always be on your best behavior and keep your hands to yourself. I decided to do this when I read other reviews of people saying the night vision doesn't work well facing out a window because the infrared reflects on the glass distorting the view. Keep in mind I live in southern California where the outdoor climate is dry and this may not work for you if it rains a lot where you live. Our driveway and front yard is now being watched when we cannot.

Reviews.Title: love them!
Reviews.Author: Andy Graham
Reviews.Content: Just placed an order for my 3rd one. So much easier to set up and operate than the Panasonic security camera  whichI bought before. I would like to see Dropcam make an outdoor housing for the camera also.

Reviews.Title: I couldnt be happier wtih the camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I’ve had the dropcam up and running for about three weeks now.  I can only think that the people that have said it loses its Wi-Fi connection every couple days have a glitch with their Wi-Fi.  Mine has not lost it yet, I’ve also read that it can’t log onto the Wi-Fi unless it’s in the same room as their Wi-Fi.  My wireless router is down in my basement and I put the camera outside in the backyard.  It’s quite a long ways from the router and I don’t have an expensive router.  This was very easy to set up but quite a few people have said that already, its ease of setup was an excellent part of the camera because it’s the 3rd camera I’ve had.  I consider myself to be quite computer literate.  I had a Linksys camera that was so impossible to get to work, it was an Ethernet camera, to the point I had to call an IT professional and it took him an hour to get it to work.  I purchased a D-Link camera that I finally gave up on.  It was supposed to be “easy” to get it up and running.  I tried it on three different computers, two different houses and my computer at work and never got it to work.  I can’t speak highly enough about this one, good picture and it “works”!!! ALL THE TIME.  I don’t usually leave feedback but I’m so pleased with this camera I had to.  The only Con I will agree with is the cost of the online recording is quite expensive if you want that feature.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Daniela Jaros
Reviews.Content: Great quality! Even the night vision on it is great! The app for the phone works perfectly and it gives you peace of mind. We bought for our baby that is coming in October, but tested with our dog. It is great that you can talk from wherever you are and the baby or dog or whoever is on the camera can hear you. I would recommend this product and would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: A quality product supported by outstanding customer service
Reviews.Author: Paul F.
Reviews.Content: DropCam is a quality product that is supported by outstanding customer service.  A home alarm system is a first line of defense against intruders but, as any police department will caution, a burglar of even minimal competence can probably get in and out of a house before a police car, responding to the alarm, can get there.  A DropCam, however, gives one a video record of an intrusion and, moreover, can supply video of it in real time, which a DropCam owner can view on his/her smart phone.  A DropCam won't necessarily prevent burglaries (though a sign that warns of its presence might discourage them), but the video supplied to police will undoubtedly aid them in identifying and apprehending the burglar.  The long and the short of it is, I suppose, the added peace of mind that a DropCam can provide.  The DropCam, itself, is reliable, easy to install, and easy to use; it is essentially plug-and-play.  Moreover, DropCam offers first-rate technical support.  The company's staff members are unfailingly polite, smart, and helpful.  The preceding remarks are, admittedly, unreservedly positive and may strike some readers as over the top.  That reaction would be mistaken.  DropCam, as a product and as a company, is that good.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Chuck T
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing.  It literally takes less than 3 minutes to setup.  The picture quality is awesome, and I love the Infrared night vision.  It comes with 2 way sound and works on a MAC.  What more can you ask for???  Works great on Ipad and Iphone.If I could find one improvement, it would the capability to move the camera left/right and up/down.  But honestly, this is thee best and easiest camera on the market.I'm ready to purchase a few more!!!

Reviews.Title: Great cam
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn
Reviews.Content: I chose Dropcam because of its features and I must say I am pleased with my decision.  It is so easy to set up, has good video quality, sound quality and many settings options.  I like the fact that it streams live video, and having the option to purchase DVR recording.  The stand the camera rests in is bendable which offers visual flexibility, and the camera has the advantage of being removed to be placed more covertly.  Customer Service is very attentive too; if you have questions you never feel like you're on your own.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: L. Platt
Reviews.Content: I can now watch and hear my pets and living room anytime from my iphone or a computer! Pretty plug-and-play, very easy set-up and installation.Suggestions to Dropcam:Reduced fee for plans on additional DropcamsAbility to remotely control and move camera viewAbility to turn off camera light (which I covered with electrical tape)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gadget guy "Patel"
Reviews.Content: I needed to install a, indoor camera near my front door to see who is at the door before I opened the door. I researched a lot for a reasonable camera. Finally, decided to try this one. I am glad I purchased this one. It works like a charm. Excellent picture quality. Mind you, you are not buying a high end camera here. It's job is to look in close proximity and give you a clear picture. Picture quality is natural and very good. Also, you can talk through the microphone. I ended up adding a range extender to my router as the signal was not strong enough from my wireless router for this camera to work right. After I added the extender it works nice.I can see my porch remotely on iphone or web from any where. I can also see my drive way if there is any car parked. If you are looking for local indoor camera, this is great product at a reasonable price. Installation is very easy.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Martin L. Coltrin
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of other similar products, I was worried about port forwarding and other low-level internet connections.  How easy would it be to watch this through an iPhone when we are away from home?  I got this for my wife, who loves her dog more than she loves chocolate.  She wants to be able to look in on him when she is at work or away from home.  I opened the box, and set it up according to directions, but figured that only set me up to watch it locally on my home network.  Nope.  It set up an account on dropcam.com, and we can watch it anywhere.  The apps are quick and intuitive.  She can now watch her dog (and talk to him) any time, any where.  Not sure how much value as a baby monitor, because who is going to leave the baby home alone?  But as a home monitor, this would be great (or to watch the housekeeper).One little nit - it is not made for outdoor use, as some of the others are.  It is only rated down to 32 degrees.  We would have liked to set it up outside on days when it might snow, to see the conditions of the road.  We can still do it, but have to do it through a window.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam
Reviews.Author: Arman Orogian
Reviews.Content: The camera has night vision. How cool is that? It's got audio. That makes it hilarious. It streams video. It sends it to your device so you can always be watching and listening. Motion detection makes certain you catch anyone and then, if all that were not enough, this thing will send freaking call you to tell you it is filming something unusual. Seriously? What more could you ask from it except for it to bake a cake?

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: G. Beall
Reviews.Content: 1/2 the price of our panasonic cams, Installs in 30 seconds, night vision. If it could zoom and rotate it would be perfect. Also panasonic have no sounds for MACS

Reviews.Title: Easy to Setup
Reviews.Author: Lourdes
Reviews.Content: This camera literally took 1-minute to setup on my Mac. This products offers a bunch of features that I was looking for in security and surveillance. Here are some of the reasons I bought this:1. Easy to setup on pc or Mac2. Plug and Play3. HD picture4. Automatically uses Night Vision camera5. Extra Long Cable6. Optional offsite DVR7. PriceThe quality of the metal base is hefty enough and easy to adjust the viewing angles.  It also comes with screws/base for wall mounting.  Having a long cable is a must as I already had to return a D-Link camera because the cord was so short that I had to use props to get the camera high enough. Not with the Dropcam---- the super long cable allows me to set the camera up high on my bookshelf or above the door windows and it easily reaches the wall socket near the floor.HD picture quality, super crisp clear images that you would expect paying hundreds of dollars.  This camera senses sounds and movement, and will instantly alert you by text, alerts, etc (depending on your setup).Overall, this camera has all the features and complete mobile control I was looking for and definitely worth the price.  It works so well, that we have decided to order a couple more while highly recommending it to friends who travel a lot, to others who have seniors living alone and need to check in on them, talk to them, and to friends who can keep an "eye" on their pets while they are at work, and even as a "nanny-cam".  There's also a built-in microphone so you can talk to the kids or pets while you're away.  This is a great little gadget that works in BIG ways!

Reviews.Title: Love this product
Reviews.Author: samswildworld
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the easiest wireless video monitoring camera around.  The pay as you go online DVR is awesome.  You don't have to worry changing media or hard-drive failures.  The push notification for motion is very accurate also.

Reviews.Title: Really cool little camera!
Reviews.Author: Rino Manfroni "Rino"
Reviews.Content: I have the cheapest service you can get from Time Warner Cable in Texas and this webcam still performs great! I can see videos on my phone and I love its high sensitivity to motion because it catches anything that happens in my bedroom when I am not there!

Reviews.Title: Love it but be careful with port
Reviews.Author: Motorlegs
Reviews.Content: I love my DropCam -- I use it to keep an eye on my pets when I'm gone and to keep an eye on the driveway for deliveries when I'm home. I use a MacBook, an first-gen iPad, as well as an iPhone 4S to monitor the feeds. I do not use the HD feature, as it tends to suck quite a bit of bandwidth. The night vision is amazing -- it's so much fun to watch what my critters do at night!DropCam's customer service is exemplary. About a month after I got the DropCam, it seemed to lose the connection, so I pulled out the USB cable and stuck it back in. The little metal sleeve on the port of the DropCam dislodged into the DropCam housing. Oh no!!DropCam customer service was wonderful! They immediately shipped me a new DropCam and provided for return shipping of the old one (even though I bought it thru Amazon). This is why I gave the product 5 stars, even though the port is a little on the flimsy side. DropCam really stands behind their product.My tip: Try not to plug & replug the cable into the DropCam often. Hopefully they will make it more robust in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for the price and ease.
Reviews.Author: BrianS
Reviews.Content: Installed this last night and had it functional in under 10 minutes. The camera quality is very good and the lag is only a few seconds. The audio feature was tested and is functional but again with a short delay. I am likely going to purchase another one but would like the ability to mount it outdoors. I was able to view on my iPhone 4s, computer and Samsung tablet. The interface is very simple and I liked the available features it offered. I also like the cloud storage rather than an actual DVR, even though you do have to pay extra (monthly or yearly) for this optional feature. I've read reviews about the bandwidth required and I imagine this will play a part with your video quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: Easy set up. Not only using it for a home security camera but watching the progress of a renovation of my pool while I'm at work.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: jbudde
Reviews.Content: we bought this for a "baby monitor" didnt really like the idea of having to be on either the pc or phone to watch it.. BUT its an awesome spy camera . we had it on while we were out of town and we saw our neighbors come in and play with the cat! they didnt even know!

Reviews.Title: Ideal for me for few reasons
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn Settler "Nuyoka"
Reviews.Content: First, install made very easy where I don't need to have some DNS accounts because they would never work since Cablevision blocks port 80. Secondly, software to check via an iPhone is great - everything about this product is solid, I think because this product is mature and that's why manufacturer doesn't jump like others from changing storage on youtube to dropbox. I have bought cloud service as well, so now can go back 7 days to see what was going on.I hope at some point service for cloud service will drop from today's $100 for a year.

Reviews.Title: Hopefully the NSA isn't watching us through these
Reviews.Author: Second Stroke Mopeds
Reviews.Content: But if they are, whatever. We deserve it for the convenience we get in exchange for a $150 surveillance camera that goes straight to your phone and saves to the cloud for $99 a year.Today we caught a guy trying to steal a bike today and got super clear pictures of him on our two Dropcams. Really good quality. I like that it has audio.Cons:- They do cut out pretty regularly so I'd definitely recommend at least 2 if you are using these for a business.- They make our internet super slow.I have recommended this to so many other business owners for a cheap solution for monitoring their businesses when they're not around. The iPhone and iPad apps make it the best option out there for so little $$. A professional system costs well over $1,000 and does pretty much the same thing.

Reviews.Title: Usually works, good security, cheap way to monitor the home...
Reviews.Author: J. Woolston
Reviews.Content: This one is a great device..but sometimes it flakes out. Usually works, keeps the room recorded (the plan you buy with it for 10 bucks a month records the room and saves it for 1 week, so if an issue occurs, you have proof for police, etc). I like the layer of protection it offers. Good for front doors, keeping watch on kids, pets, etc. A cheap way to gain some high tech peace of mind. I would totally buy another one.

Reviews.Title: OK performance
Reviews.Author: V. Agarwal
Reviews.Content: Overall, OK performance. Monitoring over the iPhone App is hit and miss. Works best on the iPhone when you are connected to a wireless network. Monitoring on your PC is OK as well - my experience has been that the connection keeps going in and out; so can't rely on it solely.Haven't been able to use any of the history or timeline features. Installation was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless video monitoring camera
Reviews.Author: Moondust11
Reviews.Content: We have had very little problem with this camera. It was easy to set up with the step-by-step instructions that came with it. We have had some difficulties with it turning off, but not excessively. Sometimes, we have problems with looking at it online in the computer but can view it through our I-phone.

Reviews.Title: Limited range. Loses Wi-Fi connection.
Reviews.Author: Edgar Kuck
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this camera is the ease of setup, taking less than 5 minutes. There are no port forwarding or other router settings to configure as required with the Foscam and DLink camera. After a major power loss this unit automatically reconnects and even sends an email stating the time and duration of the disconnect. That is assuming the camera is fairly close to the router.However after connecting I found that it has a limited Wi-Fi range, the poorest of any device tested.  All other devices including Foscam and Dlink cameras, an iPad, and several laptop computers all connect at least double the distance. Meanwhile the Drop Cam disconnects at less than 20 feet from the router, regardless of placement, and often as low as 15 feet even though my Wi-Fi Signal Analyzer measures between 4 and 5 bars (max signal).  This is most likely due to the design of the Drop Cam Wi-Fi client which has been squeezed into the small camera housing and is lacking any decent antennas. There is no way to increase the Wi-Fi range of this camera. My router is an ASUS RT-AC66u which reliably connects all Wi-Fi devices throughout the entire house and even outside, everything except the Drop Cam. Do not buy this Cam if you plan to install it at any decent distance from the router. Also unlike the Foscam you cannot use a direct LAN connection for this camera. It is either Wi-Fi or nothing and that is often the case - nothing.Be advised that you must pay $99 a year to access the 7 day recording feature and that will only work if the camera does not loose its Wi-Fi connection. Otherwise you simply get an email message that the camera has been disconnected for 30 minutes or longer.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Patrick Tokach "Minnesota res"
Reviews.Content: Daughter is using in baby room and she loves the fact she can see over her iPhone, iPad or laptop. Easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality is Fantastic.
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bundled this Video Camera with the Belkin WeMo and it worked perfectly the 1st time.Yesterday, I was 20 miles traveling on my WiFi Apple Tablet... and was able to turn on the power andthe camera appeared after a short boot up time...all automatically.  Excellent Quality.I live in Sprint, Texas and my daughter who lives in Huntsville, Texas was able to control the power supply andcamera.Excellent ValueCon:  It does not setup well with Windows 8.  Lucky, I still had my Windows 7 Desktop and set up was very easy.  I had to callCustomer Service for assistance.  They were also not setup to handle Windows 8 issues.  It was easy once I was able to see "setup" program.

Reviews.Title: We've tried other video monitors and this is by far the best
Reviews.Author: Smommy
Reviews.Content: We bought a video monitoring camera primarily to hear/watch our infant, and this product has been by far the best of several we have tried. In addition to Dropcam, we have an iBaby (complete waste of money), a Summer monitor (good, but lousy video quality), and the AngelCare monitor (great, but serves an entirely different purpose for us). The DropCam user interface on my desktop is great - intuitive and easy to use. Set-up was easy and my husband had it up and running in less than 10 mins. The video feed is great and we've watched our house from around the world with no problems. The sound and motion alerts are very accurate, and I love that I can look over the past week's history and go straight to movement events, rather than watch hours of video. Would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stesvis
Reviews.Content: it works really well, the quality of the video is very good and it comes with some interesting settings. the only issue i found is that it disconnects quite often, depending on where you install it...

Reviews.Title: Sweet camera
Reviews.Author: boyinkspot
Reviews.Content: So easy to install. So easy to view on my iPad and iPhone. Highly recommend this camera. I watch my baby all day long. She's very cute.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Michael Grasso
Reviews.Content: Great price, good quality, nice design.easy folding,delivered on time, above expectations, would buy another. Very easy to set up and install, easy to use

Reviews.Title: Dropcam does what it says it will and does it well
Reviews.Author: D. Long
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for new cameras to act as monitors for my two children.First, I first tried the Logitech 961-000391 Alert 750N Indoor Security Master System and Add-On Camera (Gray) - utter failure.  I am not technically tarded but the Logitech was a PITA.  It took me two hours to get one of the two cameras to work; most of that was figuring out that one of the cameras didn't work.  Once I did get the camera set up, it didn't matter because the lag time on mobile devices was between 20-30 seconds when I was in my own home and tied to my wifi.  I researched this lag issue further and it seems like it was common and the fix was to buy third-party software (Blue Iris).  Sad.So, I ordered the Dropcam.  I got home from work and set it up within five minutes - just in time for my boy to go to sleep.  This thing rocks! The lag is 2-3 seconds whether I'm in the house, on my commute, or at work.The picture is clear and the camera view is excellent. (I had a little hesitation not getting a camera with motorized Pan/Tilt functions but my worries were unfounded.)Night vision is great as long as you take off the protective film (I was in a rush the first night).The interface on mobile and web is clean and very user-friendly.  Don't hesitate - I've only had this setup for five days and I've already convinced some of my friends to buy one.

Reviews.Title: Fast easy setup
Reviews.Author: benchmark "Ben"
Reviews.Content: I bought Dropcam because of the easy setup, wireless hookups and the ability to monitor our home remotely. I was not into the complicated network "port forwarding" other systems required. Setup toook minutes and worked the first time. The mobile app on my smart phone works perfectly. A bit more expensive than other systems but worth the cost in convenience and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: KATERINA KRAMARCHUK
Reviews.Content: This product lives up to its description and some.  It is superior to a Lorex brand camera I tried out at the same time in both ease of installation, picture quality, sound quality (both ways) the wide field of view, Iphone Ap reliability, ease of monitoring from a regular PC.  Even in today’s day and age this product is impressive!  I use it as a nanny cam and used a TrendNet Camera prior to and cannot believe I did not research and find this product sooner!  Getting more for other rooms!  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: tim
Reviews.Content: Bought this a week ago. The first one that I ordered would not stay connected to my WiFi and finally just wouldn't connect at all. The box was damaged during shipping and Thank You to Amazon for have a replacement at my door in 24 hours!! The new one took 5 min to fully connect and is working fine. The APP is ok. Your still relying on you phones download speed ( not a dropcam issue ) but here is the cool part. Within the APP ( iOS or android ) you can set up location services i.e. you can tell the app to turn on the camera when you leave home and turn off when you get home. This is all done within the app and is automatic. Very cool. I will update this in a month.UPDATE AFTER 2 WEEKS:So have had the camera for 2 weeks and I really am happy with the purchase. Camera works great and the 9.99$ DVR service is worth it. Buy this camera! Best one on the market for the features and they have great customer service!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Great!!
Reviews.Author: Vincent Gayoso
Reviews.Content: Tried three cameras before this one.  Excellent video quality. The setup went as smooth as silk on my mac.  Audio is clear. Works great in no light as well.  App works like a champ.  GREAT JOB DROPCAM!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect baby monitor
Reviews.Author: LLGio
Reviews.Content: After buying and returning several baby monitors, we have dropcam a drive and it's perfect! We live in an old building and no monitors would work outside. So an Internet cam was needed, and this one is perfect. It's easy to setup, has only a 2 second delay, works great in the dark. And it's great for my parents 500 miles away to be able to log in and get a look at the baby!

Reviews.Title: Costs a little more and well worth it!
Reviews.Author: EZ writer "Curmudgeon"
Reviews.Content: One I got broadband at my new mountain house,  one of the first things I wanted was a webcam that I could view at any time from my home.  I especially wanted to know what the weather was at any given time.  Snow season can be tricky up there.Well, if you've looked around you know there are a lot of cheap webcams out there.  $65 to $90 will get you one that pans and tilts and zooms....but it won't get you a full time web server.  One of those cams is just the beginning of what you'll need to have a full time, on-line webcam that you can view....let alone share friends or family in other locations.Drop cam solves all of that in one very nice package.Plug it into your computer;  give it your network wi-fi information; unplug it.  Take it to where you want it to telecast from (indoors).  Plug it into an AC outlet via a USB/AC adapter and you are DONE!The camera comes with a very long cord,  so your mounting options are many....wall, ceiling, window sill (that where I mounted mine).  With an HD/720P picture and full screen capability,  you really get a great, detailed excellent color picture.All of the camera controls are fully functional remotely.  So I can sit at my house 200 miles away and zoom the camera, change from HD to SD picture, engage automatic night vision and lots more.Best of all, dropcam provides the web server where your camera's output resides.  There is  NO charge for it.  Set up your account and you have instant access to your webcam from wherever you are, and on nearly any mobile media you might be using:  iPad, computer, android, iphone etc.  You can send friends and relatives a link to your webcam and, if you want, you can make it accessible for public views by anyone.Best of all,  Dropcam provides the webserver that makes all this possible at NO charge.  It is literally Plug and Play with NO pay.If you get the impression I'm happy with this purchase,  you're right.  Do yourself a favor and skip all the hassle you're going to go thru trying to do it the cheaper way.  The dropcam is a bargain and a huge value.I've just ordered another!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy set up
Reviews.Author: Gary R. Cameron
Reviews.Content: Monitoring mom who is 94 and living at home. She has major memory problems.What a camera. Nice color, nice wide angle, good microphone pickup, high resolution,very easy to install for someone who knows nothing about IP addresses, etc.Free live video. Easy to look back in time if you pay for subscription. I do 7days and it helps to keep track of who comes and goes and whether or not mom is safe.I have 3 of these cameras now and three Dlinks d 932L. Much better to spend a little more for this camera. No comparison in quality and features.Update: three drop cameras on at one time caused too much data stream and would cause the picture to cut out as I have three D link cameras running on the same  net.I remotely reduced the two of the Dropcam so they no longer are high resolution and the problem was solved.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: D. Magruder
Reviews.Content: We got one to watch our puppy when we are away from home.  Great product.  It's super simple and easy to set-up.  The online, phone & ipad apps interface is straight forward.  Overall what a great product.  My only wish is that we could control it remotely to pan around up & down and side ways - that would be six stars!

Reviews.Title: Product delivers everything it promises
Reviews.Author: Beverly Griffin
Reviews.Content: Prompt delivery, easy setup (If I can do it anyone can) and a wonderful monitoring device for my new puppy.  I do not utilize the DVR feature.  It is a very nice option and if I was using the camera for security purposes I would definitely pay for the service.  I simply want to be able to check on my new puppy to ensure she is okay and the camera is perfect for the job showing me live video.  It even has night vision.  I am even considering getting a Dropcam to check on my elderly mother.  The two way audio would be perfect to communicate with her.  Check out the other cameras, then compare them to the dropcam.  I think you would be very satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Video Quality
Reviews.Author: Rahul
Reviews.Content: The video quality is extremely poor, although the setup was straightforward.I would think twice before spending on unbranded products.

Reviews.Title: horrible - always disconnects
Reviews.Author: tom
Reviews.Content: this device always disconnects.  it is useless as a remote camera for a second home (which is the way i am using this).

Reviews.Title: COULD NOT GET ANY SUPPORT AFTER 1 WEEK OF TRYING
Reviews.Author: mk2006
Reviews.Content: the camera worked for about a week ... now that is not working it is impossible to get any support.  I called them about 10 times and left messages I also emailed them 4 times ... enough trying I am returning it

Reviews.Title: For baby room
Reviews.Author: Keri
Reviews.Content: Purchased to watch baby in his crib. We use a separate sound only monitor at night and check the app if needed. The video monitoring is not perfect, but better than any other baby camera I've used. Love the convenience of the app.  Picture is always clear, but video is unavailable at times. During the free trial DVR period, it seemed like 1/4 of the time the video was not loading and we considered returning the camera. However, since the dvr trial is over and it is just live video, it almost always works and the maybe 5% of the time not working, it loads within a few minutes. The instructions say microwave and garage door usage (and other things) could interfere and I think that is our problem. Because we found the camera during video recording to be unreliable, I would not use it for security purposes, but highly recommend for use as a baby or other live monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Horrible support
Reviews.Author: paperboy98
Reviews.Content: When the cameras work, they are good to have.  However, if you need phone support, just forget it.  They are never available.  After holding for several minutes, you get a recorded voice that says nobody is available, so leave a message or email them.  I have two of these and am thinking of returning them due to lack of customer support.

Reviews.Title: Gives Peace of Mind
Reviews.Author: Jammer
Reviews.Content: After recently being robbed, I decided to purchase a surveillance camera.  Note to Dropcam: your support responsiveness both online to customers and direct is one of the main reasons I purchased your product.Set up as stated - less than 60 seconds!I have placed it against an indoor window facing my front porch with the status light off. Fortunately I have lighting on my front porch because the Night Vision does not seem to work through double or single pane windows. You get a reflection that distorts the image, from my research this is common with most night vision cameras.My Upload is  >2.5  Mbps (and 25 Mpbs Download) and I have not noticed any negative effect on my usual internet access. However, even with the bandwidth and proximity of being a few feet from my Airport Extreme, I still get a ~3-5 second delay in Live View.It has "lost" connection a couple of times and ir require unplugging and plugging it back in. It would be nice if it could reboot itself after a certain amount of time. I would be disappointed if this happened whilst I was on vacation.The motion detection is too sensitive, any car passing by on my street, sets off a notification, so I have had to turn notifications off. However, when I go on vacation, I will simply unplug it and face it indoors in my hallway and set notifications back on.It would be simpler and more intuitive if you could simply zoom into a quadrant via gestures or mouse click directly on the viewing window rather than opening up a settings screen.iPad version is awesome, knowing that I can monitor additional cameras will likely have me purchasing another one.

Reviews.Title: Product doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Paul Giroux
Reviews.Content: Setup would not detect available wi-fi networks.  Repeated setup several times with same result then started receiving error messages that the camera cord had been disconnected from the computer (which it hadn't).  I tried calling DropCam support several times - to be first put on hold, then a recording saying no customer service agents are available.Terrible product!

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great
Reviews.Author: Baby Dady
Reviews.Content: We bought the drop cam with the intention of using it as a baby monitor for our son. We loved the idea of being able to check on him even when we were away and had a baby sitter. Despite our excitement, we were a little disappointed in the connectivity with the camera. We have great Wifi in our home, and both my wife and I have the new Iphone 5 so we were very surprised with this issuse. The live feed would cut out when were we out and about on the 4G, as well as when we were at home on the Wifi in the room right next to our son's nursery.

Reviews.Title: Good product from Amazon, delivered right on tme.
Reviews.Author: Pal Sal
Reviews.Content: I bought two Drop Cams. If you're worried about installing the Drop Cam, DON'T!! Very easy to install with a wi-fi Router. It connected immediately. At first one would go off and on. but I simply had to move the location slightly (to get a stronger signal) and it worked fine. The night time viewing (no lights)was a little too dark but otherwise it was very good. Left the house and went on my lap top and there was my living room on the screen. Real piece of mind. If you want to record what you are seeing, you have to pay for that service. It was worth the price for what I needed.That was my first impression, however, I left for Florida and two days later I lost the connection to one of the cameras and continued having trouble for the next two months.  At times I would receive a signal that was frozen so I was watching a scene that happened hours earlier. On numerous occasions I was unable to zoom in. Support was unable to help me unless I was at home which was not possible. I will look elsewhere for a surveillance cameras.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam HD a disappointment
Reviews.Author: Ryan Nelson
Reviews.Content: I was able to set up the Dropcam HD to my base wireless router fairly quickly as advertised. However, I found the range of the camera to be quite disappointing (basically it worked within a one room range of the router ... which is totally unacceptable).I bought a wireless range extender and then learned that the Dropcam HD doesn't operate with range extenders. Here's the response from Dropcam support that I received:Hi there,Thank you for contacting Dropcam Support!A Wi-Fi range extender actually won't work in most cases the reason being that Dropcam HD requires a DHCP capable connection and most extenders do not put out DHCP.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Minus NightViewing
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Dropcam is a great camera if your just wanting to check in and receive alerts, but if you want alerts your going to have to fork over a good chunk of money to Dropcam. Also if you want to see at night with these good luck, can't see very far unless there is some type of light on. All in all pretty good experience though. Supppppeeeerrr Easy set up anyone could do it.

Reviews.Title: Great Webcam
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Weiss
Reviews.Content: Great webcam. Works great all of the time with one exception- and this is a big deal- it is a bandwidth hog. Realistically you need at least a download speed of 7MB + and an upload speed of 1MB + to effectively use anything else on your home network.  Could this device be used as a whole home security system? Not unless you have FiOS or faster. If it didn't hog all of the bandwidth it would have received 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Lower quality than previous version
Reviews.Author: Laurette Burgess
Reviews.Content: We bought a dropcam a few years back and we love it. The resolution and picture quality are fantastic. We decided to buy a second dropcam when they lowered the price and added two way sound. We hate the new camera. Yes, it was about 100.00 cheaper than our first camera but the picture quality is awful. The picture is dark and fuzzy, not at all the quality of our first dropcam. We inquired with the company and they said something about a software upgrade coming, but still no improvement.  They should go back to the better quality, I would pay the extra money.  The one is pretty much useless.

Reviews.Title: Not useful as baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Sarahkay42
Reviews.Content: It looks like we will be returning this camera. At night we can barely see our children in bed. We have another camera in the room and we see very good detail with that one. We expected the same level of quality from a more expensive camera with HD in the title. I think ours may be defective, but due to the poor customer service it seems our only option is to return the camera. It has been a full seven days since I opened my support ticket. We did get a response suggesting that our bandwidth was insufficient, and another suggesting I unplug it for 5 minutes. Ok, we have sufficient bandwidth and have unplugged it, but I still can't tell if my kids are in their beds. Is this the normal night vision quality?

Reviews.Title: using as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: MAyor
Reviews.Content: At first, I was going to buy the summer infant baby monitor which is about $210. I was thinking 'what the heck. $210 is way too overpriced. Those cameras seem target to parents who are not computer savy. $210 I can get more with an internet monitor". Thus, I did some research and end up buying this Dropcam. To be honest, it does not has the best graphic quality. I don't think it is really HD even it claims it is. However, I still pick this over logitech camera because:1) EASIEST TO SET UP! You basically can use the camera within like 30 secs. It is really plug-n-play. Just make sure you plug the power outlet to the wall and not to a surge protection or extension.2) It has two way audio, night vision, and internet access (which other brands may charge you more with these options).3) It is FREE to view real-time on Dropcam.com. If you want to record and download the clip..you will need to pay $9.99 per month. I do not see it is necessary as this is only for my baby monitoring purpose. Logitech charges you somewhere like $80 to use its software.4) I can now use Kindle Fire, Andriod phones, and any PC to view my baby. I share with my parents so they can see my baby remotely at their house 24/7. They LOVE this!Some disadvantages:1) It tends to have 3 to 4 seconds lag even it is real time on Andriod phone. Kindle fire has 10 sec lag time! However, I am using this as a baby monitor. So, I can live with this.2) Logitech camera has much better HD quality than this. But you will need to pay the premium. Since I put my Dropcam very close to my baby, I am still fine to see his face.3) Dropcam has fine iphone app but need improvement on its Andriod App (which only allow you to view but not 2-way audio or zoom). You need to open an internet exploer and log in to Dropcam.com in order to do 2-way audio or zoom or record.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, quality reasonable
Reviews.Author: Mike J.
Reviews.Content: After using the dropcam for the last few days, I am pretty happy with the experience.  I am a bit disappointed in the quality, there are quite a few compression artifacts and I have had several videos where you can't see peoples faces due to the compression.  I would also like to see some zooming options in the iOS client.I am currently on the free 2 week plus trial and I like the service, I have to decide if the high monthly cost is worth investing in (especially if I get a few more cameras).I could easily give this 5 stars if the compression/video quality was improved.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Matt Stone "Matt Stone"
Reviews.Content: My problem with this product is that it has a really, really bad WiFi receiver. What shows up as 5 bars on my laptop, phone and tablet will flick on and off 1-bar (mostly off) on the dropcam. The first week I contacted their support and was told that it was likely due to interference from other electrical items like the microwave or from other WiFi enabled devices. I have shared WiFi in my building and the landlord won't allow me to mess around with the router. Other tenants have strong WiFi signal (as I do for all other enabled products). Was hoping it would be fixed with a firmware update, but nope. Still a piece of _____!

Reviews.Title: Not for every device
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine: the image is good, there’s a little lag (just a few seconds) and their cloud based solution (that means easy set up and no funny applications in your PC) is neat. My problem is that I believed in the promise of access from “any device” and it is not true: if you have a browser on a device that does not a accept plugin – like Windows Phone or Xbox – you can’t see it. And that’s a bummer because I love my phone. Dropcam also doesn’t disclose any information for you to set up access from a 3rd party app, they really want to lock you on their system to sell you their DVR service. Here’s my summary:The good:• Image quality• Easy set upThe bad:• No HTML5 for modern browsers (they still require flash)• No app for Windows Phone• DRV is a subscription model (not necessarily a bad thing, but be advised you will be locked with them for the future)

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup, but so-so performance
Reviews.Author: Busy Executive
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for some small monitoring cameras that I can leave at my vacation home when it's unattended, and the Dropcam seemed like one of the better options. It's small, easy to power and requires no PC or appliance, instead recording video to a cloud service provided by the vendor.On the positive side, this is one of the easier products of its type to install and configure. You connect the cable to your PC, a configuration program starts, you enter your WiFi information and you're done. Really simple, and I'm sure just about anyone can succeed here - no technical skills needed.There's also a mobile app that gives you live view for free, and if you're willing to pay for it, there's a cloud-based DVR that records your video. The device comes with a two-week trial for the cloud DVR service, so you can get a sense of whether it's worth the money.Image quality is good in bright light - less good in dim or high contrast (that is, mix of bright and dim). It may be HD in the sense that it's 720p, but the video stream is so compressed, there's quite a bit of pixelation and muddiness, to the extent that you sometimes can't even tell who you are looking at from ten feet away. Motion is also somewhat jerky and the images tend to be somewhat blurry if there's lots of motion.Still, this is a great device for, say, baby monitoring or keeping track of when the kids get home. There are a few limitations, however.For one, you can't program in multiple WiFi networks, so if you're like me and you have multiple SSIDs where you want to use the device, you need to plug it into a PC to reconfigure and time you move between networks.Second, the device stand is fairly large and cumbersome given the size of the camera. Yes, you can remove the camera itself and find a way to mount it without the stand - but with the stand (as pictured in the product description), it's a bit too large to be unobtrusive. For example, although I have wide windowsills, the base of the camera is a bit too wide to sit on one of them.Also, the camera itself is not weather sealed and so it's pretty useless for outdoor monitoring. You really can't, for example, park it looking outside a window - the night vision simply reflects off the glass, giving you glare instead of clear outdoor pictures. It's very much an indoor only solution.I have mixed thoughts about the cloud recording approach you get with Dropcam. While the live viewing is free and easy to use from a mobile device, recording is expensive and error-prone, and you're locked into the Dropcam service. I suppose I'd pay $99/year for it if it worked reliably, but I'm not so sure this is the case. Although it advertises it keeps the last seven days of video online, my experience is that you get way less than 50% coverage within that seven day period.The cloud recording approach Dropcam uses is also dependent on lots of bandwidth. I have Verizon FiOS 50mb service - generally screams, but I still couldn't get reliable cloud recording with this device. When I go back and look at the recorded video stream, there are too many "No recording available" segments. As other reviewers mention, you will definitely need to be careful if you're on an Internet plan that limits your monthly usage. Plus, it's hard for me to imagine getting good results with multiple cameras on a single network.Unlike some other cameras that support various network and device standards, there's no way to simply run some PoE network cables to these devices and control them with your own choice of software. You're pretty much locked in to the vendor's apps and network services.There's also flaws in the motion detection software.Another vendor I tried was able to sent me an alert exactly as motion was detected - I could see the person triggering the event, and I really wouldn't have to search through the video stream to figure out what was going on.Not so with the Dropcam. In the first few weeks I owned it, I've had perhaps 100 motion alerts, and exactly zero have depicted the actual person or object triggering the alert. In most cases, because of the holes in the recording, it's rare to find the cause of the alert by reviewing the video stream online. I find this to be very frustrating: you get an alert that the camera detected motion, but you're not able to see what the camera saw.Bottom line is that the Dropcam offers great packaging, simple setup and a good solution for live viewing an indoor object, so long as you have lots of bandwidth. If this is what you're looking for, then it's worth a try.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera Just Shy of Incredible
Reviews.Author: Sven Rafferty "SvenOnTech.com"
Reviews.Content: Trying to find the right camera for watching my sleeping baby or insure my home office is secure is no easy task.  You are left most of the time either with either excellent video quality and an impossible to set-up network configuration or just the opposite.  Try to add iPhone (or other smartphone device) for monitoring and you've just made your hunt nearly maddening.  Thankfully, Dropcam made a remote camera I was looking for...and possibly you.The first things that impressed me about this Dropcam was it's price, video quality, and iPhone app.  Based on the reviews and TWiT networks stamp of approval, I purchased one to give it a try.  I wasn't disappointed upon delivery.  The packaging is nicely organized and looks sharp.  It was easy to removed the camera and USB cable.  I quickly plugged it into my Mac and opened the USB drive image and was immediately configuring the camera in three easy steps.  In less than a minute, my camera was configured and ready to stream to the Internet.I moved the camera to the baby's room and positioned it pointing down in a very low angle.  The base held its ground and the camera didn't fall over.  Nice.  I then took out my iPhone, opened the earlier installed Dropcam app, and quickly logged into my camera.  In seconds, I had it perfectly positioned and left the room.  The test came when my wife put the baby down to sleep.We opened the app and took a peek at what was happening.  The video clearly showed our 10-month-old not happy with his nap time and the audio prefectly transmitted his cries.  Both video and audio were sharp and accurate.  He finally gave up his protest and fell asleep.  We watched for a few minutes and then closed the app.  Both my wife and I kept checking on him from within our home network and later my wife while at the store without ever having to make an adjustment to the Dropcam app.  A little over and hour later, we both received an alert message on our iPhones that movement was detected.  I opened my iPhone and there was my little boy sitting up, in a fresh awaken daze.  My wife went to get him out of his pen before he began crying to notify us that his nap was done like he previously would.  Now, we know before he knows we know. :)So why did I entitled this being shy of incredible?  Well, there are a few quirks that need to be resolved.  First, the zoom on the iPhone is very kludgy.  You must go into the Settings and then select a section (bottom left, center, top right, etc) to zoom into.  There is no way to zoom while viewing the video like you can from the website.  Second, when you use the built-in speaker to talk through the camera, you lose audio.  There is no two-way communication.  Third, and it's less than a quirk and more a complaint, is that the DVR feature is pricey.  You have three option: Live streaming only for free; seven-days of video per month for $9.95, or 30-days for $29.95.  That's over $300 a year per camera if you desire to use this for security reasons.  Ouch.  One other cavet is bandwidth consumption.  Most ISPs now cap your total usage and this camera will quickly get you closer to that cap.  Add a couple or handful to the mix and you'll be looking for another provider.That said, I love this camera and will be purchasing another one if not a few more.  It comes with a mount so I can easily snap the camera onto the ceiling or move it elsewhere at will.  Because it uses Micro-USB for power, you can pretty much power this anywhere with a simple adapter including from your car! (Road trips can become interesting if you're hotspot has a great plan.)Sleek looking, easy to configure, solid mounting options, and dream-like access from any internet enabled device, Dropcam is now pretty much my only remote camera.

Reviews.Title: OK engineering, lousy business model
Reviews.Author: Maynard Handley
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I'm disappointed by many aspects of this product, too many to recommend it.On the engineering side, my primary complaint is that it runs hot. Running hot was OK in consumer electronics of ten years ago, it is not OK in 2013. We have a world where companies like Intel, ARM, Apple, Samsung, or Microsoft are all working hard every day to reduce power consumption and excess heat. Then we have a company like Dropcam, who apparently feel they don't have to be part of this trend, they can slap together whatever random (cheap) electronics they can find, and if the result runs hot and wastes power, well it's not their problem.On the business side, you have to be aware that Dropcam are not interested in selling you a camera, they are interested in selling you an ongoing subscription (costing at least $99 a year) to their service. They have done everything they can to ensure that this product is useless without that service. So, for example, their appears to be no way (at least on a Mac) to register the device as a standard camera and run your own software which utilizes it. If you complain, I'm sure Dropcam will cry copiously about the expensive cost of running servers, and how they are losing money storing your video at "only" $99 a year. What they will not point out is that they give you NO CHOICE in this matter.On the combined engineering + business incompetence side, a byproduct of lousy engineering and the hostile business model is that they do no motion detection on the camera (and, of course, provide no way to delegate this task to one of the computers in your household). Which means that the camera is, every minute of every day, clogging up your WiFi connection and then your internet connection, sending out its stream to their servers. Just like energy efficiency, the attitude appears to be "why should we care about efficiency --- you're the one who has to live with the consequences".The crazy thing, of course, is that the camera obviously has to have motion compensation hardware in its video compression chip --- and it should be trivial to hook up that motion comp cell to report motion detection when the motion comp energy across a frame exceeds a threshold. With just the slightest concern for creating a quality product, they could have simultaneously somewhat reduced power consumption and substantially reduced bandwidth consumption, all using hardware that already exists in the camera!Unfortunately that's the problem with new companies. You often can't tell until after you buy if they're populated primarily by engineers, proud of the job they've done and anxious to do even better, or by MBA/marketing types who don't give a damn about quality as long as they have your money. Of course, sadly, you CAN tell once you have paid...One final thing should be added. An earlier version of my review complained about the lack of use of push notifications and geofencing on iPhones.Both of these features DO in fact exist, but Dropcam does not go out of their way to tell you about them or to make their use obvious. Should you want to use them, the best solution appears to be to run a google search for the feature of interest.

Reviews.Title: Good camera Horrible support
Reviews.Author: J. Tambascio "johnt1000"
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for home monitoring. I had a problem with mine. 800 line always went to voice mail  email took multiple days to get answered.

Reviews.Title: Bought For Use As Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: S. Melder "aka I Heart Monster"
Reviews.Content: Baby hasn't arrived yet, but I hooked this sucker up the day it came.  I really really like it.Things I love about it:1. The black camera part comes right out of the silver metal mount, no problem.2. There's a microphone and a speaker both in a really small package.3. It does both infrared at night and color during the day.4. My husband who works out of state can talk to me on it from his phone... which is awesome because that means he can talk to the baby while watching the baby online while he's away.5. I will buy the $99 monitoring package for the year once the baby comes, but there's no need to have that beforehand.6. The Android app alerts me when there's either movement or sound and the sound sensitivity can be adjusted if you live in a noisy neighborhood or really quiet one. (we live across the street from a park, so I turned the sensitivity down so that it doesn't pick up the soccer team or the mail man).7. During the free trial period, I played with the clips of recorded video and sharing those, and it was easy peasy, I was really happy with that.8. I can give access to out-of-state relatives who want to see the baby for a day or whatever so that they can see, but can then take away access when I want the privacy, and the UI is all really user-friendly.9. Some reviews warned about how it eats up all of their bandwidth or something like that, but I haven't seen any slow down at all and I upload and stream video a lot.  (I pretty much stream video all day long)  I have cable internet and the medium tier of service with an average upload speed of 3/MBps and download of 19.5/MBps)Basically, it's everything I expected, everything I wanted, and it was an awesome awesome price (black friday $50 off!) I'm considering getting another for use as a security video camera.  It's a lot cheaper than paying someone offsite to monitor video for you.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Eden
Reviews.Content: To use this camera you'd have to set up an account with dropcam and you don't really have the freedom of using the cam as a stand-alone unit (independent from dropcam.com). In other words, you don't have complete control of your camera. Plus, if you want to see past video (recorded video), you would have to pay extra (~$10 per month)!  This camera does not provide the option of feeding the video directly to your OWN DVR locally or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Does not work!
Reviews.Author: Entrepreneur "Entrepreneur"
Reviews.Content: Just arrived. Followed the setup (which is easy). Keep receiving the following error. Can't solve it. No answers on the Dropcam website. Will return it."This Dropcam has encountered an error. Please reconnect the camera and begin the setup process again."

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera except for one VERY important problem
Reviews.Author: kevin "Old HP Guy"
Reviews.Content: I have owned two dropcams for approximately eight months now. My Brother also owns three dropcams. So this is the deal with dropcams: First of all, they are very high quality cameras for home security. The HD resolution has set a new benchmark in this area of home and/or business security. The camera setup is very easy and once you have completed it you can forever disconnect the camera from your computer because each individual dropcam will now "recognize" your broadband router. This is a huge advantage over other systems because you no longer have to keep your computer running 24/7 and the power consumption of each camera is quite minimal. The cameras run off of a USB power cube typical of the iPhone variety. The power cord is long enough that for most positioning applications there should not be a problem. My Brother runs two of his cams with extension cords due to the distance from the power source. He has not reported any problems with this setup. So overall, the setup procedure could not be easier. After a very short screen setup procedure, the average time from box to operation takes about ten minutes. In the eight months of continuous operation my two dropcams have not had any major issues as far as picture quality, night vision capabilities or sound quality. The motion detection capabilities and time bar marker have worked perfectly and have been quite handy in checking back to review video clips. My Brother and I both subscribe to the remote "cloud service" offered by dropcam. This gives you a continuous seven day loop of all video captured by your cams. Now for the only complaint I have about the dropcam: You absolutely MUST have a VERY STRONG broadband signal in your home or business to ensure continuous and consistant operation of these cameras. Of the five cameras we have in different towns the same problem occured numerous times. The cameras will NOT work properly if your router is not putting out a strong signal and is in CLOSE proximity to the actual cameras. It took us both a couple of weeks to figure out why the cameras broadcast signal kept dropping out. The issue seems to be with the cameras inability to capture a marginal router signal. Where other electronic items such as phones, ipads and laptop computers have no problem capturing the exact same signal strength, the dropcams just can't recieve it for some reason. At first I thought I may have a defective camera but all five of our dropcams have the same issue and all five are in completely different settings using different brands of routers. We finally solved the issue by purchasing new top of the line "N" routers and positioning the routers so that there was no more than a thirty foot distance between the router and cams. This completely solved the issue and aside from some momentary signal dropoffs from time to time we have had excellent service from these cams. So overall I am giving dropcam four stars. It has solved all our home security issues. They are available for viewing on our Iphones, Ipads and all home computers instantly from anywhere. The video quality is excellent and once correctly set up have proved to be very usefull.

Reviews.Title: Internet Based Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Stuart H. Warren "Reader1"
Reviews.Content: I received this product yesterday and found several issues.First, it works and is easy to set up. It is wireless, once you get it "configured" and authenticated on your WiFi router.It can't do ANYTHING without the internet. There is NO internal buffering in the event that it can't get to the internet...So, as far as security, get a $30 WIFI jammer and no video recorded...It takes a lot of bandwidth to run when the resolution is at its highest. If you want to use it as a babycam, with the camera in the other room, the video leaves the camera, goes out into the cloud where it is recorded and then you can see it. So you hear the baby crying a good 15 seconds through the wall before the computer.. Also, since you're using 2x the internet bandwidth, forget anyone else using netflix, hulu or VuDu to stream video.No way to set up triplines (zones that cause recording)No way to have it do motion detection without telling you every time it sees motion. If you turn off motion detection alerts, you also turn off the detection capability, and the web site does not show when there was motion. There is a big difference between detection  and alerts. In their simplification, they have bundled it on a single on/off button.No local storage in the event that there is internet congestion. The Mobotix is a much superior camera since it has local storage and can also send it offsite. (I know it costs 5x the cost but it works, except Mobotix has to heater...). it should at least have some local storage and cache the video in the event of an internet outage or problem.The big metal base is OK, except if you want it looking out the window, since the base is circular and the mount pivot is in the center of the base, it sets well away from the window and interferes with drapes, blinds, etc. There should be a way to mount it to the window glass (small cylinder of plastic with a flat flange and double stick tape) Stick the mount to the window and snap in the camera. I guess I could double stick tape the base to the window and fold the camera flat for a minimal depth mounting.Due to the bandwidth needed, we stepped the resolution down to the non-HD level and it still looks decent and doesn't hog the internet connection. There should be a setting that compares the average of 5 frames and unless there is a 5% or something configurable different, then skip recording the same image to the internet. To bolster that, add a circular queue and allow the system to back track 10 seconds before the motion event for no-loss recording.There should be some method of connecting locally to view the camera and there isn't. Apparently the video is encrypted leaving the camera and can't be decrypted unless it goes through their website. Why not use the same code as a java script download to view it locally?I had planned to use several but now think a more traditional camera would be better suited for our purposes. By the time you buy more than 2 of these cameras, and the annual DVR costs, you're in the same price range of many wired camera systems with local storage and internet access.If you have lots of internet bandwidth and it's rock solid, then you're probably OK with this product.

Reviews.Title: dropcam is the perfect name.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It (actually both of them that I bought) continuously dropped off the network.Support was slow to non-existent so they went back.When they did work video quality was good, but they didn't work well enough.

Reviews.Title: Not going to work for me
Reviews.Author: Wildlife Watcher
Reviews.Content: Dropcam definitely has an easy setup, but if you have other wireless devices in your home either the dropcam wont work or your other wireless devices wont work. Even with ONLY our wireless bluray player on, that uses the Amazon Instant Video service, it would stop streaming the movie when we plug in the Dropcam. I never could get an HD picture. The interface is very basic as others have said. If you wish to zoom in you have to go into settings and your allowed to choose upper right, upper left, lower right or lower left as options and then the camera will be zoomed in on that area which I didn't really care for. If I was at the store which is a five minute drive from our house and went into settings I could reconnect with the server for some reason, when I was receiving video prior to entering settings. I think under the right circumstances this might be a great camera for someone but in our case it has to be returned.

Reviews.Title: Who's there? Darn birds/rabbits/clouds/???.
Reviews.Author: Wackadoo
Reviews.Content: I bought this to monitor my front door and record/alert when somebody was at the door. I wanted to go back in the DVR to see who was there when I was sleeping (I work nights) and when I didn't feel like going to the door to see who was there (letting them know I was home).Positioning & false Motion Alerts:It's easily positionable to catch my porch area, however the camera doesn't have a feature to "ignore" certain portions of the captured image so as to not always send the constant and numerous false Motion Alerts that I was getting due to traffic on the road/sidewalk. I haven't played with the digital zoom feature to see if that would work to exclude those portions because the image from a CCD of this size is already grainy enough (although the image quality is generally OK). Also, I was getting constant false Motion Alerts due to birds, rabbits, and the occasional cloud shadow moving across the front yard. There were even times when a Motion Alert would come across, and try as I might I couldn't see a darn thing that caused it. For this kind of application, the DVR and Motion Alerts are of limited use.Night Vision:In order to catch the front porch through a window, since the camera is not rated for outdoor usage, the night vision IR emitters are conveniently reflected off the window. Modern windows are designed to keep that type of energy in. This turns the window at night into a mirror, making it absolutely impossible to see anything outside with the IR night vision turned on. With the porch light on, the camera works ok for the immediate vicinity that the light reaches. With the light from street lamps, the camera can barely see shadows and faint images but not any detail worth using to identify people. Once again, for this kind of application the camera has limited utility.The iPhone app works pretty good. Since nearly all of us have our phones on our person/within reach, when I'm home it's nice to take a peak to see who's at the door. When I'm away the app ultimately has limited utility since all the extraneous Motion Alerts at the front door forced me to disable that feature.Where it might work better:As a nanny cam or as an indoor security camera this camera would work ok. It isn't a large camera, but it isn't small either so placing it in a discreet location would work OK in some cases. If you have pets/children the Motion Alert would have very limited applicability. It would work great as a baby monitor and if you used the Motion Alert feature it may even let you know when little Timmy/Tammy was awake. The cloud-based DVR feature, being a for-fee service at $9/month for a single camera ($4.95 for each additional), would have to be something you really need in order to get any benefit from it. For a parent/family the iPhone app would have a few helpful uses I'm sure.Overall for me, this isn't the best solution. If it was outdoor rated or had a protective non reflective bubble to encase it in to protect it from the weather it would be more useful. Also, if I could crop the motion sensing feature to exclude certain parts of the image and decrease the sensitivity of the motion sensing it would work better for me. Since I've already paid $149 for it though I can't very easily drop this cam for something else (pun intended).

Reviews.Author: Mike Mu "tech consultant"

Reviews.Title: Awesome with a few caveats
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this along with our first child, setup really did take all of 60 secs.My Husband is a IT Engineer and vetted the security and technical details.It was very easy to share out to my family so they could watch and they had their own accounts so they didn't have control of ours.Picture and sound quality are great both in the night and day modes, the day mode can be especially good looking when it has a good connection (more on that in a moment.) Sound pickup is excellent a small toot is easily heard.Regarding those that complain about bandwidth usage, just turn it off occasionally (you can do this from the smart phone apps or the pc website, or pull the power to the unit) and your bandwidth usage will drop dramatically.The only downsides we have found is the 2 way voice is finicky, and when combined with the 1-5 sec delay the camera seems to have it can be hard to have a real conversation over the camera. there is also no off switch you either pull the plug or it is on.Our dropcam does have some connection issues where it will freeze for a second or two, it does it maybe once an hour. But since our wireless router is 3 stories down and we have half a dozen + devices on it at any given time we are about the worst case scenario for a wireless connection. My husband said he will work to boost the signal and see if that is indeed the issue, we'll update our review later on.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kyzrsoce
Reviews.Content: Easy to set-up.  My wife who thinks the computer is a "magic box" set these up in just a few minutes.AMAZON -- Ok this is where I had issues.  I purchased one.  It worked great.  So I bought two more.  Effin Amazon sent me two open and obviously used cameras (already been logged onto) that I couldn't access.  BullPoop.  This is my first bad experience with Amazon.  I have put them on probation for now - we'll see how that goes

Reviews.Title: Peace of mind and great entertainment for "retirement-age" adults
Reviews.Author: descendent of Bill Wilson "Jakov Alltrades"
Reviews.Content: Our elderly parents spend time in southern climates during the winter and always fret about their house in the frozen north. When the Dropcam arrived they unboxed it, installed the app on their iPhones, and then got confused. I came to the rescue and performed the super easy and simple installation. Since then, the Dropcam has become even more dependable entertainment than their favorite cable news channel. That is a feat! Sitting in a doctor's waiting room, sitting at home, visiting with friends at the park, it seems to come up many times each day: "Hey, let's take a look inside the house.  Yep, everything's right where we left it!  See that, you can even zoom in on the couch pillow there…" etc, etc.Thank you Dropcam for giving all of us a clear view of the family homestead, day and night.Now we are saving to budget one for our house too! By summer we'll be there and given the unfortunate increase in crime in our area lately, it will be none too soon. Hopefully none of us will ever need it, but when it's there it just works!

Reviews.Title: These Are Affordable and Work Great
Reviews.Author: Thomas O'Brien
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to look after a family member who has dementia. It really gave me the freedom to be away and still be able to check in from time to time to make sure things hadn't gone awry. Now that family member is in a nursing facility, but I still use the cameras as part of an overall home security system. I can now check in on the cat when I'm away, and on more than one occasion, I was able to avert a 911 call by the security company when their equipment sent a false alarm because I was able to surveil the house and confirm that no one had broken into my home.The reason I bought this camera over the competition was because I could speak to the person in the room that I was viewing through the camera. The camera also has a very wide angle lens, which gives a panoramic view of the rooms. These are fantastic features.I have recommended this product to numerous friends.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Dropcam!
Reviews.Author: Marge Kudlewski
Reviews.Content: We sure do love the new Dropcam that we bought. We can check our property anytime of the day or night and whenever we get an alert on the iphone to see what triggered it! It is also great when we are miles away on vacation. We were very surprised as to how well the nightvision feature works! The two way sound is also exceptional

Reviews.Title: Set up can be a pain, but delivers what it promises
Reviews.Author: Craig Gunderson
Reviews.Content: Yes, this camera is tied to the service.  No, you don't have to pay for it unless you want to record.What they don't tell you:  Set-up must be done on a computer on which you have admin rights.  I was on the phone with support trying to do the set-up using my work computer and it wouldn't happen.  Do the set-up on your personal computer.My biggest gripe - the camera does not retain your wi-fi settings.  If you take the cam to a different network, you have to do the set-up again for that network.  And then when you bring it back home, yep, do it again.  We bring the camera to our friends' house to see what the dogs do when no one is watching.  "Um hey, can I use your computer to set this up?  AGAIN?"  I really wish that once you set it up, it remembers and recognizes that you've set up on that network once before.And five minutes?  I don't think so.One more gripe - the micro USB connector.  The female port is shaped in a way that it is nearly impossible to tell which edge is round and which is flat.  It takes a lot of trial and error to connect.  It's also very awkward to connect it when the cam is in the stand.  I almost always end up removing the cam from the stand, jerking around with which way the connector fits, and then putting it back in the stand.  That alone is your five minute set up.Once the camera is set up, it performs very well.

Reviews.Title: Sensitivity is an issue - storage plans expensive
Reviews.Author: Horatio Magellan
Reviews.Content: While I agree that this camera is incredibly easy to install and then manage/monitor remotely, the sensitivity threshold to detect and send alerts regarding registered motion is so low, it renders the alert feature somewhat useless.  I have my camera pointed indoors in an office and the very slow moving shadow created by the light passing through the window as the sun sets will trigger half a dozen alerts in the evening .  I can't imagine using the motion alert if the camera is pointed outdoors, where the slightest move of the leafs on a tree is going to trigger an alert.  There is no way to adjust this setting (ignore a quick movements of small objects (e.g. leafs) but register movements of larger objects (e.g. delivery truck)). Hopefully this is a SW feature that will eventually be updated.  Until then, the number of false positive alerts has me ignoring the camera's emails, which kind of defies the purpose.  I also wish they'd offer a cheaper plan where you store the video for s a shorter period than the one week ($99/year) or one month ($300/year).  The camera will send you a photo when it detects movement, but in my case, that often is simply the door of my office being opened.  Unless I can access the historical video, I won't know WHO walked in after the door was opened.  If there was a one day plan for $15/year, I'd totally go for it. I also think that they could offer one hour storage plan for free.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is a 10.  Wireless range is a big fat zero.
Reviews.Author: Brett England
Reviews.Content: Dropcam would be a great product if it could pick up a descent wireless connection.  It can't.  If your dropcam isn't located in the same room AND within direct sight of your wireless router you will not be able to connect these cameras to the internet.  My first attempt to setup the camera failed.  I was only 20 feet from my router, but there was a wall between the camera and the router.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup, does its job
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "crmaimon"
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set up, and video quality is pretty good.  I liked that it has motion/activity alerts, but found that getting these to be useful, and not a nuisance, will require some input and training.
