Out of the box, the camera picked up and sent me motion alerts every time the camera could see, through closed semi-transparent curtains, a car drive by the front window of my house.  You can, however, teach the software that all of these events are of a particular type that can be ignored.  I wanted a camera that would allow me to look in on the house when I'm away for a few days and alert me to motion.  Overall, I still think this was a good purchase for that purpose.  I only plan to use it for a few days a few times a year.

Reviews.Title: Not for use as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: SunShine
Reviews.Content: We have had fun with our Dropcam. Especially so my husband can check in on the baby from work. But it does not work as a sole baby monitor because of several issues. One main issue is the interference on this thing is just terrible. It also loses connection to Wi-Fi all the time for some reason. There is also an annoying orange flashing light that goes on that I worry will distract the baby. There is also a lag which can be awkward when the baby is crying and you can hear them and then the monitor repeats it. The real issue however that makes it's not possible as a baby monitor is the software on your phone does not allow you to use other apps on your phone while listening to the baby. This means you have to log out of watching or listening to the baby to use your phone an any way. The good news is the picture is excellent. It would not connect to Wi-Fi at first but after restarting it a couple times I was able to connect and set up was fairly easy. In summary I give it four stars as I camera, two stars as a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Excellent resolution. Just wish I could save video locally.
Reviews.Author: Y2K Heretic
Reviews.Content: Excellent resolution. Just wish I could save video locally. It's frustrating that so many web cams require a subscription to save video. This kind of wring the last red cent out of customers is why so many consumers go to the cut-rate all Chinese manufacturers. I have no pity for American corporations who cut their own throats this way. They sure's heck have none for me.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: B. Nelson "Bien (B. N.) Photos"
Reviews.Content: The bad news is: when setting up, the camera may pop out of the frame. The good news is: the camera still worked after hitting the floor. The camera "sees" well in lit conditions as well as dark. I have some issues with the Dropcam program but that is a different review...

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: G. Grosse
Reviews.Content: Product excellence due to overwhelming simplicity of setup.I purchased the Dropcam during a Cyber monday deal for a great price. It wasn't quite as cheap as the $65 Foscam Pan/Tilt cameras (non HD) though it was fairly close. I've been waiting for the price to drop on this product and it finally did.What I liked the most:-SIMPLE setup...as truly close to plug and play as I've ever experienced with a PC related product....short of a USB drive. You plug it in, and run through a quick browser based config and you're done...thats it.-Great picture quality and wide field of view.-Motion detection that actually works.The free trial of the cloud-based DVR is great as well, and a good ploy to get you hooked on the service for a fee later on.No drawbacks I can think of, other than it gets a bit hot and the cable is thicker than most, making a bit hard to keep the angle of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Its good but not Excellent
Reviews.Author: Kaykay
Reviews.Content: Got my camera few months ago and I found it to be a good camera but it lags allot and goes offline allot even if there is wifi connection. Other than that it good.

Reviews.Title: Great product: you get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Mark T.
Reviews.Content: For once, this actually is a wireless indoor camera that really does take just a few minutes to fully install and really works consistently and easily!  I compare this to the Linksys Wireless-G Home Monitoring Camera and its attendant software.The Dropcam costs more, per camera.  However, the Dropcam literally takes 2-3 minutes to fully install and become fully and permanently operational.  The Linksys requires downloading a large software program and then making wireless router settings.  The Dropcam maintains its connection to your wireless network.  The Linksys drops constantly and requires you to download and use a third-party application such as dyndns to prevent your router from dropping the cameras if your router uses dynamic DNS settings.  The Dropcam can easily be accessed and controlled with a free iPhone app.  I have never been able to make the Linksys system easily accessible when I am not at home.The Dropcam's ability to use cloud storage of video (e.g. activation by motion and/or noise) is only available after a two week trial period for $9.99/month as a subscription.  The Linksys features are part of the software package. IF you can get the frickin' thing to work!Otherwise, the Dropcam can easily be set by internet or iPhone app to turn on or off, to notify you of motion, noise, going offline or any/all of the above and also by time or your proximity to the wireless network.  It even looks sleek and modern and is will built.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: judith collins
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. It is so easy to use. I have a 91 year old Mom that lives with us and I have complete peace of mind now when I have to go out for awhile. I can look on my phone or iPad and see that she is ok. I am going to order another one for the living room so the house is covered. Great for the animal lovers too. You can actually use the mic and talk to them. Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product and a Great Surveillance Tool
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Awesome product to keep an eye on your kids or keep an eye on your property.  With it's WIFI feature would be thieves will be caught on the camera before they even realize it's caught them.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC Customer Service, Great Product overall
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Zan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera back in August of 2012 and have been using it to keep an eye on my pets while I'm at work, and also to keep an eye on the house while I'm traveling.  I have mine plugged in about 60 feet from my modem, with no issues whatsoever.  Until a few weeks ago.  Not sure if it was a coincidence, but right when they rolled out the Pro and redesigned the website, my connection dropped every time the night vision kicked on.  So I contacted their tech support.  Jossi attempted to figure out what was wrong and why it acted like this only during night vision mode, but could come up with no answer.  So, they decided to ship me a whole new Dropcam, free of charge.  Of course, I'll be returning the first one... but WOW.  I was very impressed with their customer service.  Being that it's been over a year since I purchased this camera, I thought for sure I'd be told I had to buy a whole new camera.  Nope!  GREAT company.  They go the extra mile to keep a customer happy.  I'll be purchasing more cameras in the future... perhaps for my birthday... thanks to Dropcam, and Jossi specifically.

Reviews.Title: messed up - what did I buy, new or refurbished?
Reviews.Author: Sreenivas Ramarao
Reviews.Content: What! this brand new camera out of the box does not belong to me? tells me that it is registered to somebody else.submitted a ticket. Will wait for a suitable response, if not, will return!Update:Returned the used dropcam and got a new one. Works well!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product for a web connected home.
Reviews.Author: pixlweb
Reviews.Content: Super simple setup, great quality for the price, and great web interface & apps. I just want another one! Camera is slightly larger than I expected, but not too big.

Reviews.Title: Great for home security.
Reviews.Author: Brian C. Kitchens
Reviews.Content: I have three of these cameras and they provide peace of mind when away from home since you can access them from any computer or smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera works well with the Iphone5 for a baby monitor.
Reviews.Author: Justin Guthrie
Reviews.Content: I like the camera sometimes it randomly goes offline.  It could be my router though. I haven't spent a lot of time troubleshooting. Easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Frank E. Garland
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! We will be using it as a baby monitor. I love how you can view it anywhere you have access to the internet and can turn the camera on/off remotely as well. The picture is very clear and the night vision is decent as well. The only thing that isn't great about it is the mounting bracket that comes with it. The camera fits somewhat loosely in it when mounted on the wall. I'm afraid the camera is going to fall out.

Reviews.Title: Works sporadically
Reviews.Author: Washington Veteran "Washington Veteran"
Reviews.Content: Nice idea but in reality the thing is just not very reliable. Loses its connection with the wi-fi network all the time. When it does work its fun (we got it to see our cats while away and a pet-sitter was taking care of them) but half the time we would eagerly try to look and only got a dead screen.

Reviews.Title: Like it.
Reviews.Author: me you
Reviews.Content: Great for keeping an eye on our dogs during the day.  May lag a bit depending on the bandwidth of your inernet.

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Steve Stallard
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 3 months and I'm really happy with the quality.  We use this as a baby monitor for our new born and its leaps and bounds better than what is available in that category. If I was using this as a security camera I do like that Dropcam offers the DVR service off site for an affordable price. The setup was EASY and QUICK!

Reviews.Title: Good Security Camera
Reviews.Author: James Stewart
Reviews.Content: The Dropcam does everything as advertised.  I use it daily.  Hope the company will produce one for outside use. Will buy more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great ideas but a bit flakey/buggy ime
Reviews.Author: Phil Louis
Reviews.Content: Lots of clever ideas, but imo needs more work to flesh out implementation.Range is iffy in either of our houses, sometimes even 30 ft is too much. Somewhat frequent dropping off the network, but usually getting back on within a minute.Terrible pink ghosting in image with any brightish light from the lens (opposite from the center of the image from the light.  And reversed).What triggers sound alerts and doesn't is a bit flakey for me.  Sometimes a house creak will send an alert, other times even a minute of loud beeping from setting the house alarm in the other house will not trigger a sound event.One thing driving me a little crazy is even though I have sound  alerts turned off currently, for example I just got woken up from a deep sleep from the alerts from the other house when someone called that phone as a wrong number.  Not the first time it has sent sound alerts when supposedly turned off. At first I thought I was mistaken, but now it is very clear that this is buggy.Sometimes I receive the alerts right away, sometimes it takes up to 5 minutes, and some times I get nothing.  Haven't figured out the pattern yet to isolate variables like my different emails (google, msn, etc).Also I really wished they support alerts to a verizon w8 phone (just talking a text here) better, I get about 1/10 of the alerts directly to my phone.  Not sure why that is so spotty, maybe something to do with my specific phone (928) and carrier and the text format.  But all other emailed texts to my phone seem to work fine (I have other apps emailing the phone texts with no problem). This a problem for me, as getting alerts to my mobile is a major part of what I wanted.And dropcam says there is a 30 minute alert timeout between alerts per camera.  I am getting motion alerts often as often as 15 minutes for a single camera, sometimes at the 30 minute intervals. Another area that dropcam needs to spend some resources on, imo.  For any "security" system (which is why I bought it) needs to be reliable and predictable.So kind of flakey in the implementation, but I love the basic idea of the dropcam.  So handy to have the ability to get info on our other place while we are gone when it all working (currently camera has gone off line at other house, for example).  While wi fi connection is spottier than I would have expected, when working it gives good video although it does eat up alot of upload bandwidth which would make multiple cameras a problem for us at either house as we only have around .7 - .8 mbps upload.And I love the concept of the ability to view the stream at any time and see the sound and motion events, even with a subscription fee.  If it all worked a little more solidly, the cost would be well worth it to me.At some point down the road I think it could be a killer product, but not yet imo.  But still pretty cool and if I could I'd give it 3.5 stars.edit: I  heard back from dropcam support and they said the pink flare in the lens is considered normal in the dropcam. I consider this kind of reflection only normal in a poor quality lens.  For whatever reason, the dropcam pro does not have any of this flare under identical conditions.Also having a bit of problem keeping my dropcam HD connected.  Currently it had been offline for two days and we have not  had a chance to go there and get it reconnected.update 12/3  Camera is now dropping off network every few minutes and then reconnects (which results in a motion alert).  And then after a couple hours it quits entirely. Tried rebooting modem, camera etc and behavior is the same.  After I am away a few hours the camera goes offline (sometimes it seems to actually sbut off. So for me it's of no use and is going back. Also to work at all I had to put it the same room as my modems (same for both houses) with no walls between them at all.  Crazy poor wi fi ability.I since bought a dropcam pro (which does not do this same dropping off regularly every few minutes) but it is  having issues of it's own.  But I'll wait until the behavior patterns are clear and post this in a separate review.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this as a baby monitor! Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Kimberly A.
Reviews.Content: The concept of the camera is great.  It is very easy to use and set up, it also has great clarity in the video.  The customer service is polite, efficient and fast.  My problem is that the camera is constantly losing connection, delayed feedback or constantly spinning the blue wheel and loading.  I contacted drop cam and they tried to help me out by trying different solutions such as moving camera closer to modem ( which isn't always possible as in my case ) changing the channel on your modem to a less busy one which I did and then they eventually sent me a new camera.  Unfortunately none of these solutions worked.  I do not recommend this for a baby monitor which is one of the ways it is marketed.  I have the camera in my child's room and I cannot depend on it always working.  With a baby you need to see them at all times especially at night which is when I seem to lose connection the most.  I calculated one night that it is losing connection or loading 10 minutes in a 15 minute time frame. That is unacceptable for any security camera no less one that is in a baby's room.  I have roadrunner lighting so speed should not be an issue. The only other devices I have are an ipad and 2 cell phones in the house which they said some wifi devices might interfere but who doesn't have that in their house?  My house is a small 3 bedroom so I don't know I have put so much time and effort to get this thing working I'm over it I wish I would have just bought a traditional baby monitor.  So if you are looking at this for a baby I DO NOT recommend this, please save some frustration and get a traditional baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Delivered on everything as promised. Great quality
Reviews.Author: Rpjackdux
Reviews.Content: Delivered on everything as promised. Great quality.  The features all work and set up was easy as promised. Recommended to many friends

Reviews.Title: Excellent Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Christa Weiss
Reviews.Content: Covers a large area and great clarity.  Will probably get another!The app that comes with the Smart phone is great.  You can check in anytime.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: Jon Sharp
Reviews.Content: I like the dropcam. Now wish I had gotten the more expensive one. I think it is great. The picture is good but I am sure with the more expensive one the picture would be sharper. Good buy though.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam - WiFi issues
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J Schmitz
Reviews.Content: Critical review - I've been using the dropcam for several months now so are the the pros and cons.I reviewed several other cameras before I bought this one and also reviewed the tech report from our local TV station regarding the camera.**Check for updates on the WiFi booster experience next month**Pro: Definitely very easy set-up, even the novice can do it in a couple of minutes...maybe not 60 seconds but 5 min should do it.  The picture quality in HD (have not tested SD) is very good, the night vision can be a bit blurry but still good quality.  The dropcam app - you can access the app via I-phone and I'm sure via any Android as well. For the I-phone you have to  go  thru settings first in order to turn on/off the camera (one/two extra steps...could be easier). Once the camera is on you don't  have to be in close proximity to view it - you could be miles away.  The built in microphone picks up sounds very effective and the background noise (static) is minimal.  Tech Support: Overall the tech support is helpful and tries to figure out quickly how to resolve the issues ( I tested e-mail  only). The online help knowledge base is very limited in my opinion.Con: WiFi issues - this seems to be the biggest problem with my camera. I have FIOS cable so my internet connection is very fast  as is the WiFi. Unfortunately the camera doesn't work very well if the router is not within the same room or if you have a 2nd  story right above it. We had the camera upstairs above the router and the delay on the camera picture was about 3-5 sec.  on average. That's a bit long in my opinion especially if you're using it for your kids. Now that we moved the camera to  another room the WiFi is very spotty. I am constantly getting a message "Camera disconnected...." although we have WiFi in  the entire house without problems. We also bought a WiFi booster but for some reason it's not helping either - check back  for updates on this issue.  After the latest software update whenever I turn the camera on it shows a picture from the last time it was on and not a "live"  pic - solution is to close the app and open it again. Annoying!!!Final review:Overall the dropcam is a very nice good working camera, very expensive for just one camera, but the quality of the live streaming video is usually very good in either daytime or nighttime conditions. The biggest problem is the WiFi but maybe this can be solved via a WiFi booster - we are currently experimenting with it. Would I recommend this camera?I think overall it's a good product but I would research some more before I would buy this pricey one.Check back for WiFi booster experience update.

Reviews.Title: Good Cam but a Big Appetite for the Upload Bandwidth
Reviews.Author: Road King
Reviews.Content: The setup is super easy and the design, size, picture angle and quality is really good but this dropcam is a hungry little devil when it comes to upload bandwidth.  That can cause some issues for you.  I set the unit up in less than 5 minutes from box to view.  The remote view from my iPhone and Ipad was great but I soon found that my internet was cutting out... a lot.  I have just switched from TW to ATT and have the top speed package they offer.  I had noticed a slower browse speed with ATT than TW so with this new internet drop issue I decided to call ATT Tech support to see where the problem was.  They were extremely helpful.  I found out my router channel was not properly set by the install tech and they led me through a re-channel procedure that helped tremendously in boosting my download bandwidth to 18+ Mbps and upload to 1.6+ Mbps.  ATT is known for slow upload speeds but my speed test showed that I was back to where I was suppose to be based on the package I pay for.  Even with that adjustment it kept dropping out when the camera was connected.  Disconnect the camera and it was fine.  Dropcam Tech support (very good by the way despite it being all email based) took me through several iterations of moving the camera closer to the router and then farther away.  Distance from the wireless router makes a HUGE difference.  One floor up and almost overhead of the router and the internet connection drops frequently with 2 iPads and 2 iPhones also drawing signal.  Moving the cam to the same room as the router the signal is steady with no drops over a 24 hour period.  Moving the cam to the opposite side of the house (~40') and on the same floor and the internet drops a lot.  So if you are going to locate the cam over 30 feet away or on a different floor from your router you may run into frequent signal drops.  I am also sure that running more than 1 of these would bring my internet to its knees.  Bottom line, if your ISP gives you plenty of upload speed and you keep the camera located fairly close to the router you will be very happy with this Dropcam.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for spying on your kids.  Or making sure they're safe.  Either way.
Reviews.Author: A. Matthews
Reviews.Content: Great unit....there is a delay even in SD, but still great picture.  We use it in the playroom to watch the kids and make sure they're not burning the house down.  Great being able to login from basically anywhere.  Could be used for a million things...security/monitoring/kids/pets/etc.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product - watch how many.
Reviews.Author: Dickie
Reviews.Content: So I've been a long time user of Dropcam - right from the start.  I have to say they are an awesome product - and I've been gradually adding more and more over time.Picture is awesome, configuration is easy - the cloud based DVR is worth every penny.Only word of caution is I recently added a couple more (taking my total to 5) and 4+ seems to kill my 2.4Ghz wireless network - so If you are considering a dense deployment you may want to consider the HD Pro which allows you to work on the 5Ghz radio.

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it, love it!
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Use it everyday to watch the dogs.  Just wish they would have had this when the kids were little.  Couldn't have been easier to set up and is easy to use. Not one problem.

Reviews.Title: Works great, not a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Manuel Carballo
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and quick set up but the lag doesn't make it ideal as a baby monitor. Keeping it to use while I'm away but I'd go with a cheaper option if you want it as a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Price is right for a very good product!
Reviews.Author: Artemus Gordon
Reviews.Content: Ok I was skeptical about this item. We bought it for our 42 ft RV. Why, to watch the dogs when we go to dinner or leave them for any reason.  It's great, we can yell at them or praise them.  We yell more often, I am afraid.  We have a Bernese Mt Dog and a Golden Retreiver.  Big dogs can be destructive!  Other reason we purchased it, was to be able, via sound, to insure the Air Conditioning is working while we are gone!  Very good product, but it does need good "hot spot" or solid wifi!  We even use it as security device.  Sets up well, compatible with our Mac's, IPhones etc.

Reviews.Title: I love my mommy cam!
Reviews.Author: Angela Dispenzieri
Reviews.Content: The camera and sound are superb. Easy to intall and to use. The software associated with the saved video could be better, but overall I am very pleased. I use it to watch my mom who is elderly and frail. She fell and this was caught by drop cam. Not only were we able to react quickly to the event, but we were able to see how and why the fall occurred.

Reviews.Title: It's a nice little system.
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: It's amazing what goes on when your not around. So far I have caught the wife up to no good. The kids selling crack and my neighbor sniffing my under clothes, from the hamper. I would recommend the dropcam. It was easy to hook up and not too expensive. I use the video cloud storage with it for under 10.00 a week.

Reviews.Title: Worked Perfectly
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: The camera and stand are well made and very sturdy.  The camera's WiFi was setup in minutes, the picture is clear, and sound quality is good.  I only wish I purchased this earlier.  We bought this to monitor the nanny for our four month old and just a few days after installing it we saw her neglecting and mistreating our daughter.  If it weren't for this camera who knows what could have happened to her.  I did notice that when you are on the site and you view video recorded earlier in the day the speed seems to either be in fast forward or slow motion in during some time frames.

Reviews.Title: Gives me peace of mind
Reviews.Author: momma t.
Reviews.Content: I work 12hr shifts overnight, and would worry about my baby constantly.  I knew she was in good hands with dad, but it drove me crazy not being able to check in.  We got this camera, my husband said set up was simple, and now I can check on my little one from my phone anytime I want.  The app is user friendly, and I love that you can turn the camera on and off so easily when you're away from home.  Overall a great purchase !

Reviews.Title: Best Buy!! :)
Reviews.Author: Robert M.
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera..Caught my neighbor doing criminal mischief..Exactly what I needed to show physical proof to the police..Best purchase I have ever made..Thanks DropCam!!

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Lexington, SC
Reviews.Content: Simple to install out of the box.  Picture detail is amazing at a value price.  Recording functions and flexibility of monitoring is so easy.  5 star rating

Reviews.Title: App is a tad glitchy but the camera itself is awesome
Reviews.Author: SH "ssbmg"
Reviews.Content: Set up took all of 3 minutes.  It was incredibly easy.  Just connect via included USB cable to a PC or Mac and set up a quick account, connect to your wifi network, and you're ready to go.  The base is weighted and very sturdy.  The camera itself is very high quality.  When viewing on a computer/tablet/phone the image looks great.  Not crystal clear hi-def 1080p great but hotel room standard definition ever so slightly blurry great.  Which for a security camera is great.  Also at night the image appears like a black and white TV - again very high quality.The app is intuitive and easy to use.  I have it both for Android and iOS.  The only issue I've had is not the camera's fault but related to the bandwidth speed in my house.  I have DSL so 20 Mb/s is great for viewing content however DSL upload speed in <1Mb/s so I get a lot of buffering from the camera feed when trying to view remotely.  I only have one installed on my main level and intend to use as a motion sensor that will email me when triggered while I am away from the house.  I think that if I wanted to add another one (maybe for my front entrance and/or garage) then I will probably have to switch ISPs so I can get a higher upload speed to support multiple cameras.Also I hope they come out with some kind of weatherproof kit so I can mount this outdoors because the night vision really is pretty remarkable.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be easier to set up!
Reviews.Author: angelicamb "angelicambb"
Reviews.Content: This is literally plug and play.  For the price and performance I can't imagine it could be better.  Video can stall or be slow when you aren't on wi-fi but that's a small concession.  I highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: alex s tepper
Reviews.Content: incredibly easy to install and a lot of fun watching how our bulldog spends her time when we are out of the house.  Great fun listening to her snore through the camera and talking to her via our iphone

Reviews.Title: Constantly Buffering
Reviews.Author: Gadget Nut
Reviews.Content: This cam gets amazing reviews but it didn't seem good to me. I tested it and it wouldn't go more than few seconds without buffering. It also has about a 3-5 second delay. The video quality is good but I wouldn't say amazing.

Reviews.Title: Tracking mom
Reviews.Author: LVH
Reviews.Content: I love my new dropcam. I had to buy a repeater router to access the wifi but it works beautifully now. I only wish the receiving audio in the camera was louder.I use the camera to keep tabs on my 95 year old mother when I go out to shop etc.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for monitoring your Pets or for surveillance but NOT FOR BABY MONITOR!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Reinaldo Troconis
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera 4 stars because is an outstanding camera, with the following PRO's:- Super easy installation on a MAC or a PC. (In my case was a MAC)- Great picture quality- Good Night vision feature- You can watch the camera from multiple devices at the sametime in real time from anywere!- Notifications of motion alert to your smartphone app (In my case an iPhone 4S)- Very sensitive with the sounds and the two way audio feature work very good- Zoom (not in real time) of four quadrants (upper/lower - left/right)- Create clips of recorded events on Dropcam website- Price is very good for the quality of the product.CONS:- The delay of the camera goes around 4 seconds to up to 3 mins! (average delay is 15 seconds) This is unacceptable for a Baby Monitor, so is impossible to have a DropCam to monitor a Baby with this delay!!!!  (And is not because the speed of my internet connection, actually I have a very good internet speed at home, and I tested the camera with my iPhone Wi-Fi connection and not with the cellular Data connection)-The feature of turning Off the camera with the app in your smartphone when you arrive home doesn't work- You can't make a clip of a recorded event in the iPhone app- It would be cool to have a Zoom in real timeI decide to bought this camera over the conventional baby monitors (Samsung / Motorolla / LG) because you can use the DropCam for other purposes (Monitor from your smartphone/tablet/PC your Pets, Babysitter with your kids, teenagers alone at home, surveillance, etc.) when your baby is not a baby anymore, thing that you can't do with the conventional ones, they simple become useless when your baby grows up. But with the delay that I found in the transmission of the video between the DropCam and the iPhone app, what I think is not acceptable for monitoring a baby, I have being forced to buy a conventional baby monitor anyway.If the Dropcam was mainly commercialized as a Baby Monitor I would give this Product between 1 to 2 Stars. But since this camera is not offered mainly as a Baby Monitor, but as one of the many features that it haves and giving that this camera has a lot of other cool features and is a high quality ending product it deserves a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: 100 percent failure rate!
Reviews.Author: Thomas R Costantino
Reviews.Content: My first impression was excellent BUT I am upset:Update after just a couple of months:I liked my dropcam so much I bought 3 total and wanted to add more.They are the simple to use and the monitoring cvr feature is  just fantastic. But 2 of my cameras stopped working within weeks.The third just stopped working(after a couple of months) That is a 100% failure rate folks! Customer support is very good,and replacements were shipped to me, but 100% failure rate within a couple of months is scary! How long can I expect these things to last? Under warranty now so I am ok, but what happens next? Good luck and be careful.I still intend to buy more cams for my house but How or why would I buy more Dropcams ?

Reviews.Title: great dog cam!
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: We have owned this camera for almost 2 months now and use it several days a week when we need to leave our newly rescued dog home alone.  He has terrible separation anxiety and it helps our stress level to be able to check on him when he has to be by himself.  I've used the "talk" feature to try to calm the dog and it works great with just a slight delay when I am watching on my iPhone until I hear my voice come through.  I have no complaints about this product at all.  I'm so happy we bought it.

Reviews.Title: Nearly perfect baby monitor --- once we figured it out
Reviews.Author: Scott B. Stern
Reviews.Content: I wrestled with 4 stars or 5 stars here. This is a really great product, but we almost completely gave up on it.Pros - HD/near HD quality video is night vision and regular, minimal delay (less than 5 seconds), we can watch on our iPhones, iPad, computer, etc. both when connected to wifi and 3G/4G, unit is very small and easy to transport, lightweight so can easily be mounted to any service, camera can be tilt 180 degrees to ensure it's watching the entire scene.Cons - Make sure your wifi is up to the challenge of reliably streaming HD video, otherwise the Dropcam is worse than useless --the video and audio will be choppy, delayed by as much as 10 minutes, and the connection will randomly drop for extended periods. Other than that the only real cons are that you can't remotely pan/tilt the camera and, for the digital zoom, the screen is divided into 5 pre-set sections rather than allowing you to select any centerpoint you want. A final, fairly minor con, is that the IR transmitters glow red rather than being invisible to the naked eye. Not a big deal, but a bit annoying.Then we added a wifi extender and adjusted the channel of our wifi network and everything changed. This now works perfectly. We get reliable audio and video with maybe 5 seconds of delay at most at HD (or at least near HD) quality. We can watch from our iPhones, computer, iPad no matter where we are and no matter whether we're on wifi or 3G/4G.

Reviews.Title: Better than a crummy old baby monitor
Reviews.Author: James Miller
Reviews.Content: We needed a baby monitor for our son’s room. This is smaller and more versatile than most of the baby monitors we looked at, and there’s only the one piece: the camera. You can monitor from the Dropcam website, or your phone/tablet. And it works great. Even the night vision is crisp. Setup is a snap, too.The customer service is really great, too. About a week in, we left it on for 2 or 3 days straight (you can turn it on/off from the website or the app, which is great, cause I don’t want it always on). Anyways, after a few days, the plug component started to smell like overheated electronics. I tweeted to @Dropcam, and they put me in touch with support, who took my serial #/email address, and just sent me another plug straight away. I didn’t even have to send the old one back, I just threw it away.So, if you’re considering a baby monitor/security cam, I highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Liked it so much, I bought a second.
Reviews.Author: John P. Metcalfe
Reviews.Content: I now own two. I keep a price watch on Amazon to see if the price drops significantly. If it does, I'll likely buy more.The app works well. Picture quality is amazing for the price. Day/night feature is flawless. Audio could be a little better, but it's not a deal breaker. It's more about the camera for most people.

Reviews.Title: Delivers what I need and much more
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Lynn King
Reviews.Content: I tried several other cameras and most could not keep a wifi connection and all had inadequate desktop and iPhone software. The Dropcam has everything I need and also things I didn't know I wanted. I'm thinking about getting another one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: luisa enriquez lazo
Reviews.Content: Its excellent!!!!!! Clear image only when you speak the message sounds later but even like that i would buy another one

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera in all ways
Reviews.Author: JMT
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great camera for the money.  Easy as pie to set up and the best part is your PC does not need to be on for all of the functionality to remain.

Reviews.Title: Not Appreciated by Family!
Reviews.Author: Mommylicious
Reviews.Content: My purpose for this item was to have access to my dad's shenanigans.  He had just returned from a rehabilitation center.  We did not want him to fall.  This small camera was able to span the entire room...clearly!  I was truly amazed that I could see him from anywhere at anytime using an iPhoneAlas, one time my dad was getting up without using his walker.  From my SUV, my  daughter yelled, "Sit down grandpa!"  It frightened him because I neglected to tell him that it had a two way speaker.  Since there are two others in the house who roam in and out of his room, they kindly suggested I return the camera. I don't blame them - kind of spooky. I thought about using it in my home but I like living in denial that our babysitters are only babysitting.

Reviews.Title: Awesome so far!
Reviews.Author: Redbeard
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these and I have to say I love them so far! Did a lot a lot of research on IP security cameras for home/office monitoring. Had to go with these based on reported ease of setup and simply design and function.Gave it four stars because of the following:Camera does disconnect sometimes but I haven't used it enough to report a major issue. DVR service charge is lame. Night vision could be a little bit better. It does suck up bandwidth but there are options to help ease this.Overall I'm happy so far!

Reviews.Title: great monitoring
Reviews.Author: Shintajay
Reviews.Content: quick setup  Very good custumer service when I had question.  I now have two.  One issue is the video lag.  As small as a few seconds to 30 seconds.  Depends on the wifi signal.

Reviews.Title: Good security cam with very easy setup
Reviews.Author: Ronald W Becker
Reviews.Content: This cam has super simple setup and works well. It does require adequate wireless bandwidth to maintain a reliable connection. Given that, it performs well and is reliable.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera image not super great
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Peterson "MDP"
Reviews.Content: I do like this camera, and do recommend, what would make it better is a zoom and ability to rotate the lens. I positioned this in best spot and it does do what I need it to do, great that you get sound, which is not always that clear so that would be good if audio was improved but it is ok enough. The picture quality is not super awesome but it is good enough. The talk function is practically useless, I tried it out but it is too quiet and muffled, not that I really need to use this I am more interested in hearing than communicating to those I am viewing. Zoom would be awesome, sometimes it is hard to see and I have it positioned to capture as much of the room as possible but I get the general idea of what is going on. I did research a lot and this camera looked best for the price, I will possibly get another one for another part of house, or I may try a different brand to see how compares but is really great that I can see on my iphone, ipad or computer from anywhere I am whether away on a trip, or in the car or out at dinner I can view on my iphone or other device and see what is going on and get live viewing and audio.

Reviews.Title: DOWNLOADING . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
Reviews.Author: Greg G. Gebhardt "Greg Gebhardt"
Reviews.Content: The camera installs and goes to work in only a short period of time. Features work but are rather basic.The bad, all of your recordings are downloaded to the dropcam severs, no option to load video to your computer INSTEAD. I find the servers at dropcam to be VERY SLOW.  I have a very fast Internet connection and the latest WiFi and it takes forever to view your videos due to very slow downloading speeds.If dropcam is going to force you to use their servers and charge you for it, they need to provide the bandwidth to make  it an acceptable experience. Until this is fixed not sure if I would continue to use this camera.OK used for a few days and the servers are not so bad but would still like the option of downloading to my always on computer instead of the $30 month fee for downloading to dropcamAlso this camera uses a good bit of WiFi bandwidth as I can tell a big difference when I turn it off my wireless devices work much faster.Still 3 stars

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: C. Williams
Reviews.Content: I have purchased two of these cameras. The downside of this camera is that it requires that you plug it in. It said wireless so I thought that is what it meant but it is not..I like the quality of the camera and it is very sensitive. It reacts to the wind blowing really hard.

Reviews.Title: It has improved!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Binotto
Reviews.Content: I have two Dropcams along with their 7 day recording service. I use them partly as an addition to my security system (i.e. if someone was to break in, I would have them on video), partly to keep an eye on my place while away, & partly because it is just fun and puts my mind at ease when away from home. I will say that I was fairly frustrated with them going offline so often. Sometimes it would be off line for hours at the time. Other times it will do down sporadically creating frequent gaps within the recordings (sometimes hundreds of short gaps in every hour). I knew it wasn't my wi-fi. I have a super strong signal and download speeds over 50 Mbps. But something happen over the past couple months. I assume the firmware was updated at some point. It has been very reliable and now something I can recommend. When Dropcam works as designed, it is the best in class!

Reviews.Title: works for me!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Sims
Reviews.Content: This was just what I had hoped it would be - at a reasonable price.  We use it as security for my Mom's house & it hasn't failed me yet. I can see her and hear her. and..it works on my Kindle!!..couldn't ask for more

Reviews.Title: Great Wi-Fi Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Fabrizio II
Reviews.Content: This is a great wireless camera. It was very easy to setup and get connected to my network. It has good picture quality and the night vision function is an added bonus. I would highly recommend this product for security, doggy-cam, or a baby cam. The software settings also allow the camera to send an alert either by email or to your phone as to whether it has detected motion or a noise.It does use a significant amount of data if you have a limit from your network provider. It also does occasionally lose connectivity, but it is minimal and does not last long.This is a great camera and it functions as advertised.

Reviews.Title: dropcam is worth every dime
Reviews.Author: customer
Reviews.Content: way better than expected. works great home survalance is terrific. you really will be amazed. any one wanting to see what is going on at your home will love it.

Reviews.Title: Best internet connected camera out there!  I've bought three more!
Reviews.Author: Chase
Reviews.Content: I have had 4 webcams in my life and this is the best one, hands down, by far!  I am purchasing three more to put up at my other home and at my in-laws.  Plus, I have a new baby due and we will be using this as the baby monitor.The whole setup time is less than 5 minutes, the clarity is excellent and the DVR is amazing.  It's so nice to be able to go back and see through motion and audio alerts what has happened.  Their iphone and ipad apps are very easy to use.I fully recommend this produce!

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome.
Reviews.Author: Jamie L. Wright
Reviews.Content: I got my camera Saturday (3 days ago). I've been using it to watch my puppy. I have to say that I absolutely love it. I've tried a few different cameras to watch my pets (for years I used gotocamera.com which is now out of service). This one is leagues above everything else I've tried. The two way audio is just awesome, though I do try to leave my puppy alone when he's sleeping. There's a slight delay (anywhere from 5-30 seconds), but that's not a problem at all. The night vision works well, although I don't usually use it. This camera is everything I could have wanted and more. Not to mention it's amazingly easy to set up. Thanks, dropcam!

Reviews.Title: A REALLY good idea but...
Reviews.Author: icebean
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera so that, when I went on my first trip away from hubby since his becoming disabled, I would be able to check in any time I wanted from my smartphone. Being able to intervene even though there would be a full time caregiver with him made me feel a lot less guilty about taking the very necessary trip I had planned. I loved the advertised idea that it could pan, zoom and tilt as well as having a conversation via the product.Sadly, it was not to be.I bought and installed it about 10 days in advance of my trip. First off, it doesn't really pan or tilt -- neither does it really zoom. It's all digital so you can't get the same zoom result as with the optical zoom on your camera, for instance. You can move it around, tilt it, hang it on the wall, set it on a dresser -- but I never found a way to alter the view from either my smartphone or from the dropcam website. So that was disappointing...Although it found and linked to our Xfinity wifi/wireless router, the connection was never great or consistent. And on the very morning that I was leaving, I woke up to a solid red-orange light. I checked on the website, read the guide(s) and found that it means it's trying to connect to the router. Or you don't have internet service. Or your router is broken. I tried 2 laptops, a tablet, a desktop and my smartphone and every one of them connected with zero problems. It wasn't our router. It was the dropcam.Here is a summary of the issues I found with the dropcam:1.  Zoom is digital so you can zoom to a particular area on the display, not zoom in on the subject itself.2.  Video is grainy even on the best day so you can't really see facial expressions, which for me was a big deal.3.  The audio is extremely delayed -- probably 3-4 seconds minimum and it was not good audio so hubby rarely understood what was  being communicated to him.4.  The camera (the black part in the center of the metal stand) is made of a plastic housing with whatever components inside -- it gets HOT... REALLY hot.If it were to work, here are the pros that I can imagine being important to buyers/users:1.  Easy setup via a provided cable, a quick account set-up and logging in to the dropcam site.2.  Sturdy stand that can be mounted in multiple ways.3.  Decent smartphone app to interface with unit.4.  Additional interface available at any time via the website.5.  Ability to upgrade to a paid plan that allows archiving of video taken by the dropcam.6.  Night vision feature.7.  Wireless -- plug into any electrical outlet after initial setup and you're good.Needless to say, I disconnected the unit the morning of my travels and, as soon as I returned from my trip, I contacted Amazon and returned it. They refunded my money immediately -- the return process was about as simple as it could be.After reading through many of the reviews on the Dropcam, I'm just not sure it's ready for prime time... I know that, for me, when I needed it most, it failed. I won't be replacing it or trying again. I may see what other types of cameras are available with our Xfinity Home Security and maybe that will be a better solution for us.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Frances M. Hallman "Frances's books"
Reviews.Content: My daughter's baby was premature and had problems, and her husband had to go back to work. He drives truck for a living and he could watch his daughter while he was working. Now my daughter had to go back to work and I bought another on so no matter which room the baby is in she could watch her. They love it too!

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: Ian L
Reviews.Content: Easy as discribed and its online feature has helped since I started going underway more often. I really wish I got this sooner.

Reviews.Title: Worked exactly as advertised.
Reviews.Author: pianogirl
Reviews.Content: Only took a few minutes to set up.  We use it as a webcam/nanny cam and it works perfectly for that purpose.  It is not exactly inconspicuous but I stuck it right underneath our TV in the main living room and it looks like it belongs there with all the other electronics.  We opted not to sign up for the $10 mo. service because we only use it once a week or so.  I just log in on my Android and see what the kids and babysitter are up to.

Reviews.Title: Nice system - not a fan of the subscription plan
Reviews.Author: urwink "Wink"
Reviews.Content: I really like the system and the camera for it's image quality and ease of use.  The only disappointing aspect is the ongoing cost of using all the features the camera has to offer such as recording the video.

Reviews.Title: Met all expectations
Reviews.Author: Jim Fischer
Reviews.Content: Easy to install, my 15 year old daughter did most of it and it was set up in 15 minutes. Controlling it via my android phone in minutes after install.

Reviews.Title: The best in class
Reviews.Author: SEAN
Reviews.Content: This company has figured out a way to design the product I have been looking for. It is simple, well designed, easy to set up and works as advertised. I have watched live feeds of my NJ home om an iPhone and ipad while in St Thomas. Great product

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: We were recently burglarized so we went looking for a surveillance system, and this camera is seriously the most easy piece of technology I've ever used.  I saw "have it up in running in 1 minute" at first I figured it'd end up taking hours BUT, - it DID take only ONE minute - LITERALLY!!!!  All you do is create, an account, tell it which wireless network to connect to, and it's working like a charm.  After the easy installation, download the app and it's just as easy to use on my smartphone (iPhone 5) as well as on the web - you can view it anywhere in the world!  The first one we purchased worked so well, we took advantage of a sale the company was having and purchased another!  Thieves beware - we'll be watching AND recording you!  The DVR is done remotely (separate charge if you so choose), which has it's pro & cons, but if a thief sees your camera and you capture the face - too late!  Your image has already been captured and sent to drop cams remote DVR where you can make a movie and provide it to the police to (hopefully) capture the culprit!  Reasonably priced, easy to setup, and works as advertised = the definition of FIVE stars (in my book).  If you're on the fence, purchase it!  I hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: Careless and slow response support team
Reviews.Author: M. Tavarez
Reviews.Content: Product has a great looking design, easy to configure and setup. But the support is to slow in my case my dropcam IR works during the two first days; after that I’m not able to see in darkness even though the IR LED inside the camera lighted up.  I reported the issue to dropcam support but still after six days after issue comes out, they have not come out with the solution. Seems to be a good product unless uplink bandwidth is critical and the support staff is careless.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: JDB
Reviews.Content: I ordered five of the cameras.  The overall quality of set up, product and web design is very good.However, one camera was unable to hold its Wifi connection (while the others do in the same spot). At first I did not find their service responsive, but after posting my dissatisfaction here, they responded quickly.So, upgrading them to 4 stars as the product and service is special.They do need an outside casmera version.

Reviews.Title: Easy Set up.  Not really HD and Speaker is weak
Reviews.Author: Ronald J. King
Reviews.Content: I'll agree this was easy to set up.  I'd say image quality is okay.  If you're expecting HD as in HD TV, this isn't even close. If a robber were to come in during daylight, you might get a feel for his major features - you won't see that he has a mole on his left cheek.  Nighvision is cool, but again, pretty weak in the resolution department.  The microphone is very sensitive - easy to hear the guinea pigs fighting in the other room.  But the speaker is really weak.  Any amount of background noise you have is going to easily drown it out - even at full volume.  For example, I wanted to yell at the dog to get off the "special" couch she's not supposed to be on.  Instead of startling her in to submission, she barely opened one eye and must had been thinking "What are these soft voices I'm hearing in my head".

Reviews.Title: Great DIY Security System
Reviews.Author: Pauly D
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these to monitor the main level and basement of my house and plan to add more in the future.  Setup is a piece of cake.  Picture quality is great and web interface couldn't be easier.  The IR, for night vision, likes to bounce off windows/mirrors/pictures and render it useless so you need to be extra mindful of placement.  DVR feature is awesome but too rich for my blood.  If you are in reach of a computer or cell phone all day then the notifications are quick enough.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic and so simple
Reviews.Author: Kathyv "KathyV-NJ"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to keep an eye on the pool when we are not home (to monitor through the window).  I have been searching for something that did not require a visit from the geek squad. I have purchased other surveillance cameras in the past only to box them up and return. I read the reviews but did not believe them until now. So it arrived today, and the simplicity of the instructions had me up and running this without a hitch. I then downloaded the free iPad app and was blown away. The picture and sound quality amazing.  Ease of use and set up was exactly what I wanted and the price, compared to others out there is totally affordable. I will be recommending this to everyone. Oh, and by the way,I am retired female and if I can do it so can you!!

Reviews.Title: Best Baby video monitor out there!
Reviews.Author: Silbia
Reviews.Content: After researching a lot about baby monitors that worked on more than one client, we decided to try this one out.It has been more than a month now and we have been pleased so far with it.The setup is super easySetup and maintainability on pc, ipad and iphone is easyPicture quality is greatNight vision works goodAudio quality is also good. It can be adjusted with the Camera microphone sensitivity control.We have been able to share the video feed with relatives over the internet with ease. the resolution is really goodThe talk back feature doesn't work well sometimes though.Overall we regard it as one of the best baby purchases we made.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: PV'er
Reviews.Content: We were going to install cameras that came with our ADT security system but they were much more expensive and the representative from ADT said that the drop cams were much better because you can stream them live.  These are great cameras!!

Reviews.Title: Easy
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Ross
Reviews.Content: For years I have spent tons of time and money trying to get Internet cameras to work without a major struggle.  Dropcam has ended that struggle.  For the first time, I had the camera on line in 5 minutes with seamless cellular access from both my iPad & iPhone.  The only downside I can see with this camera is if the company goes out of business or starts charging for basic access.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift for Gadget Lovers
Reviews.Author: sthomp
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my gadget loving husband for Christmas. He thought it was a computer cam and didn't look very excited until I told him to read what it can do. He loves it now. He watches our dogs when he is at work and when they jump on the couch he can tell them to get down or to lay on their beds. The 2 way speaker system is great except when trying to talk via internet. Works better on his iTouch but if you have too many gadgets using wifi the camera will interfere with everything else. Picture quality is great but have to be careful w/ reflections on the window if using night vision or else it whites out. Little bit of a time delay with picture and sound even w/ DSL which is only a small inconvenience. We had 2 bikes stolen off of our porch and our neighbors car was broken into. This brings us piece of mind knowing now when we go on a trip we will be able to watch our house via internet or on his iTouch. When motion is detected it will send an e-mail to us w/ a picture. There is a monthly charge ($9.95) to record daily activity that is not mentioned until after you purchase it. If it is not purchased you will only get live recording. Lense has a zoom and you have the option of deactivating the recording light. Great when you have teenagers breaking rules. Also, it gives you the choice to have your recordings public or private. Hubby wants another one for the back yard now. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Blair Schumann "Shoehorn"
Reviews.Content: This dropcam is fantastic as an inexpensive security camera. It also can double as a notification of internet troubles as the LED turns amber when it can't connect out, and their system sends a noticication when it hasn't connected in a half hour.Fantastic video quality, though I wouldn't say HD. I've never gotten video quality that I could deem HD, and I have 5mb upload on my internet connection. All in all a fantastic camera, and if the video was actually HD it would have 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Basics are Fine but not enough
Reviews.Author: -ben-
Reviews.Content: I really love the easyness of Dropcam. Connect to the computer, the set up starts automatically, put in a username, chose a password, give the cam a name and put in your wifi credentials... ReadyThe cam comes with a long enough power cord to put it even on the ceiling and still plug it into the power plug down on the floor. The picture quality even during night mode is quite ok, still nothing compared to the crisp sharp pictures of a Skype call on iPad / iPhone in a wifi network.Missing is- split screen mode for iPhone (it's on iPad only)- dynamic picture quality depending on network (it's always ok but not nice)- zoom function while watching the stream (u can set a fixed zoom level in the settings though)- full horizon adjustment (only 180 degrees flip in the settings)- adjustment of motion detection, I receive dozens if fals alarms a day (!) cause a car light shines in or a minor movement of a plant inside my house

Reviews.Title: Great product - easy to set-up, terrific quality, great features
Reviews.Author: David Martella
Reviews.Content: Love these cameras. Incredibly easy to set-up, you just plug them in anywhere you want them. Quality is great, and the one time I had a question technical support was top rate.

Reviews.Title: Nice product! very quick and easy to use. no complaints whatsoever.
Reviews.Author: Edward Delgado
Reviews.Content: This is a easy simple camera system to use. Dont understand some of the negative rating some people write about it. Completely awesome.

Reviews.Title: Super Simple
Reviews.Author: BRIAN STROHMAN
Reviews.Content: I just got this today and it is very easy to setup. As Paperboy 98 said phone support is lacking but email was fast when I emailed them about a question using the camera. I like the ability of having  two way sound and viewing it on my iPhone and iPad. A outdoor camera would be great as others have suggested. I have a security system with pan/tilt features and these cameras are a lot better.

Reviews.Title: pretty awesome camera
Reviews.Author: mttew1
Reviews.Content: Not perfect, but really good.  Motion and sound detection are a bit sensitive.  I'd love to see the ability to move the camera possibly in the next version.  Overall it fits our needs for what we use it for and i'm happy with the quality and functionality at the price point.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Michael Phillips "Cobra2o2"
Reviews.Content: Has really good quality, more than expected i'd give the video a 8/10 (10 being dvd quality) the sound on the other hand is iffy, it work but if you talk too loudly it just goes static or not at all. but what does go through i'd give a 6/10 on top of all that its got about a 5 second delay when watched on the computer but for some reason its only a 3 second delay with the free phone app. Night vision works good and  the cord is pretty long to the wall. Setup was literally like 5 minutes and there is no subscription but if you want DVR you'll get the 2 week trial after that its about $10 a month.

Reviews.Title: love the iphone viewing
Reviews.Author: A. Jones
Reviews.Content: We just bought this for our 12 month old after not having any type of monitor in her room.  The monitor is more of a toy for us at this point because we can hear if our daughter is awake in her room.  It's nice to know if when she fusses she's fully awake or still laying down and sleepy.  Also, being able to see the monitor remotely is cool.  The best part is the iphone app.  There were a few problems with the app recently, but Dropcam updated it and everything seems to be working well now.  I love being able to use my phone as the viewer instead of having another gadget to carry around.  It's also nice that multiple phones can be linked to the camera.

Reviews.Title: So versatile
Reviews.Author: Alexandros Hatzakis
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations! Setup is simple and once you've set it up you can move it as many times as needed. I shift the camera around every so often to find the best vantage points. Re: nightvision, works better than expected, only consideration: make sure there isn't ambient light as the camera will then automatically disable nightvision.

Reviews.Title: well worth the investment
Reviews.Author: Paul VanDuyne
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a total of eitght dropcams - they have worked well in multiple homes - providing both internal and external monitoring where ever we travel.  The installation was easy - one camera at a time - took several minutes a piece - loonger to figure out where to place the cameras and actaully attach them to their perminent locations.  Once done - they work great - showing views outside the house through exterior windows (shut off the night vision to avoid reflections).  Having the ability internally to both see and hear is a big plus.  Purchased teh 7 day backup for cameras - not very expensive for what you get and the ability to see what happened the past couple of days - even if just to see what the sun set looked like.  I have shown the dropcam app on my phone or iPad to others that quickly ask where they can get them for their homes.  A reasonably priced option for monitoring your propewrites...

Reviews.Title: Weather Cam
Reviews.Author: W. Jordan
Reviews.Content: I have had my Dropcam for about a month now, and it is great. Easiest  set up ever, it is monitoring the weather in a community  in Northern Arizona. Only disadvantage is that it eats up bandwidth in HD mode, so I leave it in non-HD mode,BIll

Reviews.Title: Dropcam is ok
Reviews.Author: Charles Perkinson
Reviews.Content: It would be better if it were more compatible with other, open standard, storage software, rather than requiring the cloud storage.  It does not support bonjour discovery.  Otherwise, the motion detection is good.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money.Not an exceptionally clear video, but is very much in tow with the current technology.Works flawlessly and is inconspicuous.Great product for nuclear families settled abroad.

Reviews.Title: Super cool for the small price!
Reviews.Author: lburgsouth
Reviews.Content: This records in HD and you can talk back through the camera. Camera alerts you via push notification to iPhone when motion detected so cool and keeps you house secure. Intruder can not destroy the video due to it being in the cloud even if the camera is destroyed.

Reviews.Title: EASY TO SET UP, WORKS AS PROMISED
Reviews.Author: Dardo Galat
Reviews.Content: The only issue, is that when the 15 days free test period is due, they would not take payment from outside the US, where I live, so, no paid plans for me.Apart from that, it works beautifully, I check it on my I phone and or computer

Reviews.Title: Jury still out
Reviews.Author: hike sedona "hikesedona"
Reviews.Content: Set this  up about a week ago.  Installation  is quite easy and initially the camera worked great.  However during the last couple  of days the camera disconnects from the router (nothing  has changed).  I unplugged and then plugged the camera back in and it took awhile and then reestablished connection.  Today, same thing .... I'm just going to  leave it as is and see what happens.I have high hopes however will wait and see what happens.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: Orelious
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to watch over my pets when I'm out of the house, and this camera has past expectations.  My family enjoys looking in on my pets and gives them peace of mind about me since I live alone.  Since Dropcam can be accessed remotely from a smartphone (I use android) it makes remote monitoring a breeze.  The camera is small and can be mounted in various positions.Recently I had a break in which took me totally by surprised.  Never thought I'd experience this in my neighborhood but they kicked in my front door (security screen next purchase).  Well behold dropcam recorded the breaking right from the ringing of the doorbell to the search and taking for a small scooter.  The police arrived before I did (thanks alarm company) and I was able to tell them I was on my way which probably did more to startle them since they thought someone was still in the house.  I got there reviewed the video and they called CSI (yes they call them that) to print the things the guy touched they also were able to see him in the video and get a good description. They asked me if I could email them the video didn't realize cops carry all the high tech phones also.  They caught the guy a few hours later.Though Dropcam wasn't suppose to be my security camera it became that and the nice thing the recording off site makes it worth it.  Had the robber took the camera the video would have still been accessible.  Nice!!I definitely recommend this product if your looking for an affordable solution for home monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up, great app support, but the simplicity ultimately limits usefulness
Reviews.Author: DaveH
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Easy setup-Access from anywhere-Apps on most all platformsCons:-Can't access directly over the local network. This is huge because I can't limit internet bandwidth by accessing directly. It's inefficient to send video to the internet and back to view locally.-The video looks awful as is. 720p needs a higher bitrate.-No ability to increase bitrate for video.-Limited by being able to access only from dropcam's software. 3rd party app support would be great.

Reviews.Title: Remote piece of mind....
Reviews.Author: Sean C. Sutton
Reviews.Content: We've had several break ins etc in our neighborhood recently. We have an alarm system but not connected to a service ($40 a month with 3 yr commitment is too much). SO yes we have a 165 decibel alarm BUT no way to know if ppl break in or are walking around.In addition to our new pit bull mix we have Drop cam now. It obviously is only for the area it can view but mine is pointed to cover the main entry, kitchen and anyone breaking in would eventually be in view of the camera. So now I have a dog (that I can remotely watch as well) and a camera that will tell me whenever there is any movement.Set up was literally 3 minutes including the iphone download. If you do not want to eat up your cell plan GB usage you can log on to the dropcam website and view from there.$99 for the year for the 7 day DVR history is a decent deal- thieves cannot get at it, no DVR you have to deal with and its there when you need it. Anyone who said that $99 for one year is too much is clueless as its MAINTENANCE free.I like this system- i set it up and have been able to check it from 10 different places so far with no issues.If security, watching kids or dogs or just awareness is important this is the best deal around.As an ex teacher- this would be cool to have in classroom to open up to parents who may want to "check in" on the class from work etc as most folks cannot do so in person.

Reviews.Title: Not quite there yet
Reviews.Author: MarkD
Reviews.Content: Hardware is pretty good, but their motion detection¬ification; software needs work. Get ready for 15 false alarm emails a day.  IR leds turning on/off -- motion alert! It would be very nice if you could lasso a part of the scene and tell it to ignore changes there. Better yet, use a little computer vision and learn detection likelihoods over the image based on users marking a motion alert as a false alarm. Maybe with a couple more software releases this product will be usable.

Reviews.Title: Great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: J. Yu
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a baby monitor that can be viewed on our iPhones and this did the trick.Setup was very easy, no installation disks needed. Installation software stored on the dropcam and can be installed when you connect it to your computer.Video quality is pretty good in lighted conditions but night vision is just OK quality, not as good as our old baby monitor.Overall, a good value considering how easy it is to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M Boyer
Reviews.Content: I received this yesterday and set it up immediately after opening the package.  Took about 20 minutes because I had to use my laptop that has been relegated to second hand status since I have an IPAD and Galaxy S3.  It requires you to connect to a device with a USB port to setup the camera.The quality of the product is exactly what I expected from all the other reviews.  The picture is good and the sound works fine.  There will be some delay in the video/sound due to this being routed through the internet.  I would maybe have liked an option for you to connect to it directly within the same LAN to improve speed, but that is a not a deal breaker.I'd recommend this to others looking for a baby monitor device like I was.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good...
Reviews.Author: chuckbobuck
Reviews.Content: I got the camera today and was surprised at how easy it was to setup and use. There are only 3 things to do on the 5 by 5 setup card and it only takes about 30 minutes including installation of the apps on the phone. I am basically very impressed.I see that there are a lot of reviewers with big issues and my complaints here are very minor. First, after you complete the setup there is no desktop shortcut to the camera. You'll need to create your own link to [...] and login. You also need to look on their website where to find info for your Android app. It is obvious to most folks, but it would be nice to know just what app to look for and where to go in the setup. I also noticed that the camera gets warm. Not really an issue, but it does.  The difference between HD on and off is minor, but the video/audio delay is less. I noticed too that the images have a purple tint in areas similar to what other users have mentioned, but I think this is because of the color difference between incandecent and fluorescent(CFL) bulbs. And yes the nightvision isn't great. It is acceptable though. In the app, the "zoom" off button is off screen at the top. Scrolling up is not what I expected to do. After changing the zoom to center and then back out the camera changed to center zoom by itself. Am I nit picking?At this point the benefits far out weigh the minor things in my review. 5 stars easily still in my book. I went through the port forwarding issues with the Foscam camera I bought before this one which only worked for a couple of weeks before changing IP address. It was a nightmare in the end.I need a low cost, easy solution to check things when I'm not home. This sure fits the bill. It looks nice too.If anything goes sour I will update, but...So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: MLR
Reviews.Content: This is my first review of any product purchased via Amazon.  I am impressed so far with the Dropcam.  It was very easy to set up, and took me all of about 10 minutes.  I needed to watch my property when I'm gone because I live quite off the beaten path. I set it up to "gaze" out a window to the entrance gate which is about 600 yards from the front of my house, it also catches my front gate and walk as well. Watched as a neighbor came in thru the gate this afternoon, and I was able to tell make, model, color and license of vehicle when they parked at the walkway.  This is only day one, no power outages yet and we get a bunch of them in the winter.  I tested to see if it would come back on if I unplugged it and it did.  Being able to "self reboot" after a power outage is important to me, they say it will.  I'll update my review after I've had it for awhile, but so far, like I said, it's a pretty impressive little gadget for the price.

Reviews.Title: The best webcam on the market.
Reviews.Author: RAI
Reviews.Content: I needed a webcam to watch my cats while I am away for a few days. They have auto feeders and water. I have the camera positioned so I can see the feeders and verify that they did get fed at the programed time. The camera is everything and more than I expected. Just before a feeding time I can pull up the camera on my iphone/pad/laptop and when the feeders drop the food I can see my two cats scurry into the room and chow down. I can even hear the crunch crunch on the audio. It has night vision so I don't need to leave lights on. I have tried other webcams and they were a total pain, you need to open a port on your router, set up a web page and more. With the Dropcam you just sign into your wifi network and log into your free account with Dropcam. It works great!

Reviews.Title: Good camera system for most users
Reviews.Author: Tony Deblauwe
Reviews.Content: I have owned multiple Dropcams for over a year now. I like them and they serve the purpose. My analysis would be:PROS:Very easy install process out of the box that doesn't require you disable your firewall to installWon't run into manual fixed IP problems for remote accessWorks fine on mobile OS (I tested Android, iPhone and iPad)HD version gives wider viewing areaNight vision is greatMaking video clips is easyCONS:Fixed lenses; would be better to have swivel camerasCommon delay in access; there will be delay no matter what over WiFi but sometimes accessing from the desktop or the phone you will get connection lost for each camera even if the main view of cameras is fine.Annoying that it asks you almost every time to upgrade even if you have; better on mobile and I am a subscriber to the basic monthly service (not the DVR)No outdoor versionI have tested other cameras from other vendors including the more expensive true security kind that come with a DVR. There is always a trade off in what you want. I think Dropcam is great for most users who want basic access to their home. Still not sure having tested access from multiple sources with business strength bandwidth versus home where the lags in network connectivity come from but there have been occasions where Dropcams feed has been totally down. If you want something ultra reliable you probably have to invest a lot more money or go through a security company for that. If you want an easy to install, easy to access, and decent remote camera system Dropcam is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful product
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Brooke "innkeeper"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!Plusses:* VERY easy set up* The HD setting renders clear and sharp video.* The iphone app works great and is very convenientMinuses:* No way to use the dropcam outside. Dropcam -Please develop an indoor/outdoor camera!* No way to see multiple cameras all at once on a grid - a limitation if you have more than one drop camFinal word: After researching all the other surveillance cameras that Amazon offers, this is the best. Ilook forward to see it develop further.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam for watching puppy!!
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT camera for watching a new little puppy that stays at home by itself throughout the day!  Anybody who is needing or wanting a camera to watch their pet should definitely buy this camera!  More than enough if you are just wanting to see what they are doing.  Don't listen to any negative reviews, trust me and buy it!Drew

Reviews.Title: Uhhhhh...Nice!!
Reviews.Author: myrideisa
Reviews.Content: Incredibly easy and fast set-up. Took longer for my computer to boot up than to set up the camera for viewing on my phone and laptop.  Not really up to my concept of HD but still puts out a good image.  Really got this for the wife to check up on her cats when she's away from the house.  And, it's positioned so we can also see a portion of the backyard and therefore what the weather is like (in the daytime).  It's advertised that you can speak through your phone (or miked laptop/desktop) through the camera's speaker) and from my experience you can, but it's really very sporadic and difficult.  Some of the words get cut off.  Don't expect to hold a conversation. There's too much lag (4-5 seconds)and that's to be expected with the software/hardware architecture and at this price.  The audio from the camera microphone to your phone or laptop is good to very good.There are two issues that you must be aware of.  Why there is no app for the iPad is beyond irritating.  There is an app for the iPhone and Android that works great.  This MUST be fixed.  And, after the initial 2-week trial period you'll have to subscribe to Dropcam for the recording feature. This is something like $10/month for 1 week history and $30/month for 30-day history. I'm close on those figures.  For now, I'm opting for real-time viewing only.  If I had money to burn I'd definitely go for the 1-week history.If, by chance, you do not have an Amazon credit card (Visa), then you may be able to save even more by applying and then getting a gift card that is applied to the cost of the camera.  My cost for the camera was about $85 and change.All in all, this is a very good camera for the price.  NOW, Dropcam needs to make an all-weather version and I'll buy that as soon as it hits the market.  4 stars for no iPad support.  5 stars when that happens.

Reviews.Title: Great product! A must buy!
Reviews.Author: drglacy
