Reviews.Content: I actually have two cameras for my security system. The dropcam is just as good as my higher priced camera. It does not have a pan/tilt, but that is fine. it is reliable, clear and work consistently well. This is a good buy. it is easy to sync and takes 3 minutes to set up

Reviews.Title: A superior video monitoring camera - better than Foscam
Reviews.Author: Bryan Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I've used Foscam cameras for video security in the past - but they often fall into disuse because they are so hard to configure. If one gets unplugged, it's a pain to have to set it up again.The dropcam, on the other hand, is super-simple to set up. It took me less than a few minutes, and I have live HD streaming from our stock room. I'd highly recommend dropcam to anyone looking to do video security.

Reviews.Title: Better than the rest
Reviews.Author: Richard  Hardison
Reviews.Content: I have  security cameras with Life Lock Security, the VueZone and Y-Cam.Finally a really good camera.  This camera view is clear, dark light capable and audio.....and did I mention incredibly easy to set up and dependable.The only and I mean only disappointment is that it's recommended for indoor use.  But I use one outside in a protected area with no problems, yet.

Reviews.Title: Great security camera
Reviews.Author: GMacDonald
Reviews.Content: A great camera for anyone leaving their home for extended periods.  Only weakness is that it is overly sensitive to motion and/or sound (depending on how it is set up) and you end up getting a lot of (false) alerts.  A sensitivity control would be useful for controlling this.  Otherwise, Great Product!

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Review
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: The Dropcam was very easy to setup. It works great and I am very satisfied with it. I loaded the android app on my phone. That was easy also. I was able to monitor my house while I was in Europe for 3 weeks. It definetly eased my mind knowing everything was ok.  The night time viewing is very good.

Reviews.Title: Simple and easy to use
Reviews.Author: eo
Reviews.Content: I wanted cameras without the hassle of wiring, DVR's or having a computer on all the time.  The setup for the cameras took less than 15 minutes from unpackaging to placing somewhere and connecting to the WiFi network.  Then they have dropcam mobile apps for my phone which allow me to turn the cameras on/off, zoom in on the live picture, view motion events, talk through the camera to family at home and turn the night vision to on/off/auto as well as other camera options.  The website then provides a variety of other features and considering the price to record off site, it's cheaper than a monitored security system.The only cons I can think of are when the WiFi connection drops or your internet provider is having issues then video feed is gone. It would be nice to have an SD card slot to record more video in case the connection drops.  I'm not sure how much video the cameras can record locally then transmit to the servers.  Overall its a great camera for the price, features and simplicity.

Reviews.Title: Good when it works, but mine has bugs...
Reviews.Author: Irvine Guy
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 Dropcams nearly a month ago to watch my cat and my garage (provides assurance that I shut the garage door).Here are some advantages and disadvantages I experienced.Advantages:1.  Easy setup2.  Satisfactory video and audio quality.  Video quality is affected by lighting conditions.  The quality looked good when I tested it pointing outside of my house. However, for everyday inside usage where lighting conditions aren't as good, the video quality is just okay.3.  You can turn the camera off and on remotely.4.  The DVR feature is nice, but too costly for me at $10 a month per camera.Disadvantages:1.  Bugs!2.  On one camera, while on night vision, I couldn't make out anything.  It's hard to explain but everything was blurred, grayed out.  I had to reset the camera to fix it.3.  My other camera loses its connection.  The light blinks yellow.  Its weird because this camera is closest to my wireless router versus my other camera.  Sometimes, I am able to reconnect after turn on and off the camera under the settings.  Other times, I have to reset the camera.I really want to like the camera, but the bugs have me worried.  I'm considering exchanging the one that is losing connection before my return window expires but I'm worried I might end up with a unit that is even worse.Hopefully, if these issues are commonplace, Dropcam will work to fix them.  The product is a good concept, reliability is not so good.

Reviews.Title: DropcamHD
Reviews.Author: David W Findley
Reviews.Content: This is a very excellent HD Camera.  It was so easy to setup and install.  The picture is VERY high quality.  I ordered one camera, then a second and now I have ordered two more.  I use two at our lake cabin with one pointed out to the lake and in the main house living room.  This is a great asset to monitoring our place away from home.  I do the same back our primary residence.  And the price is right.  I also have signed on to the DVR program for one of the cameras and considering adding one or more cameras to the DVR plan.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous.... No Brainer
Reviews.Author: grtnyc
Reviews.Content: Exceeded all expectations: super easy to set up, relatively inexpensive, does everything as advertised.. Valuable asset for any home/ business.  Read about it first in the technology section of New York Times, ordered it on spec and installed immediately upon delivery.  A week later, there was a follow-up article in a different section of the NYT, showing the devise in action, with still photo of a burgler "caught" red handed by technology.  Great for people who travel alot or just want some extra piece of mind without a major security system etc... very impressed..

Reviews.Title: Already Registered to Another User
Reviews.Author: PAD "PAD"
Reviews.Content: Wow, when I received my unit, and plugged it in, I couldn't activate it on my account.  After a call to DropCam (quick and easy) they told me that the unit was previously activated on a different account, so it sounds like the unit that Amazon shipped me was NOT NEW.This is a bit bizarre, and something that I would have expected from Amazon (who I've had absolutely great luck with over the years).

Reviews.Title: unbelievably good
Reviews.Author: tulio12
Reviews.Content: Complete opposition to Esky c5900(I've dealt with both).Dropcam was highly praised,but it's so much different(in a good sense)from c5900,that no words can describe a difference in terms of practicality,internet and OS support,ease of use,fast and easy setup and quality.I don't know about other cameras,but I can tell that this product is close(or is) to the best.There are opinions that it overheats.So far it's cool and feels absolutely normal.I was afraid of overheating,reading couple of reviews,but thahkfully it's not the case.Five stars to true professionals

Reviews.Title: Dropcam is Great
Reviews.Author: toledoone
Reviews.Content: I have both the original and the HD with audio and both are a great product, the Dropcam service with video on line is fantastic.  I can see what's going on on both cameras on my I phone, my Nexus 7 and any computer for that matter.  What a great product and great product support as well.  It is not very often these days that I am totally satisfied with a purchase but I am with Dropcam. John.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam HD
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: The Dropcam HD was easy to install, even on a PC. The image quality is excellent. Night vision is good. The field of view is quite wide which I prefer. The zoom feature allows you to look at a portion of the field of vision which is nice. The audio quality in a large room is not great if there is any background noise. In a quiet room it is better. The recording works well as does the clip making feature. When I added a second camera I began noticing bandwidth problems which show up as dropouts in the recordings. This can be corrected by turning one camera off when not using it. A suggested improvement would be the ability to take snapshots at a user defined rate to lower the bandwidth usage. Another suggestion would be to be able to record on the camera that is turned on if you have multiple cameras and one recording service contract. I am very pleased with the product and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Easy Set Up & Excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: Robert Curran
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first Dropcam to monitor the driveway and it was so easy to set up and the picture was so good, I bought two more to cover the front and back doors. The alert system works great and I would recommend the seven day cloud storage of your cameras ($99 per year for the first camera, $49 per camera after that). I should note that all my cameras are stationed indoors (I have small windows above all the doors) -- they haven't come out with a weatherized version (yet -- are you listening, Dropcam?) Also, I need to upgrade my 5-year old wireless router since occasionally, the driveway camera, which is furthest from my router (about 40 feet, through several walls), loses its wifi signal. But the range is pretty good (could be a little better) and with a longer-range router, it should be fine. I really like that I can monitor the cameras on my iPhone, even with just a 3G signal. Dropcam has been really good about updating their app with new features (twice since the camera was released six months ago). Plus, you can set up the app to alert you when the camera detects motion or sound (or both). That comes in real handy when I'm traveling. Once, I was 600 miles away and was alerted to the driveway cam and saw that the oil company was trying to fill my tank in the spring (and I only need oil for heat). I quickly called the company and saved myself a premature charge for overpriced oil I wouldn't be using for another five months! The savings right there paid for all three cameras!

Reviews.Title: Dropcam - quick and easy setup & viewing
Reviews.Author: Ed from Monterey Park
Reviews.Content: The Dropcam is reasonably priced and the service is only a few dollars per month. I have 2 Dropcams - one facing the front of the house and another in the backyard. The one in the front of the house faces the porch and the garage door, so I use it to monitor anyone who approaches the mailbox, anyone who steps on our driveway or knocks on our door, or to see if I remembered to close the garage door. I can view everything from the Dropcam application on my Android cellphone. It is useful for knowing exactly when UPS/Fedex packages and mail get delivered as well as for recording the faces of bogus door-to-door solicitors who occasionally make their rounds in the neighborhood.The Dropcam in the backyard is mostly for entertainment to watch the family pet dog's antics. We catch him digging holes in the garden and just tearing the yard up to suit himself.So, for my 2 Dropcams, it only cost me about $14.95/mo. for the 7-day's worth of DVR. That's all I need. By the way, the initial setup was very easy; it only took a few minutes. The video is pretty nice considering that it is shooting video through a double-pane window. My only disappointment is that I assumed that the night-vision would record right through the glass window, but apparently the infrared lights just reflect off of the glass and I don't really get any night vision. I suppose though that if I set the camera up outside that the night vision feature would work.I have looked at other video monitoring options, and they all seem so difficult to figure out. They seem to require optional cabling or special parts that make it difficult to even figure out how much it'll cost you in the end. Overall, I highly recommend the Dropcam cameras for their ease-of-use and affordability. Plus, in my opinion, their customer service is outstanding. Go buy one or two. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: I mounted my with 2 self adhesive business card magnets, easy install
Reviews.Author: FLMartin
Reviews.Content: Purchased 3 dropcams and we have metal doors, i used one magnet just for the dropcam itself and I use 2 for more strength if using all the hardware it came with. this allows us the flexibility of putting it in other places very quickly or removing when certain guests may prefer it off. I love the fact that the software (when on a subscription plan) updates the camera for improvements, etc. I wish there was a 10 day or 15 day plan, the 30 day plan at time of this review was $300 for annual and $100 for annual on 7 day, in other words one plan is 3 times the cost than the other. This ironically reminds me of dropbox service that is free up to 2gb or offers 200gb for $10 per month, most would pay dropbox $4 per month for 25gb, etc. Apple and Google both offer storage plans with many increments to accomodate all their clients. Dropcam, like dropbox, offers a cheap/free plan and than a very expensive plan. A 15 day $200 plan for first camera and $100 for 2nd camera would be a welcomed addition to this very unique product.

Reviews.Title: Best Available Security Camera
Reviews.Author: BWJR "BWJR"
Reviews.Content: I have been a Dropcam user now for about two years. Between my home, vacation home and business I now use more than 14 Dropcams.I bought them first as a low cost solution to try to monitor my vacation home, over 1,100 miles away from me. The alerts I choose to receive help me more than ANY security system could ever do. I can listen to sounds, watch the level of a swimming pool, and check to see that the maintanience workers are on site when they say they are.At my retail sales business, I can check on traffic, use for security monitoring, and can even post the camera as a public camera for customer viewing on my website. All of that I did myself, with a short amount of setup time and a very small optional monthly monitoring fee.For day to day security I monitor vehicle key storage, important file cabinets and inventory control and am comfortable knowing that I have up to a weeks worth of recording to check on problems that my arise.I own "wired" security cameras as well but I originally purchased these so I could monitor with my iPhone. Now I would never go back. To replace my dropcams with a similar featured wired system would cost in excess of ten thousand dollars. And with my drop cams, when my needs change I can pick up and move the cameras myself. I couldn't do that with a hard wired system.I think dropcams are one of the best inventions in recent times.

Reviews.Title: Very good wireless internet camera
Reviews.Author: A. Massey
Reviews.Content: I have tried several cameras for remote monitoring via the internet and all of them were terrible.  They had terrible picture quality, poor field of view and worst of all they were crazy hard to connect to my router/wifi.When I heard about the Dropcam I decided to try it and if it did not work, I would give up on my idea of being able to monitor my home while I was away.When the Dropcam arrived I plugged in into my computer with the included USB cable and in 30 seconds it was configured to use my home WiFi.  I unplugged the USB from the computer and carried the camera to another room and plugged the camera into AC power (with the supplied USB and power adapter).  I downloaded the Dropcam app for my iPhone and in 10 seconds I was seeing the cameras image (and hearing it) on my phone.It is so simple to use I was able to tell my wife to download the Dropcam app for her Android phone and without any help she had it working in a minute.The iPhone app is great, I can turn the camera on/off I can digitally zoom in or out, I can listen to the room or even speak through the camera from my phone.The best feature is that the camera will send an alert to your phone when it detects movement.  This is very useful.  I have the camera setup now in my garage so I can monitor my garage doors to be sure I have closed them.  But it is so easy to move the camera I can change the location without any problems.The only negative thing I can say is that I wish the Dropcam folks would provide about 5 seconds of video when the camera detects movement.  They do allow users to purchase a DVR type service that can record many hours of video with event markers where motion occurred, but the price for this service is pretty high.  I just want them to include (for free) 5 seconds of the last movement event.  Then this would be the perfect camera!

Reviews.Title: simple and easy
Reviews.Author: Susan Barmess
Reviews.Content: My dropcam was up and working a couple minutes after it arrived. The picture was crystal clear.  I love the night vision but it should be noted when you have the camera placed facing out a window you will only see the flash on the glass when it comes on rendering the picture useless until the night vision is turned off. We have placed ours in a nook outside well under a protective eve (against manufactures recommendation for indoor use only) with great success. We have it watching his business parking lot and because of it's wide angle it includes several other business and a rather dangerous intersection where it has recorded proof of why so many bad accidents happen there. The sound feature seems rather useless.  While we can hear everything fairly clearly I have found when I speak into it from home I am told it's garbled. I wish it came with a feature to turn off the wireless and plug in a direct network cable. There seems to be some unknown interference and the camera is often offline, disconnected from the network even though it is only 20' from the router and the internet connection is still on and has a strong signal.I intend to purchase more of them because they are so simple to use and access from anywhere. It is well worth the price, and you get more than your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam
Reviews.Author: Ed Dench
Reviews.Content: Easily setup gives good picture can receive from  anywhere  I am in Japan and can watch my dropcam  Would like the talk feature to be a bit louder  on the dropcam

Reviews.Title: user friendly ++
Reviews.Author: The College Counselor
Reviews.Content: I become easily frustrated with the time and effort to set up wifi related devices.Dropcam is,by far,the easiest installation i've ever encountered.The setup took less than 4 minutes and the product quality is flawless.When the grandchildren take a nap at our house,I can see them crystal clear.I can hear every sound they utter.If I choose, I can even talk back to them-----all from my ipad in any part of my home!

Reviews.Title: Great idea, needs work
Reviews.Author: Monte
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the first Dropcam and pre-ordered the new HD at first chance. The video quality is outstanding. The produce design is great. The size is good and all the parts for mounting the camera are well designed and do the job. Set-up is elegant and simple. I placed the new Dropcam HD fairly near the older model I had mounted. My WiFi coverage is good in this location for any other device I own. The new HD keeps going off line. I returned the first unit and received a replacement. The replacement doesn't go offline quite as often. However, it does go offline. This is very annoying, especially if I am going to be away or traveling for several days. This last time when it went offline I did nothing and it came back on after several hours. This is my biggest issue with this device.Customer service is outstanding. I always get prompt replies to email or telephone contacts. Customer service seems very quick to offer a replacement, but not too interested in trying to find out what could be causing my problem. This doesn't help me make any adjustments with a new unit to try to figure out what could be improved. Now my unit is out of warranty.The web site is pretty but confusing. I could see a discount offered for a year's recording, but I could not find any way to get the discount. I finally called customer service. They again promptly solved my problem and gave me the discount, but I haven't seen any changes on the web site.I would like to see a more reliable product, or a better explanation of what to do when the DropcamHD goes offline. Does it have  built-in error correcting? Can I just wait for it to come back? Is there a way to get the unit to self-correct if it doesn't? Now, it isn't recording. Do I call customer service? Did they forget that I am paid for a year? Am I the only one with these issues?So...great product, great customer service, just not quite "finished" or "ready for prime time", or reliable as I would like.

Reviews.Title: Better than anything else, still problems
Reviews.Author: wilson
Reviews.Content: Price is right, set up is easy as promised. Infrared night vision is very goodWebsite based monitoring on the pc is easy. Love the audio and the HD images. The cloud storage concept is excellent, (The burglars can't steal the images of their own burglary.) Pricing is fair.Problems:1) wifi range is disappointing. If the camera is not line of sight to the router, I get frequent cutoffs that require power cycling the camera to re-establish monitoring. Replacing the camera did not help, (although tech support was friendly, helpful, and prompt.)2) The video driver for android is pre-beta. Red/green/blue images are offset, making the image mostly useless. Also, the time line that is so handy on the pc website view is not seen on my android view.3) choices for being informed of video or audio events (email or text) are either all or nothing. Being able to limit messaging to particular times of day would be very helpful (I don't need a text every time my secretary makes a copy).4) a weather proof housing attachment/option would make the camera much more useful for home and office.5) the public cameras are pathetic: tired puppies or office window views.So, a promising product, but a work in progress. I look forward to the promised improved android app, and I'll keep looking for the best location for the camera that doesn't cut out.

Reviews.Title: Okay starting to change my mind
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Initial review: 2 start. Okay, good IP camera and high quality video. Now for the rough parts. Yes this is a good video feed, but it also causes my entire bandwidth to be sucked up and my Netflix has to rebuffer. Sure you say, fix your dial up! But I have a regular 7-12 MBps download and 1 mb upload. Well upgrade then?! Wait this should not be showing the outside of my house every 30 seconds. I only want real motion, cars, people and animals. Why do I have a time lapse of every minute? Not efficient use of storage or having to scroll through a days' worth of video. So, I made several adjustments to the video and it is still uploads way to much. So, the motion sensor is way too sensitive I think. The night vision is cool, but you have to be ready for the IR circular lights to be on all the time. Also, the video device gets extremely hot. Almost to the dangerous point if you leave it somewhere concealed and not enough air to circulate. So, I will have to forgo this device. I would rather have a timer that turns it on and off during certain periods I can choose. 24x7 is not my intent. Sure 8 could by a power supply with a timer, but I already paid 150 bucks for this thing only to have to spend 10 bucks to do something that should be simple.new review: 3 stars and getting better...I went ahead and turned the device back on. This time I turned off the mic.  Mmm this change seems to make a huge difference with every motion detected. Now trees can blow or cars pass by my house and I do not receive an alert. This is a good thing. I only want "real" activity. So, I will post more when I give it the whole weekend. If I only get the "real alerts", than I will be much happier. As for the heat, it is still hot. As for a timer? I can only hope the maker can invent a way to do this. If I can turn the device off, shouldn't I be able to have an app that can have a timer setting? If so, this would be a perfect product and I would give it 5 starts.

Reviews.Title: It's bad! bad, bad! Worst product I've had in years.
Reviews.Author: Stanley Ferrand
Reviews.Content: Let's make it short. I've never written a review on amazon, and I've purchased over $50,000 in tech stuff on Amazon. I can not be more dissatisfied with this camera.Two cameras in two weeks, first one the image looked purple. The second could not keep a connection. When I was away from home and tried to view from my smartphone, I was not able to. I tried everything, purchased new Apple Extreme router (which is one of the most solid routers out there), changed the wifi channels and tried all of them with no difference. Keep in mind the router is 8-10 feet away, with no obstruction in the way. All of my other wifi connected gear have had connection issues.Every tech company has "tech support" right? Not this one. Call their toll free number, it will "ring" no one will ever answer, I tried at all times of the day on different days. Now what about web, chat or email support? They sure must have that right? The answer is NO! Submitted a "ticket", but no one ever replied. That was 9 days ago! So my last resort, was Twitter. If they saw this on their page they will have no choice than to respond right? NOPE, their twitter messages are controlled and filtered, so my message never showed up on their twitter page. They only show whatever they want people to see.One more thing, they want you to believe and force you that storing your recorded video online they force you to pay a monthly fee for "DVR" cloud services. I understand that my video is safer online but give me a choice. And the main problem with this camera is the fact that you are forced to stream your video straight to their servers, so when their servers are down (which is constantly, you can check their twitter account) you cant access your camera. Other cameras like Foscam, stream your video directly from your IP address.I don't dislike the dropcam, I hate it!

Reviews.Title: Don't Waste Your Money
Reviews.Author: K W Peck
Reviews.Content: After dealing with the difficulty of setting up Foscam IP cameras, I thought these cameras would be a godsend.  Easy setup, plus DVR capability in the Cloud, what's not to like.  I purchased 3 of these and placed them in a 2nd home about 2 hours from my primary home.  They continually go offline and register as disconnected.  Dropcam tells you it is likely interference, but another camera a few feet away does not go offline.  Once it is disconnected, my only choice is to drive 2 hours each way to the 2nd home to unplug it, then plug it back in, which seems to resolve the problem for a few days.  The cameras are virtually useless in low light.  If you have a bright light situation where you can easily get to the camera to reset it, then it is probably OK.  Overall the Foscam IP cameras are 10 times more reliable for staying online, perform excellent in low light, but are also 10 times more difficult to set up.  We need an IP camera with the good features of both the Dropcam and Foscam combined, but so far I have not found one.

Reviews.Title: Totally dependent on the manufacturer's service
Reviews.Author: Ken from CA.
Reviews.Content: There is no way to access the camera directly - it must go through DropCam's servers. You can't even look at the video over your LAN, it must go out to the Internet, up to their server, and back down to your computer. You cannot manage it directly, you have to go through their server.This camera gives DropCam the ability to access your network.  For many people, that isn't an issue, but for those who are more security conscious, they should allow customers to access it directly (and if you're buying a surveillance camera, you are security conscious - you should protect your network as much as you protect the rest of your home).  Also, there is no reason why a third party should have access to your video feed.  I don't trust them to keep it private, no matter what they say.This is not an inexpensive camera, it should have the capability for local management, without using their service.  They obviously want you to sign up for the recurring monthly fee - they don't allow local DVR storage, and use the lame excuse "it's for your own protection".It will be the last product I ever buy from this company.  I would give it zero stars if Amazon would let me.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam is my Nanny Cam
Reviews.Author: Tata's Mom
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest invention for all parents who wish they could stay at home with their little ones, but can't afford to do so.  The Dropcam lets me check on my daughter whenever I am not home from my computer, but more conveniently, from my cell phone using the downloadable free app.  My husband and I are addicted to checking on her when we're both gone and also spying on who is caring for her to make sure she is being properly cared for.  I love that I can hear her through the Dropcam and can talk to her if I want too.  It's easier than talking on the phone because she can't hang up on me accidentally.  This also comes in handy when we're out of town and want to check on our pets.  The quality is excellent day or night and it really has made my time away from her easier and helps me feel like I'm a part of her day, even when I'm away.I would recommend this product to everyone.  It is one of the best investments that you'll make, especially if you're a human or furry friend parent.

Reviews.Title: Teenage parenting necessity
Reviews.Author: Rita Thompson
Reviews.Content: After coming home from vacation to find some missing items in the liquor cabinet and a strange "woodsy" smell in the curtains, we finally decided to -- gulp -- start "surveilling" our kids. Call me a bad parent, or a great one ... I don't care, I just want to know what's going on. And, being a lawyer, the liability issues of having other people's children in our house unsupervised make me cringe.We put one Dropcam at each entryway, front door and back door, and one in the living room. I was worried at first since some people complained about the wireless range in the reviews, but our connection is in the attic about as far away as you can get from the front door, and it's been working fine for a couple of weeks now...The iPhone app is nice and works fine, though it could be easier to go back in the recordings. I usually use the app for a quick check in and the website for a more in-depth look. A big plus is that it seems like things are being updated rather quickly, I've noticed new settings and other things popping up, which is a good sign.I emailed support for a small issue I was having with the website, and they responded in just a few hours with some helpful instructions on upgrading my web browser which seemed to fix it right up. Thanks Alex!Oh, and the setup! So easy! If I can do it, anybody can...

Reviews.Title: Caught a burglar, got my stuff back. LOVE this product
Reviews.Author: T. Blackford
Reviews.Content: I never expected to be the one to write this, but the police just handed me back our laptops, TV, stereo, jewelry, etc... and to top it off ... our Dropcam!A few weeks ago some low life broke into our home while we were out for the weekend and took nearly everything of value, including some heirloom jewelry with particular sentimental value to my wife (belonged to her Mom). We just installed the Dropcam a couple of months ago, but even it was taken as well ... you'd think that would be "game over", but not for Dropcam! I didn't really put 2 and 2 together on why the cloud service was a benefit when we purchased, but it turns out that all of the video was still safe in our account!I can't tell you how weirdly relieving it was just to be able to see who did it ... vs the complete helplessness we would have had otherwise.We made a few clips and sent them to the local Police Department, thinking that at least they would have some leads if other houses were broken into. It turns out this chump had a rap sheet longer than my arm and was well known to some of the officers ... they went to his last known address and found all of our stuff in his garage, probably ready to be pawned or fenced... but instead we got 100% of it back.Thank you, thank you, thank you Dropcam! I can't believe this guy took even the Dropcam itself and yet we were still able to catch him using the cloud video. I think this is one of the best investments in a product I've ever made!

Reviews.Title: Bad camera and bad customer support
Reviews.Author: dropusers
Reviews.Content: Got this Dropcam HD camera after 3 weeks of waiting.  Finally i got this camera on Tuesday.  The setup was straight forward and within minute i am able to view my camera online.  But it only worked for 5 minutes and then shut off.  The camera was very hot so decided to let it cold down.  Tried to power it up after 30 minutes but still not able to connect back to my wireless network and no LED light.  Then I tried to connected it back through USB to my laptop (both MAC and PC) but didn't show up as a flash drive.  Sent an email on Wednesday morning to technical support.  After waiting for 5 days with no response i tried to send another email on the following Monday to technical suport.  After 24 hours still no response.  The question is does Dropcam has technical support department at all?  This is the worse experience i have ever encounter with a tech company.

Reviews.Title: If you want streaming privately or publicly the DROPCAM is for you!!
Reviews.Author: Jmcclow
Reviews.Content: Every now and then I take the time from a busy day to write a review. This is one of those times. I am building an experimental aircraft and wanted to share the build with a live stream. There are not many easy ways to do this. Not many inexpensive ways to do this either! I was researching live stream services but they all required a huge monthly fee to use their service and it wasnt a plug and play application.I kept searching!I came across dropcam while about to give up. If I can suggest onething to drop cam it would be to do more SEO on your website to make it easier to find you. Once I did find it I was sold. The only thing I wasnt sure of is if we could stream publicly so I sent a support ticket and within an hour had an answer. It does allow for public streaming directly from my homes wireless connection.I think that little tibdit would be useful on their website for people looking like me. I couldnt find if public streaming was available but once they said yes I was sold. I got the cam a few days after ordering. It is in HD, it has night vision, it has two way communication and it is exactly what people want. an easy plug and play streaming cam with quality video.I got it home and connected it to my laptop to set it up. In about 30 seconds it discovered my network and it was done. I placed it in my workshop and now have fully HD public or provate stream of my aircraft construction.I would bet if the company spent more on google adwords advertising or did more organic seo to make it easier to find in a websearch everyone would own one of these. It is the GoPro of streaming video. Everyone who wants to have access to their homes while not there can be alerted to noise or motion, put it in a aircraft hangar to watch your half million dollar aircraft, put it on your boat, put it on your babysitter. It is perfect.I am duly impressed. To see for yourself feel free to check out our live stream here: [...] if amazon breaks the link you can go here dropc[.]am/p/DmdiKo  just remove the brackets [.] I placed at the "." it is amazingGreat product. Happy customer! Happy to share our construction with the world!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Kevin McAuliffe
Reviews.Content: Been using it for months then they upgraded the software and it sucks....drops every 10 minutes.  Do not use as a baby cam.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, no function
Reviews.Author: Flour~de~Lis
Reviews.Content: Originally, I was so pleased when I purchased this because I read from previous reviews how easy the set up was. However, the problem lies in the fact that the DropCam needs to be very close to the router in order to work properly. If the camera is not close enough it will blink in a yellow or red light and display a message stating that it is "Disconnected". I have FIOS high speed internet and so speed was not an issue. However, the camera kept lagging and the eventually displayed the "Disconnected" message. I tried placing the camera is various places, as recommended on the box, that were distant from any kind of interference. I have a small apartment and the only place where it would poorly work was in the room where I had the router and then eventually disconnected. It became too frustrating and I just decided to send back.

Reviews.Title: Cant view remotely on browsers, and customer svc not responsive
Reviews.Author: Michael Goldenberg "goldie"
Reviews.Content: The camera seems solid enough, and works well when I'm on a laptop connected to my own wifi at home, or from our Android phones when out of the house.However I've tried viewing from work and other locations via a laptop, using 3 different browsers (chrome, firefox, IE) with all the updates they recommend (plugins and flash) and still just see a spinning 'buffering' type wheel.  Two calls/emails to customer service have since gone unanswered.Was about to buy more of these but now I just might send it back since without being able to view remotely, just isnt useful to me.Will update review if I actually hear back from them (and they help me get it working)UPDATE 4/15/14Dropcam did indeed get back in touch with me eventually and provide helpful guidance.  Turns out my company had a firewall preventing me from viewing.  The firewall has since been dropped and I am able to view my other dropcam (dropcam pro).  However now the original dropcam drops its connection to my router constantly, or simply doesn't connect.  Even when I place it just a couple feet from the router, it wont connect, whereas the new Dropcam Pro works fine even from much farther away.I've contacted Dropcam today about this connection problem and will wait to hear back to update.  I believe the camera is maybe about a year old.  Hopefully something didn't fry, what with the heat it generates (mine gets pretty hot, but they say that's normal).  All in all the idea is great, but I feel like maybe my original just has had its share of issues (firewall notwithstanding).  And the Pro is working great.  I'm raising my review to 3 stars because its a great product if it works consistently.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: tmunch
Reviews.Content: super easy set up 3 simple steps bought foscams and returned the immediatly they r junk compared to these I have one in living room and one in kitchen use the to keep an eye on grandpa they r hd and have a really good picture you can download app to your phone and veiw live from anywhere they record and you can go back and watch what happened last night they also send alerts to your phone when any motion or sound is dedected by camera infared to see in dark at night and the also have 2 way audio (which needs improvement) i gave only 4 stars because audio does not work that well when yoou r trying to have a 2 way conversation but otherwise audio sound is good i would recommened these to anyone (i also got to see which one of my dog was doing his business on the floor in the middle of the night) Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service with so so hardware
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I bought two dropcam HD cameras in December 2012. For the first few months they both worked pretty well.  Then I started having issues with the night vision on both cameras (two separate issues).  I emailed Dropcam and they gave me a recommendation to resolve the one issue but it did not work.  They did not provide any recommendations for resolving the second issue.  I emailed them back that this did not resolve the issue and I never received a response back.  I sent another email but again never heard back so I called them and left a message.  I yet again never heard back from Dropcam.  The cameras are very easy to set-up and look great but after a couple of months they both started to malfunction (ex. night vision & staying connected).  The customer support/service is terrible. I am very disappointed that Dropcam does not stand behind their product.  I would not recommend this product to family or friends.ticket #39604Update: 2/26/2013I received and email from Dropcam a few hours after posting my review.  They will be replacing my two defective cameras with brand new ones.  Hopefully the new cameras will be free of any issues (night vision & staying connected to the internet).  I will update my review after using the new cameras for a few months.  I would like to thank Dropcam for standing behind their product.

Reviews.Title: terrible set and service
Reviews.Author: Harry Wynn "Mike reeves"
Reviews.Content: They have a robot that keeps acting like they are going to help you anytime but they never, never. NEVER help.

Reviews.Title: Bad Direct Customer Support
Reviews.Author: HughReview
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but look at those from others to determine whether I will make a purchase.First, let me say that the direct customer service is supposed to be available beginning at 6:00am. I didn't get any support! I wouldn't suggest that you buy this product--find another with better support because when you have issues or need make adjustments they are not helpful. I tried to email and I was given "some" assistance and then asked to email again. In all honesty, a start-up with a pretty good product should deal with creating a good support team "before" trying to sell a product.I had issues with a "purple haze" that appeared over the video (after several days) and I was told that I should return it to Amazon. I did and when I tried to log on again to the DropCam website I couldn't. I tried a new email and still never got access nor was I able to avail myself of the two week test of their video services. Bad service!DEVICES: I had the original device (it had purple haze after a few days), then I contacted Amazon and got another device and couldn't log on (after trying my original account and two other accounts).I am looking for another device. I firmly believe that in time (maybe a year 2014) things will be better.

Reviews.Title: Poor Performance and No Customer Support Resolved By Mgr.
Reviews.Author: Domingo R Monteiro
Reviews.Content: I installed this camera last month and subscribed to their DVR service at $9.95 per month.  It worked as described, except that the wireless connection would be lost at random times during the day or night for several minutes or more before the camera would automatically reconnect to my home network.  Dropcam's support suggested that I needed to upgrade my Flash Player, which I did, but that did not solve the problem.  I tried moving the camera to a different location, closer to my router, without success, until I moved it upstairs and mounted the camera high on the wall. (My router is downstairs)  The wireless connection seems to be stable in its current location.Then I made a support request asking Dropcam to apply a "promotional code" that I received from Amazon.com for "3 free months of DVR PLUS service".  I had tried previously, without success, to follow instructions included in the email from Amazon.  At first, I got a quick response from Dropcam support offering to give me a "complimentary" 3 free months of service, if I would just provide them with the serial number of my camera.  Since I complied and gave them the number, Dropcam support has not responded to any further communications that I have attempted by phone or email!I would not recommend this camera to any of my friends, because of the poor customer support.  Plus, without the ability to record video and sound, except by subscription to Dropcam's service, the camera is practically useless.UPDATE:  Shortly after this review appeared on Amazon, a Dropcam Support manager took action to correct the problem, restoring my DVR service, and offering me a total of 6 months DVR PLUS service free of any monthly charges.  I have accepted his apology and acknowledged my appreciation of the offer.  My camera is now functioning as advertised.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED REVIEW!
Reviews.Author: Pharm4Life
Reviews.Content: UPDATED FEB 12TH, 2013okay, i spent the past week using the dropcam, and the notification did start to pick backup after initial installation problems (see below). I think the dropcam is set on default to send notification per 15 to 20mins intervals. For example, if motion detection triggers a notification now, then the next notification would be sent after 15 to 20mins. I assume that dropcam did this on default to avoid clogging up their servers. You are able to choose whether to receive notification via iphone, ipad, ipod, or email. The motion detection is quite impressive since I set it up in my living room that covers the front door which is 2 windows away. The camera still able to catches the motion even through TWO WINDOWS.I would rate the resolution as close to HD but not quite. It suffers quality problem when in total darkness but it is still very good. Though, don't expect true HD quality like you get in a hdtv these days.How far can you place this from your wireless router you say? I have an apple airport express, and the drop cam must be placed within around 50ft in order to use it without dropped connections. Initially, I had so much dropped connections when I put the dropcam from the router with a bathroom and a bedroom between them.Overall, this is a good camera but there are certain limitations in how far you can place it from your router, and depending on the floor plan of your house, you may need to buy a wifi extender. I am raising the rating from 2 stars to 4 stars after about another week of testing.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SLOW or NO notification after motion detectionThe notification system through your email or iPhone or iPad is hit or miss. This is where the 'dvr' service comes in handy. If your place is being robbed, don't expect a notification to come through the pipeline, but a recording would be on the cloud. Overall, I am still trying out the camera, but the lack of notification might be a deal breaker. I will update after I use this more. Stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: Camera great but many false motion alerts due to light change
Reviews.Author: Test Guy
Reviews.Content: Pros:Super easy setup. Took minutes to get everything going.Website and iPad apps are great. Easy to use.Video is fairly clear.DVR options/plans are good, free option is the best offered for monitoring areas.Cons:Shipping is really slow. I placed my order directly from Dropcam on the 6th and it wasn't entered into the order system until the 8th. Then it took 10 days to ship the camera from SF to Boston via UPS Ground. In this day and age two weeks seems really slow! Shipping was free, so that was good.False motion alarms: I have my Dropcam in my basement and I'm getting many false motion alerts, especially on cloudy days and around dusk. Sometimes 5 in an hour! It appears that the alarms are triggered when the outside light dims and the camera temporarily goes into night vision mode then switches back. I have opened a support request and turned off the night vision feature for now. If there is a resolution to the problem I will update my star rating.Scheduling option is really needed: The product really needs an option via the website to turn on/off via a calendar. Trying to do this via an electric timer is not optimal.1/31/13: Review Update. Dropcam support responded to me saying that motion events can be triggered by light change. I think this is a big negative if you want to use the camera for catching motion events. I'm still getting false motion events even when the night vision is off. A cloud goes by = motion alert! If you just need to view the camera feed without catching motion events it's perfect. But if you are buying it to catch motion event beware.

Reviews.Title: Great product, as long as you don't get a "purple" one...
Reviews.Author: J. Lenz
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these directly from Amazon after doing quite a bit of research.  I simply wanted to monitor my front yard and driveway and maybe use one as a baby monitor down the road when we have a kid.Setup was very simple as other reviewers have noted and I was up and streaming live video in just a few minutes...very cool.  The hardware is very simple and modern, dare I say even Apple-esque and seems to be of very high quality.  First impression of the video feed was, "this is HD??; Even with a very fast broadband home connection the video was somewhat choppy and the resolution was far from what I would consider High Definition.  It is quite acceptable but just don't expect it to look anything like the 720p cable you watch on your HDTV.The "Purple Haze">>> Once I got my 2nd Dropcam setup and viewed the streams side by side I noticed one of the cameras video feed was very "purple" as colors were not true to life.  Green grass looked gray, Blue sky looked not so blue, green trees were just outright purple = This is what people that do acid must see lol...To demonstrate this (see user attached pictures), I set the cams up right next to each other looking at the same view from the same vantage point.  I then went upstairs to view the video streams on my dual monitor PC.  One cameras video is normal (left screen), the other has aforementioned "purple haze"(right screen)  This ain't cool...I have seen other complaints about this color issue and it seems Dropcam is aware of the issue.  I have a support ticket in as I write this and will update this review when it is resolved.  Hopefully it is just a firmware/software update and not a hardware flaw that necessitates a return.Other than the color issue the camera is great.  The Android app works well and connects 95% of time within ~10 seconds.  A couple times it failed to connect and you have to close the app and restart, no biggie.  Odd issue that has happen twice...when viewing the app on my Nexus 7 it shows a "live feed" of my driveway during the day BUT it is clearly night time outside and dark.  I press the "go live" button and its says "you are live!" haha.  A restart of the app fixes this and displays the correct live feed.The DVR function works as advertised and is very user friendly, I am not sure If I want to pay the $10/mo after the 14-day trial period is over though ($5 for additional camera so $15/mo in my case).  The cool thing is that if you are using this as a security camera the footage is stored offsite not locally, so if someone breaks into your abode and steals the camera itself, your video footage is still safe.If Dropcam fixes the color issue I'm keeping both!<<<Update 1/31/13>>>Dropcam customer service got back in touch with me and explained the "purple haze" is due to an infrared film over the lens that allows the camera to work better in nigh vision mode and hence, there is nothing they can do to correct it!  That did not explain why ONLY ONE OF MY 2 DROPCAMS exhibit this "purple haze" and the other is perfectly normal (again, see user attached pics to see what I mean).  They both equally well in night vision mode too.  They didn't respond to that part of my question and just left me hanging.  Well, it looks like the "purple" camera is being returned to Amazon, I'll keep the "normal" one.  Lowering my rating to 3 stars due to this explainable flaw.

Reviews.Title: Won't connect to my Verizon wifi
Reviews.Author: scott burwell
Reviews.Content: The camera is not much good if it can't connect to a vanilla verizon wifi. It finds to network but won't connect.  I have an HP computer, a laptop, 2 iphones, an ipad and other devices that work on the wifi without issue.  What a piece of junk for $150.

Reviews.Title: EASY to setup, HEAVY on bandwidth
Reviews.Author: Alan I.
Reviews.Content: I have been using the DropCam camera for one month.  Previously, I had internal and external Axis network cameras throughout my properties.  What attracted me to DropCam was the simplicity of the provisioning process.  For example, unbox, create a user account, plug in the camera, find the Wi-Fi network of choice, unplug, and find the right location for the cameras placement.  I must admit the camera was just that easy to install and relocate.  I really like the camera's mounting stand and long plug tail to place the camera in almost any location.  However, one major difference with the DropCam camera compared to the Axis network camera use case is the DropCam camera is configured to send ALL activity to the cloud at ALL times.  While that does sound great for motion alerts, sound alerts, and DVR playback, but it comes at a network bandwidth cost.  I have residential DSL service at the highest possible speed (6.0 MB down, 768 Kbps up) and the DropCam camera's constant Wi-Fi and internet traffic slams my home network making all devices negatively impacted.  The only workaround I have developed on my own is to shut-off the alerts and the camera at all times when not actively viewing the camera.  This allows for full bandwidth and high speed for all devices when at home.  When I am away, I turn on the alerts and camera because bandwidth doesn't matter since I am not home.  I hope to continue tinkering with the settings to maybe find a sweet spot, but for now, my DropCam camera is off until I need to access it remotely, which is a few minutes throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: Great video quality, but big privacy concerns
Reviews.Author: John Feinberg "feinberj"
Reviews.Content: This camera is designed well, and the video quality is excellent.  It was incredibly easy to set up.  I just plugged it into my Mac, double-clicked on the icon that showed up, and it then walked me through setting up a dropcam username and password.  After that, I downloaded the free iPhone app and I was able to see very high quality video of the baby room.The downside to this product is that the video stream must be continuously uploaded to the dropcam server.  Even if you are at home, on the same wifi network as the camera itself, the device will stream video to the dropcam server, and then your iphone will connect to the dropcam server to pull in the video stream.  The instructions say it will upload up to 600kb/sec, if that is available.  That will saturate many upload links.  There is also the issue that I do not want video from my baby room loaded on somebody else's server.  They do promise that it will be secure, but they are not a large company and I imagine it could be an enticing target for someone looking for videos to download.  Again, I point out that ALL video MUST be uploaded to their server for the camera to function.  This video is stored on their servers (not just processed) - that is also mandatory.It is really too bad, because the camera was incredibly easy to set up, and I loved the video quality.  If there was a "dropcam personal" that didn't upload my video, I'd buy two of them in a second.

Reviews.Title: Excellent system, easy to set up
Reviews.Author: David Choy
Reviews.Content: Upsides:VERY easy setup, plug in to computer, double click setup icon and unplug. Done!GOod qualityBuilt in microphone AND speaker, not bad even as a baby monitorDownsides:Slow service (I am using in Australia) and there is a LOT of lag for the live picture. I suspect because Dropcam don't have servers near Australia. Hope they expand here soon!High bandwidth requirements - some have estimated 30GB/month when using HD video. For some people that is their entire data allowance! - Definitely not for those with small data caps and slow speedsTakes alot of wireless bandwidth - I tried setting up 3 cameras in my parents home, one camera drops out every once in a while despite a strong wireless signal. I suspect there is just too much data for the network. Only works on the 2.4GHZ band though does has wireless N, so I don't know why 3 streams are too much for the network (with no one else using it). Don't expect to have more than 2 cameras without some drop out issues, at least until AC wifi is supported.Overall a good product but beware of the flaws, they may or may not make this product unsuitable for your situation.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup - Works well as expected
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: I bought two and had them up and running in less than 10 minutes. I did subscribe to the 7-day DVR plan and use them around the house, including one pointed outside a window to front porch & driveway... For me its a little peace of mind or taste of home when traveling. I love their new iPad app and the iphone one as well.  Their website sometimes seems a little sluggish (I prefer to use the iPad app).  If you dont want to invest in a full home security solution, but rather enjoy the 'gadget-ness' of having this supplementary device around the home for various uses, then this is for you.  You cam finally figure out what that cat does all day, or get to know the patterns of the traffic in front of your property better.

Reviews.Title: It works, but wouldn't buy it again
Reviews.Author: DDB
Reviews.Content: We like that we can use this on our iphone app, but it fails constantly. We use it for a baby monitor and reception is lost quite a bit. We live in an old house so we blame it on our wireless router. It works okay but will buy the motorolla video monitor next time.

Reviews.Title: Beware if you need help - poor customer support
Reviews.Author: D. Puchaty
Reviews.Content: Read reviews and it appeared to be easy to setup and use.  Especially liked the offsite encrypted DVR service. Received the unit in a timely fashion.  But that's where the appeal ended.  The unit I received was defective.  The unit communicated well with iMac and found the wireless nodes fine.  But when placing the unit ANYWHERE it could not find the wireless connection even very close to the router- orange blinking light .  To be fair  it did once - blue light - for about 30 secs and then dropped off line.  Texted customer support described everything including my router type, bandwidth, and type.  Two days later was asked for the serial # of the unit and if the light lights were on.  I referred to my first post and answered again.  2 days later a different person responds with similar color of the light questions and did I place it near my router.  Referred again to my posts and answered again.  Well you get the picture. I was never suggested anything to try just asked questions over a week's time.  I returned the unit never have been provided a suggested course of action.  It appears from all the good reviews that when the unit functions it works well.  However, from my experience beware if you need help.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: W. Jackman "Amazon junkie"
Reviews.Content: So this little camera gives me great peace of mind with nanny when I'm away.  Signal tends to break up a lot, but lots of wireless devices in house.  It does use a lot of bandwidth, but if it didn't the picture quality would suck.  Overall, I give it 4 stars.  It would get 5 if wireless connection was more secure.  I like the remote on/off feature so you can turn off camera when you're not using it from your iphone or android.

Reviews.Title: Hassle free
Reviews.Author: Ada
Reviews.Content: Literally took less than 5 mins to setup.  The video quality is great.  You can even take a test drive with their public cams.The night vision mode works great.The app on Android and iPhone are easy to use with simple interface, never had any issues.  You can turn on/off the camera and you can even turn off status light if you want to be discreet.If you don't want to mess with firewalls, NAS devices, PCs setup, this is the IP cam you want to get.

Reviews.Title: I really like this product!
Reviews.Author: JBAP
Reviews.Content: I just started using this today.  It was very easy to install, I just plugged it in to my USB port on my Windows PC, waited for it to detect my wireless internet, entered my internet password, created an account name and password, and voila, it was up and running!  I then downloaded the app on my iPad and it automatically detected the camera.  And lastly, I downloaded the app onto my ANDROID phone and it started working automatically. Now, if you want to RECORD video for, say, an entire week, you do have to pay a fee (of course), which was $9.99 a month or $99 for a year to be able to record a week's worth at a time.  Then you can go to the "DVR" and click on the day you want to view and the time and it plays it for you.  I have already tested it and it works very well. The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is the picture is not as sharp as the Philips In.Sight security camera I have, but I must say it provides a wider view than the Philips, and there is a slight delay of about 6 seconds when viewing realtime.  Not that big a deal.  And it may just be my internet speed, although my Philips In.Sight camera's realtime is excellent.  But it's a trade-off.  I am going to keep both as each has features the other does not and together they make a good team.  So I say if you want to be able to watch your driveway or living room, etc., while you are away and want to watch it from your ANDROID phone and/or iphone or iPad, this is a great product.  The Philips In.Sight can only be used with iPhone and Ipad.UPDATE:  Last night the camera would only show glare from the window, just bright lights is all you could see.  It was still doing it this morning at 7:30 as it is an overcast, dark morning.  I went into the settings and turned off the night vision feature and this fixed the problem.  Curious how it will work at night without the night vision on.  Will try turning on my porch light!

Reviews.Title: Didn't quite meet my needs.
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Holly
Reviews.Content: The cam didn't quite meet my needs.  Somehow I was dilusional in thinking that the "cloud" feature was free.  Wrong.  Returned it the same day.  I must admit that the setup was very easy and the cam quality was good.

Reviews.Title: Good Idea, WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE  EVER!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: David Deavers
Reviews.Content: The idea of Dropcam HD is a good one, HD Quality, good viewing area, can listen and talk, way easy set up ect. This why I bought the device, however it has turned out to be a product from hell. Set up was pretty straight forward and actually easy. That is where my fun with the product ended. After set up. I noticed a terrible quality picture, especially because this was HD, and my iZon (half the resolution camera) had a 10 times better pictures. I tried EVERYTHING , that logically would affect the picture quality. After nothing helped and a half day trying, I tried calling customer no support. After several calls and sending several screen shots, (3 hours process), they tell me I have a defective units and replacement would be shipped (something about old units being shipped that were defective). Then they hang up without even getting where to ship it. I tied calling back but no answer, so I then call back the next day. After finally getting through and hours on the phone , they make me start all over again, answering 10's of questions, sending NEW picture files all over again, which , I do with out complaint, even though I explained this was done before with a hardware issue verdict. So after going back and forth for 4 days , guess what , yep they say it is a defective unit and they take my address for replacements. Three days go by and I get a email from Dropcam, asking me all the same questions again and wanting me to start the process all over again!!!!! I explain I already did this 2 times in full now, and want  someone to call me in a position of management, who knows what they are doing. It has been a week and I have heard NOTHING! What a terrible company with terrible support. All companies can sell you something, it is when something goes wrong and how they try help and resolve your issue, tells alot about who you should buy from.The good1. easy set up2. wireless set3. good wide angle lensTHE BAD1. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER NO SUPPORT2. TERRIBLE NIGHT VISION, IT IS NOT A TYPICAL GOOD NIGHT VISION (NOT LIKE WE ARE ALL USE TOO)3. USES ALOT OF YOUR INTERNET PIPELINE. THE BAD PART IS THAT EVEN IF YOU HAVE DVR CLOUD SERVICE TURNED OFF, IT IS STILL CONSTANTLY UPLOADING YOUR IMAGES. NOT LIKE OTHER CAMERAS, THAT ONLY UPLOAD WHEN YOU TRY TO VIEW IT ON YOUR DEVICE. IT UPLOADS 24X7 365 EVEN IF YOU ARE NOT VIEWING4. CLOSED SYSTEM, THEY WILL NEVER BE ABLE TO BE USED WITH 3RD PARTY SOFTWARE5. NO LOCAL, COMPUTER/PAD, PHONE BASED RECORDING,6. NO IPAD APP AT ALL, NOTHING7.  terrible quality picture, if you get the old version, like I guess I was lucky to get......it is like the lottery, who gets a good one and who doesn't

Reviews.Title: Simple, but poor video quality
Reviews.Author: B. Greenstone
Reviews.Content: I like the design of the device for the most part, and the price is decent.  However, the video is so incredibly compressed that calling it HD is a bit of a joke.  If you had an intruder in your house you'd never be able to identify him because his entire head would be one giant video compression block.  Also, the exposure seems dialed down which doesn't help.  If I flick on some extra lights in a room, the exposure looks really good for about 5 seconds and then it closes the aperture and makes it a little dim.Overall, all I can say is that the Dropcam is just ok.  Not great, not horrible, just ok.  Probably worth the $150 for a cheap and simple security camera solution.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam HD
Reviews.Author: Lawrence I. Fuchs
Reviews.Content: Great product.  Easy to set up.  The night vision is a big plus and the sensitivity of the audio is excellent.  It's nice to know I can check up on my house when I'm away with my smart phone.

Reviews.Title: great product, easy to use and set up.
Reviews.Author: J "J"
Reviews.Content: This is my second network camera and so far the easiest to set up and has the highest video quality. I have been using the camera for 2 weeks and i love it. I am also using the free trial of the DVR service and i think it is easy to use and check on previous recordings. Although the full time recording feature is a bit expensive at $30 per month i can see my self using the DVR service when i am on vacation etc for a week at a time for only $10. i also use this on the iPhone and it works great. The video quality on the iPhone isn't the same as when viewed through a web browser but is good enough for watching my house. I didnt experience any set up problems. All i had to do was connect the camera to my computer and follow the instructions. I was up and running in about 10 minutes. I highly recommend this product to anyone seeking an easy to use and set up IP camera with internet connectivity.

Reviews.Title: Best security camera ever
Reviews.Author: gus
Reviews.Content: It is the easiest to install and most complete camera. quality is superb and motion detection rocks. there is no doubt this is the future of home monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Horrible.
Reviews.Author: Kendra
Reviews.Content: I've had my dropcam for a couple years now and its been functional maybe 1/4 of the time.  Constant problems with it connecting, my laptop wont even recognize that it is plugged in so I cannot troubleshoot, paid extra for the recording and have not even been able to take advantage of it because the camera won't even connect!  Piece of s***!!!!!!! Don't waste your money on this product.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: cliffy
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrific so easy to hook up took a couple minutes great picture  you can see live at home anytime from your phone and I pad  love this camera

Reviews.Title: Drop cam
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Rivera
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and it's functionality. I can see whats going on from anywhere on my cell phone, or laptop. I traveled to Puerto Rico and was amazed when I was still able to keep track on how my kids behave around my dogs when they think no one is watching.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Lavoie
Reviews.Content: I've gone through about 4 or 5 different video monitors in the past few months, and this one is by far my favorite. It was the simplest set up, as it describes, and the video quality surpasses most other cameras I have owned. It switches between night and day lighting automatically and automatically reloads if the wifi connection isn't as strong as it should be. Speaker is loud and clear so my son can hear when I talk to him in his room from the camera and the audio is top quality as well. I don't personally use many of the alert settings, but it is neat to get an email saying my camera was offline at such and such a time (you can set it to alert you instantly, like I said I just don't use it very often so my settings are set to automatic).Downsides - it is not a pan/tilt camera, it only zooms. Also, the connection to the WiFi can be a bit touchy - you have to find the exact right placement to get a good signal for the camera.Great camera for the money! So happy I have finally found a decent camera - I just purchased my second for my daughter's room!

Reviews.Title: Best web cam, so easy to install!
Reviews.Author: Racer
Reviews.Content: This is such a great product. We use it to spy on our dogs during the day and finally know who the guilty party is when you come home to a mess. Camera mounts anywhere and the resolution is great. They keep offering more functionality with each upgrade so I'm always happy. Talking into the speaker really freaks the dogs out when you are not there. Use it judiciously so they don't go crazy. Good for telling kids to do their homework too!

Reviews.Title: Not great, not bad
Reviews.Author: Daniel J. Saxon "Danny S"
Reviews.Content: The picture itself isn't exactly hd quality, especially when zooming in. Picks up sound good but talking through it, the voice is quiet. Gotta talk LOUD. Is this worth 150? No. But it's worth 75-100 with my experience using it

Reviews.Title: This is great for keeping an eye on the house...
Reviews.Author: IanB "IanB"
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set up and use and I can monitor my home through my iPhone.  Make sure that the location you install the device is close to a power outlet.  The clarity is perfect...

Reviews.Title: The best wireless camera currently available!
Reviews.Author: T-DunX
Reviews.Content: I am completely sold on the Dropcam product. I currently own this model as well as the Pro. I use one facing my backyard and the other as a baby monitor. The camera and product quality is exceptional and extremely dependable. This is the perfect camera system if you want easy set up and access through your smart phone and through the Dropcam internet site. They are light weight and can be placed just about anywhere near an outlet. The chord length is usually around 10 feet. I'm usually hesitant on doing this but I have recommended this product to many of my family and friends. The only drawback to Dropcam is you must pay a yearly service fee to utilize their recording service through their servers. They usually offer a trail for a week or two. The camera itself has many customization features with the sound, night vision, camera angle, etc. I'm very impressed and would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Works Very Well
Reviews.Author: Chris Goodrich
Reviews.Content: Ordered 3 of these.  They are expensive but you get what you pay for.  The resolution is great, setup is extremely easy, and the software is very easy to use.  2 reasons I gave it 4 stars : First : Price, Second : If you plan on keeping it in a garage or colder temps, it will have issue.s

Reviews.Title: Love it LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: ManicBobo "Manic"
Reviews.Content: Got one of these for Christmas gift.  Hooked it up in a few minutes and fell in love with the whole concept, the way it works, and the app.  Was given another one for my birthday, and had to get more.  Now running SIX (one a Pro) and have the inside and outside of my house covered.  When we travel, it is great being able to keep an eye on your property.  I did have to upgrade my internet/wifi service because of the number of cameras, and the iSmart Alarm system I also run on my wifi, but that has benefited everyone in the house because of the insane number of other things everyone has hooked up to the wifi in the house.  The one problem I have run into is the night vision, the infrared reflects off the windows and pretty much makes the camera blind.  The night vision works great in my living room, kitchen and hallway.  I found that good motion lights outside make up for the lack of night vision on the outside views. With everyone in the house having access to the cameras and alarm system via their apple iToys I don't miss having a $35 a month alarm service that took 30 minutes sometimes to alert me the alarm had gone off.  I tried other cameras and systems and could never get them to function correctly if at all over the internet, and usually ended up recording in home, which always worried me if someone stole the laptop or the recorder in a burglary.  Off site recording for $99 a year?  Big whoop. Well worth it to me. I picked the two most likely cameras to catch a thief, to sign up for recording and the rest of them are real time and still send me notifications of movement and sounds.  Having tried most of the other stuff out there, I got no complaints about the system.Ps ~ one of my cameras developed the "purple screen" people mention.  I contacted dropcam and they sent out a replacement right away.  However, in my case it seemed to be self inflicted.  Because of the location of two of my cameras, in the window, I had to cut and modify the base and couldn't use the mounting plate they provided.  While waiting for the replacement camera, I was mounting another camera in another window.  I drilled a hole in the base to hold the base upside down from the top of the window sill.  In the process of putting in the screw, I touched the back of the camera with the magnetic bit holder I was using in my battery screwdriver.  The picture instantly turned pink (purple) on my iphone.  Both cameras eventually cleared the pink screen, and I went ahead and had drop cam just bill me for replacement camera to add it to my system.  It appears that the cameras are sensitive to a magnetic field. So keep that in mind when handling the cameras....

Reviews.Title: I love this product!
Reviews.Author: JULIEV
Reviews.Content: First let me start off by saying that I am not very good at setting up electronics. That being said I purchased two of these cameras to watch my mom who has alzheimer's. I set them both up in about 20 min. I love them the sound a picture quality is great. I can watch my mom at work and see if she needs anything. I highly recommend these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Easiest coolest camera ever!
Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: Dropcam is WONDERFUL! it is very durable strong metal construction.  Comes with a mounting piece that's easy to install.  All components seem durable and well made.  It was literally a 60 second activation after i hung it on the wall and i was looking live into my room and starting the free 2 week trial of the video storage system.  I definitely signed up for the monthly contract when the trial was over.  I LOVE this camera! you can zoom easy, see very well and can access it in a second from the app or the website.  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this camera!

Reviews.Title: It Works
Reviews.Author: Emmie Barry
Reviews.Content: Even a cave man could set up this camera.  Then it sits unobtrusively on it's own stand whereever you place it.  (Remember, it does require plugging into a wall socket.)You can look at the goings on in your home via your cell phone and you can hear the action loud and clear.  They don't hear you unless you turn on the microphone button.  Good way to keep tabs while gone.

Reviews.Title: The Customer Service
Reviews.Author: R. Huang
Reviews.Content: is why you would want to buy this camera.  Their customer service is really what you're paying for.  The picture quality isn't any better then say a $70 camera.  I have had them.  What you pay for is the customer service, which is 5 star by todays standards.  They speak perfect english and are located here in the states.  The software and the setup are very STRAIGHT forward.  It's like an Apple product.  You open it up set it up and good to go, that's the way it should be.  The service and setup are both 5 star no question, but the truth is, the product still has its limitations not even customer service can resolve.  My router from Verizon is setup in a downstairs office.  The baby room is directly above the office.  There are no microwaves or audio equipment in between and the camera steam is glitchy.  I went ahead and spent another $75 on a range extender but it still didn't help.  2 months into it, it's still NOT a reliable baby cam for me.  Knowing what I know now, I would have returned it.  If the camera it hooked up directly to camera via USB cable, the picture streams pretty nicely.  When used wirelessly, the technology is just not there yet.  The most reliable thing for me is the old fashioned "audio baby monitors"  at least I can get a consistent signal and know if the baby is awake and crying.  Of course I cannot see or here here remotely from work, but from work I can't do much either.  So in conclusion, I would recommend, but only if you are going to use in short proximity from router.  The setup and customer service were great, but the product in longer distances over 50 ft is minimal at best.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Melinda Powers
Reviews.Content: can see and interact with your animals.  there is a slight delay, but for the most part has been very successful on keeping them in line

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I ended up buying 5 of these. I run a company with some remote operations. It is an excellent camera, very easy to set up and has saved me numerous trips. I have hooked these to wifi and also to portable wifi hot spots. It sucks a lot of data up so I remotely turn it on when I am using it and the turn it off when I am done. I also send links to my managers so they can also check on the work being done.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Clemons "cpc345"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this Dropcam.  I got it for safety reasons so I could check in whenever and wherever I am to make sure my house is secure.  There is an occasional slight delay but it continues on and I don't miss any speech.  My son set this up for me rather quickly.  I could have done it myself but he wanted to. I only bought one for a trial but I plan to buy at least one more.I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for home security, a baby cam, nanny cam or for use as an elder cam.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Wi-Fi Camera
Reviews.Author: Warren E. Lawson "wlawson95"
