We have a baby monitor that works much better in the dark but the Dropcam is usable in the dark. All in all it does what I bought it for. There is an iPad app now and it is even better on the iPad. Great job.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC! WORKS WITH AT&T; 2WIRE Wi-Fi FLAWLESSLY
Reviews.Author: R. Schiff "hassiman"
Reviews.Content: I have tried and tried to get a WireLess Internet camera to work with AT&T; 2WIRE to no avail untill DropCam HD came along.  Fantastic.  Took 2 mins to set up and it worked flawlessly!Picture quality is incredible, Motion detection is quick and even alerts me on my iPhone.  The Camera's fimware updates automatically!  The iPhone APP is great.Only improvements I would make would be adjustable motion detection threshold so I can set it to ignor my pup... when I get one. I would also have a short-term DVR program available for those going on vacation... No need for a whole years subscription.... but even without ANY DVR service this camera ROCKS! It also has sound detection which will also alert your phone...You can clearly see and hear what is happening at home from anywhere in the world.LOVE this thing.... 2 USB ports UP... way up!Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera

Reviews.Title: Finally a monitoring Cam done right!!!
Reviews.Author: Xof "Xof"
Reviews.Content: Being a geek, I tried several different security, monitoring cams. The DropCam not only is super easy to setup and use but also has great image quality, wie angle, great sound sensor and amazing user interface (online and iPhone App). I like it so much that after the first one, I returned the other cam I had (iZon) and order a second one!!

Reviews.Title: Simple, Fast, Great home monitor!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Putkowski "novelist, pilot, world trav...
Reviews.Content: I've had some IP cameras in the past and could never get them to work as easily and correctly as the Dropcam. From the time I opened the box until I had it working was less than ten minutes! The instructions are simple. Connect the unit with the supplied cable to your computer. Click on the icon. Setup proceeds as instructed, which is very simple. Identify your WiFi box, enter the password, the Dropcam connects. Then, you disconnect from your computer, plug the Dropcam into the wall, and the Dropcam setup program finds it. You create an account with Dropcam, which is free if you don't want storage. I went the distance and downloaded the free app to my iPhone. After logging in via my iPhone, I was seeing the camera's view. AWESOME! Seriously, this camera is VERY EASY to get up and running. Now, the image quality during the day is okay, better than your average security camera. It also has low fidelity audio. Both are plenty good for monitoring your house while you're away or keeping an eye on a business such as a shop or office or reception area. I'm thinking about setting it up as a webcam with a view of the Caribbean in another property I own and letting my friends log in (on a separate account, of course) for a view of the water. For the price, the Dropcam is a great tool. I'm using it strictly for security purposes. I've ordered several more to cover multiple angles on my property.

Reviews.Title: Simplest, Best Little IP Camera
Reviews.Author: normb4 "normb4"
Reviews.Content: I work in the tech field, my department actually does home security installs with lots of different equipment. Obviously we don't carry dropcam cause the darn things are so super simple no one would need us to install these. I've tested lots of different equipment and I purchased one of these for my own home for fun and simplicity.Price is cheap compared to many similar units.  You don't have any monthly cost if you don't want, but if you want any recordings than the $10 is reasonable.The set up takes no more than 5 minutes to set up. All you need to set it up is your computer and the wireless connection. After it's set up the camera doesn't need the computer any longer and can be placed anywhere with a AC plugin. Plenty of basic options, my favorite is to be able to talk to it from my Droid or from my laptop when i'm gone -works great with the kids at home after school.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: jeri
Reviews.Content: I own the dropcam HD, have had it for two weeks and so far so good.  Easy set up, works great with my wifi and the audio is amazing, but the quality of the video while good enough is less then I have seen in other cameras.  The zoom does not seem like a zoom at all, it appears very grainy; no advantage for a zoom of this type.  But if you are looking to capture video of average quality, but very reliable I would get this camera.  I think one gets what one pays for.  $149.00 is the right price for the dropcam HD, and their customer service.

Reviews.Title: The perfect webcam for me
Reviews.Author: Stimpson
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Dropcam HD.  There were always two factors that kept me from getting a wireless monitoring cam: price and hassle.  This item hit the sweet spot for both of those.  It literally could not be easier to configure.  You just enter your WiFi password and you're done.  No opening/forwarding ports, no assigning it an IP address, etc etc.  I also love the fact that I can subscribe to the monitoring service for offsite storing of my video.  If someone broke into my house and stole my Dropcam and my computer I would still have the footage.  And it's so easy to use a computer or my iPhone to view motion events that were logged.  This little device gave me a lot of peace of mind the last time I was on vacation.  I've recommended it to all of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable - Failed 2 times in first 10 days.
Reviews.Author: Goodknight
Reviews.Content: Great idea except the camera does not work all the time.  First problem was with the night vision.  The camera was set up to look at the kitchen and kitchen door.  Early one morning Camera showed a bright circle, like it was pointed at a low watt bulb. No detail.  The camera was uncomfortably hot to the touch.  Unplugged the camera and waited for it to cool down.  Repositioned the camera to have plenty of room all around to try to keep it cooler.  Sent off a trouble report to Dropcam.  Plugged it in and it worked fine.  Dropcam did respond to my trouble report four days later and confirmed that I should make sure there was room to air cool the device.Second problem the camera failed right after turning on the lights early one morning.  Again, the camera was very hot to the touch.  Displayed a dark kitchen even with the lights on.  Could see vague details.  The night vision was off and the IR LEDS were off.  Turned off the camera by unplugging and let it cool.  Worked fine since then.

Reviews.Title: get one today
Reviews.Author: paula whalen
Reviews.Content: this camera is great easy to setup easy to control on ipad ipod iphone which everyou choose.i love that i can talk to my pets through it too

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: JMK
Reviews.Content: We have purchased three cameras from Drop Cam over the past couple of years. We still are using all 3 cameras.  The cameras are very simple to install and normally have very little problems if you have a decent internet connection.  One of it's selling features for us was it provides email alerts to our IPhone and IPad and has an application for both.  Their newest camera with night vision and talk back features sound interesting and we might look into purchasing another camera in the future.

Reviews.Title: I Love My Dropcam
Reviews.Author: D. Sewell
Reviews.Content: I absolutley Love My Dropcam, i hated being away from my dogs for 10 hours a day, then i saw the advertisement of the Dropcam and thought what a great idea, i can watch my dogs while i am at work.  I Love the Dropcam, i can log on to my Dropcam and see my dogs and talk to them thu the day.  This is totally amazing and it is live feed, not a recording.  Thank you Dropcam for making it possible to interacte with my dogs while i am at work.

Reviews.Title: Great to monitor the kids.
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera having my doughts, but to my surprise it does exactly what it says it can do. I use it to monitor my kids when I'm out and about. Actually I recently got divorced, but still great friends with the X lol. So when I want to see the kids and talk to them she will put the camera on and while I'm at work I can chat with them or just watch them cause I miss them so much. The camera at times can get hot to the touch, but called customer support and they said that is normal and will explain why, i just forgot what they said but it made sense. I just wish this camera had some sought of zoom on it and that is the only reason I didnt give it 5 stars. So I highly recommended this camera if your looking for one that is affordable. Oh, the infared on the camera works great in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Great product and great customer service
Reviews.Author: M.J.Clark
Reviews.Content: I have used the dropcam over the past month for several different purposes including to keep an eye on my kids when they are home with the baby sitter, a security cam, and to check in on my dog during bad weather. Thus far, the dropcam has operated as promised and the online access is clear enough to recognize people at a 10 to 20 ft distance. The audio is good for most situations but can become distorted in some large rooms that don't have good acoustics.We have tried just about every feature including the talk back function. While there is a slight delay, it is more than acceptable for short conversations or to tell the dog to get off the couch. The night vision was impressive and with the adjustable sensitivity levels, we were able to adjust it so small noises did not trigger an alert but still up enough to pick up an exterior door closing.One surprise was the amount of bandwidth usage per day, so make sure you have broadband connection that can handle this load. But we run ours 24/7 and will be changing our plan to accommodate the additional usage. Also, I hope that they will soon have an app that allows for HD video on the I-pad, but until then, the I-phone app works just fine.Overall it is a great product with several different possible uses and I recommend this product to almost everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: K. Durr "iFishDurr"
Reviews.Content: I found out about this on the Dadlabs podcast and thought I would try it out for a baby monitor. We already had two kids at the time, so this was a nice thing to have for our third. It is so easy to set up - it is very sleek and simple, almost as if Apple designed it. It connects easily to your existing wifi network and the iPhone app works very well with it. It automatically downloads the latest updates and is a maintenance free device. It is so awesome to see my baby sleepingw in the crib while I am at work and my wife is home! When we are done using it as a baby monitor, we might use it as a nanny cam / security cam.Pros: Easy set up, great apps for it, night vision works excellent, notifications sent to your iPhone for movement and sound, having the ability to talk to whoever is in the room, app allows for monitor to be viewed over 3G.Cons: It gets a little hot - I contacted Dropcam about it and they said this is normal - so not that big of a deal, I guess. Also, sometimes the notifications for sound don't work when they should, but this could be from other interfering sounds in the room. We'll see what this is like in the winter when the windows are closedVerdict - its worth the money, get it!

Reviews.Title: 100 Miles Away
Reviews.Author: paul salafia
Reviews.Content: We have a vacation home that is nearly 100 miles away and last year we installed two Dropcams.  One in our great room facing the front door and the other on the second floor pointing out a window to our driveway.  It gives me great peace of mind that I can check on the house on my iPhone, iPad or any computer.  I know that the house is secure day or night and I can check if the landscaping was done or, since we ski, the driveway is plowed in the winter. They are extremely reliable, inexpensive, and a snap to install.  I'd love to replace them with the new HD/sound versions but these work great too.  Love Dropcam!

Reviews.Title: Awesome device
Reviews.Author: A. Buza "Educator"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a video monitor for my child's room.  We have a the traditional monitor but it only transmits sounds.  This is great to view my child, see them in their room, and in the middle of the night why they might be crying.The product is easy to use and simple to setup.  The apps for mobile device such as an iPhone are wonderful - you don't need to carry an extra baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Almost Great
Reviews.Author: Kuda
Reviews.Content: This is the third brand of camera I have tried out. By far the design and the software (PC, Mac, mobile) are the absolute best. Great resolutiOn and sound. Works excellent in day or night. I highly suggest them. Now for the quirks you have to get over... First, they are not fans of invisible networks. Unsure why, but it is the only thing their tech support (who are great) and myself could troubleshoot out. Second, they need to unplugged and re-plugged here and there. Lastly, the damn motion and noise alerts are too sensitive. If a mouse farts outside or a shadow appears, they will go off. Seems like these are software fixes that can be done.I highly suggest checking them out. Great product for the money.

Reviews.Title: So far So good
Reviews.Author: tgoldtechie "tgoldtechie"
Reviews.Content: just got my Dropcam today after waiting several months.  it took me all but 5 minutes to setup...i think it took me longer to get the clear plastic off the box :)anyway, after attaching it to my computer, following the easy directions, entering the wifi encryption key...i was off and running.  then i proceed to download the free app for iphone...works well too although the app is limited in that it doesn't allow you to use the timeline function.  the unit itself runs a bit hot, as other posters have mentioned - not sure if that will affect its longevity.  two things that would make this a perfect monitoring cam is making it weatherproof and solar powered so i can put it between my window and screen so that there is no glare at night and won't have to pay the electric company any more than i already give them.  i gave it 4 stars which is solid for a one day use.

Reviews.Title: Very handy, high-quality Internet camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Henderson Jr.
Reviews.Content: We purchased our Dropcam a few weeks before a three-week vacation away from home.  We don't have a full-blown security system because we're home pretty much all the time.  All of the possessions that were not locked safely away are located in the living room (HDTV, router, DVR, USB hard drives, etc.), so I bought the Dropcam because it has HD picture quality, night vision, wireless communication to router for remote access, and DVR capability at the company's servers.  I set it up on the mantel, peeping through some garland there, ran the power line across the top of the mantel and down the other side to an outlet, and pointed the camera directly at the end of the room where the equipment is located.  We wouldn't necessarily prevent a burglary, but we would have a very clear picture of the burglars (at least until they unplugged the router).  I was very happy with the result.  I could check on the status of the house any time I wanted (even receiving event notifications on my smartphone when the mailman walked past the front picture window).  Of course, a major feature is that you need not have a PC in your home and booted all the time to monitor the camera.  We signed up for the 30-day DVR plan, and dropped it upon returning from vacation.  There is also a 7-day DVR plan, but we are always here, so we're not using (or paying for) any DVR capability now.  We didn't use the 2-way audio capability, but it would have come in handy if I had checked on the status while burglars were in the house.  I'm very, very happy with the unit.  There are many potential uses for it, depending on the layout of your home or office.  It has been working fine for 3 months now with no problems at all.  The only additional feature that I could ask for would be the ability to raise/lower and scan the camera remotely, but this would certainly add significantly to the price of the unit, and would warrant a whole new model in addition to the one we bought.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Handsome-Jeff Friedberg, an Author and Media-...
Reviews.Content: This works great, as advertised.ONE TEENSIE THNG: it takes a LONGGGGGG time to load, once you find the HIDDEN  &^%$#@  icon to click on.The Quick Start instructions say that the icon will be easy to find, but in my case it was hunted down in COMPUTER>E-Drive, listed as an EXTERNAL DISK or thumb drive.But it is unbelieveably great with infra-red night vision, built in two way mile, digital zoom, and more. I'm getting a few more.It can be flukey. Simply unplug, wait, and plug back in.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup but it doesn't work from Windows Phone 8 and Microsoft Surface
Reviews.Author: ZN "ZN"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to setup.  You don't need to worry about your home router settings.  It does everything for you as advertised as long as you place the camera within the the wi-fi range. Once it's setup, you visit dropcam.com and log in to see live video. Video is ok especially for monitoring purposes.My biggest issues are that I no longer have an iPhone.  Instead, I use Windows Phone 8 HTC 8x. Dropcam has not released an app for Windows Phone.  From their website, it doens't seem like they plan to.Secondly, I have to use the standard Windows 8 or Windws 7 PCs to watch video.  From the IE on my Surface, dropcam is apparently not compatible with whatever the version of flash player shipped on Windows RT. Hope these will be fixed soon.

Reviews.Title: Good product, but...
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: Overall it is a great product; the only thing is ... if you are use to a baby monitor where you can have the monitor on all the time and listen to any noise the baby or toddler makes, then this is a little different and not so practical. In order to view or monitor, you have to go into the app, so if you have the app on your phone, then this means you would use the phone only for monitoring which isn't the case. Dropcam is more for occasional monitoring and not permanent as I see it unless you have a dedicated computer, cell phone or tablet to spare.Don't get me wrong, the product is great and you can pay for the DVR service if you need 24/7 monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Amin Gheewalla
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to keep an eye on our dogs while they are home alone. Could not believe how simple it was to set up! I had a bunch of IP cameras before and they were a pain in the butt to set up and use. The Android app is also simple, but very useful.Purchased another one recently to install at a coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: One of the best app controlled devices !!
Reviews.Author: Aparajit Bajpai
Reviews.Content: This camera has convenience written all over it. Right from the installation to actual use, it is very easy and efficient processs.Have been using 2 of these in my house for about 2 weeks now and they are working flawlessly. Picture quality is good both in light and dark and we love the talk feature a lot.Best part is the unparallel compatibility with the iPhone and iPad apps.

Reviews.Title: Could not have been easier
Reviews.Author: S. Roberts "scroberts3"
Reviews.Content: This was one of the easiest tech devices I've ever setup up.  5 minutes and my video was streaming to the cloud.

Reviews.Title: Great baby monitor or security camera
Reviews.Author: L8er
Reviews.Content: I have dropcam set up as a baby monitor and an additional camera at my front door.  They work great and the HD quality is excellent.  Running 2 cameras on my network tends to slow my network down, but my upload is not that great.  The app on the ipad is great with the 4 split screen option with live viewing on  each one.  The alerts to my phone work great too.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Vince Z
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my parents as they were looking for some sort of real time monitoring system for the house.  All of the other cameras on the market seemed a little bit complicated and that my parents would constantly be bugging me if they have issues, so I looked for an easier solution.  This product is everything that I was looking for.  Very easy to set up and very easy to manage.  My parents, who are not tech savvy at all, understand exactly how to use these.  The fact that you can view the camera (with alerts) on your smartphone is a huge plus.  You can also purchase DVR services from the company if you would like to be able to refer to past events.  If you choose not to get DVR, you'll still have the ability to watch real time for free.

Reviews.Title: Does what it claims.
Reviews.Author: Brogan
Reviews.Content: Have had the cam for about a week now, and am really happy with it.For once, a piece of electronics that is EASY to set up, and does what it claims.I'd give this 6 stars if I could.  Just awesome.  The innovative features and thesimple functionality, reminds me of the GoPro camera.Go out and buy one, get the in-cloud storage and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Waited for this for years
Reviews.Author: D. Zoll
Reviews.Content: I've wanted a simple, inexpensive way to monitor the inside of my house while I'm away at work for years. All systems I looked at seemed too complex. Not so DropCam. It couldn't be easier to set up (took me 10 minutes), and the price is right.The 720p resolution is much sharper than typical webcams. My house is always pretty dark inside (I like it that way), but DropCam gives me a great picture nonetheless. As others have noted, the motion detection feature isn't very useful because of excessive false alarms, so I disabled it. I watch using my iPhone.Finally, I have some peace of mind while away from home. At any time, I can reassure myself that a) my house isn't currently burning down and b) thieves are not ransacking the place. I no longer expect any surprises when I get home.

Reviews.Title: Nearly flawless camera
Reviews.Author: A.R.N.
Reviews.Content: GREAT little camera -- clear picture, clear sound, too, and ridiculously easy setup -- maybe 60 seconds?  And the iPad app is amazing. If I could get rid of my expensive security company cameras and replace them with Dropcams I would in a heartbeat.  But they aren't meant for outdoor use and when I point them out the window it only works great until nightfall.  Then the infrared lights reflect back from the window and I see nothing.  If you're monitoring indoor use or daytime traffic though, these cameras are unbeatable.  If they ever decide to make an outdoor line, they would dominate Honeywell, AT&T;, Verizon, alarm.com, ADT and all the rest.

Reviews.Title: Watch them!!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Welter
Reviews.Content: We crate our dogs while at work. I can be reassured they are ok but checking on them during the day! Super simple to setup and use! Love it!!

Reviews.Title: Very Good!
Reviews.Author: Elaine C. V. Hora
Reviews.Content: The only problem is that since it uses the internet, there is a delay of a couple of seconds, so what you see is something that happened a couple of seconds ago.

Reviews.Title: Great idea, reliability stinks, rendering it useless.
Reviews.Author: Violet
Reviews.Content: Have had 3 Dropcam HDs since they starting shipping them. Had one replaced immediately, good service. Had several problems with all of them which were supposed to be fixed via software updates over time, and they mostly were. But in the end had too many wifi problems. Bought new airport extreme base station and airport express to ensure full coverage. Tv, iPhone, TiVo, laptops, all work great, but not dropcams. They cut out and don't reconnect the way everything else does. Used to reconnect after I unplugged and replugged all routers, wifi equipment, and cameras. But no more. Left for 5 months, cameras went off, paid someone to do the unplug-replug routine. Worked for another week. Stopped again. Paid same person to do it again. Several times. They won't reconnect at all. No computer in the house. So now my home is left unwatched. Dropcam support is willing to troubleshoot or replace or refund but no one will be there to do anything for several more months! Not at all satisfactory. I was planning to buy several more for other home, including expensive DVR service, but obviously not going to do that now.Dropcam support is only available by email, and takes days or weeks to respond to each of my emails, and often marks case solved and closed without even waiting for a reply from me. Super unhappy.

Reviews.Title: 2 tries, never worked, poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I tried ordering this for the school where I work. It would have been great, especially the online features, if it had worked. The first unit only connected to the network intermittently, constantly switching between connected and not. I called customer service, and when I described the light sequence on the unit, was told that was a code for a bad unit, and they'd ship me a new one. Then it took a couple of weeks to get the new unit - turns out they confused someone else's help ticket with mine, and had marked my problem as resolved before they shipped the new unit.Got the second unit: exact same problem. Called customer support, got a recording they were not accepting calls due to a heavy call load. (Gee, I wonder why.) Emailed customer support, waited almost a week for a response. I sure wish this would have worked, but until they get their act together on both hardware and support, I'm done with Dropcam. Good luck, guys!

Reviews.Title: Dropcam
Reviews.Author: rcaton
Reviews.Content: Dropcam works great. Company even sent me a new one because they determined the camera in the original wasn't up to par even though it seemed to work pretty good to me. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Easiest security system ever!
Reviews.Author: GXtianSr
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 Dropcam cameras for my lake house.  Within 20 minutes, both we're up and operating.  That is from opening the package to seeing images on my computer!  Fantastic piece of mind for a remote piece of property. Highly recommend it for anyone that wants to keep an eye on things.Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera

Reviews.Title: Easiest Camera to Setup
Reviews.Author: WASOS
Reviews.Content: The DropCam was a little more expensive than some other alternatives BUT the ease of use was incredible and worth a few extra dollars. Connected to computer, did install, connected to wireless network and it was up and running! I can watch my dogs at home while I am at work or just in general monitor the house. I can view from my computer, my iPad, iPhone and my Android, so it is viewable anytime anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Outright Dangerous!!!
Reviews.Author: acso524
Reviews.Content: I thought this product was great at first. It worked flawlessly for a week and a half after I received it and set it up. Then, one night I go to check the video feed and it states "Disconnected" on my iPhone app. I go to check the camera and almost get third degree burns on my finger and thumb by touching it. I let the little booger cool off and by following all of the website's suggestions in the FAQ section made an attempt to get it online again and struck out. Yes, it is a nifty little tech gadget in the beginning but the risk of your family perishing in a house fire due to the shoddy construction and/or design of this cam far outweigh the pros of this unit. Hate I wasted $150 on this

Reviews.Title: Terrible image quality
Reviews.Author: Robert Klingsten
Reviews.Content: Like someone else said, I had high hopes for this camera. I have been using two iPhones to monitor my baby boy from time to time, but that doesn't work when it's dark. So when I saw this camera on Uncrate I thought I found the solution.But alas, the picture quality is terrible. In a day lit room, I set it up about 5 feet away from my boy swinging in a baby swing. Even with plenty of light, I was not able to make out details like his hands, or the toys hanging on the bar in front of him, on the iPhone screen monitoring.The other problem is the delay ... I understand the camera is shipping the audio/video up to the "cloud" and then back to the iPhone app or whatever. That makes for a good 1 to 1.5 second delay at best. I can hear him in the other room make a noise and it's that long of a delay or more, before I hear it on the iPhone.It's too bad, it's a nice design. But I guess I'm going to go back to something I know works better like a Vivotek or similar (which I have outside on my front porch, works awesome.) More expensive, but after monitoring baby when he's bigger I can use it for the back yard or something else.The Dropcam is going back.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Crap, yes total crap
Reviews.Author: Donald W.
Reviews.Content: I worked for two hours trying to make this work.  I use a MacBook Pro and this thing just doesn't work.  It was advertised as a simple set up and go.  I am so sick of these tech companies advertising what they cannot deliver.  I'll just buy the crap 40 $ camera.  At least they work. I edited this to add a little vitriol.  I am very tech savvy. This company directs you to their cloud service.  I don't think this item will work unless you subscribe to their subscription service.  This is a scam.  Run from this.I just had a response from Dropcam.  It seems this camera was "previously registered" by another user so I cannot register it until I send them a copy of my invoice from amazon.  Well, I though I bought this from Amazon as an original purchaser.  I really am concerned with privacy and don't want an internet camera that has been used by someone else and can be compromised by someone else. Besides, Amazon did not advertise this item as a used item. Sucks if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: GuestStarChef
Reviews.Content: I have several strategically placed around the house. They work great even in the dark. I would love to see them make a weather proof outside battery operated model. I'd buy two more in a New York minute if they did. If your concerned about things happening in your home when your not around these are great. I check them from out of town on my cell phone. Great product.

Reviews.Title: GREAT product GREAT customer service.
Reviews.Author: FunkUSMC
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Dropcam. Upon arrival, it did exactly as promoted- easily set it up in less than 5 minutes. I tested it for about a week and felt comfortable enough to order another one as well as order the Plus DVR service for both. Yesterday I saw a comment on here about a 10% military discount. So, I emailed support with a copy of my DD-214 as well as my 100% disability rating letter from the VA.I just received the following email in reply:"CliffApr 03 03:25 pm (PDT)Hi Scott!I'm sorry you weren't aware of our Military discount! I went ahead and applied that discount for you, and a refund will be issued to the card that we have on file. You should see that reflected on your statement in 2-3 days. Also, to say thanks, we added 3 months of complimentary DVR service to both of your cameras!Please let us know if you need anything else, and we will be happy to assist you!Best regards,CliffTechnical Support Engineersupport.dropcam.com | 877.345.3767 (DROP)"A few days later one of my units had been frequently going offline with the message "This unit is not on," when it was. I contacted CS and they replied within the hour. After troubleshooting several things, providing them with some data, one of the things they wanted to know was any other devices in the area. As it turns out, I have a Bose surround sound speaker system hooked up to my entertainment system. There's a large subwoofer that sits on the floor just a few feet away from the unit. I moved the unit to the kitchen and the problems ceased. So, I moved it back to the living room but put it on top of the entertainment center instead and so far- no issues.Even though I have Internet Extreme package (up to 50 Mbps) and a very good setup around the house, I have had some wi-fi dropping. To alleviate that issue, I went ahead and ordered a Apple Airport Express to extend my network. I'm not sure if that's the issue or if there's unknown interference. Either way, even with the drops, it's never been off long enough to notify me via email/text (every 30 minutes). Usually, it's just a few minutes and comes back on.Hardware is legit, video is great and the bandwidth consumption is minimal.I have read a lot of complaints about customer service. However, I wanted to let other know, my experience has been stellar.Thank you for a great product, professional and timely response from customer service. I am looking forward to an OUTDOOR unit! :)Scott FunkUSMC Ret."For those who fought for it, freedom has a flavor the protected will never know."Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera

Reviews.Title: Dropcam
Reviews.Author: TB
Reviews.Content: I loved the camera,  It had a great picture and wide view of the room.  Unfortunately, I could not get it to stay online :(  I really wanted it to work, but would not stay connected even with the router sitting right next to it :(

Reviews.Title: Got a lemon!
Reviews.Author: D. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Set-up was easy as 1-2-3.  The app and online website were easy to use and access.The device disconnect or goes off line every few days.  Each time, I had to reset the device by unplugging the power source.  After 2-3 weeks, the device light shut down and even with unplugging the power source it did not come back on.  It was also observed that the device gets really warm during operation.  I gave it one star due to this first experience with Dropcam.  I returned the device and received a full refund on Amanzon.  Would not recommend this device due to its reliability.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: ckott72 "ckott72"
Reviews.Content: My only design complaint is that the camera must be plugged in.  There is no battery option.  Other than that, for the size and price, it takes decent surveillance/monitoring video.  It is definitely not high-def, but you can recognize faces.This could be an amazing product with just a little more stability.  Unfortunately, after a few days, the device started crashing.  It turns off.  It constantly loses connection with the router.  Customer service has not been helpful.  They always responded (slowly) with all the regular answers:  "Did you make sure it's plugged in?  Are you sure the router is connected to the Internet?" etc. etc.  I've been through all the steps and rigmarole, including having my connection speed tested, all to no effect.  I wish this product worked.  When the camera is on and recording, it is a great product.  Unfortunately, it has rarely worked for more than a couple hours since I bought it.My recommendation is to NOT buy this product as of today, March 27, 2013.  If you really, really want it, at least wait until Dropcam fixes these issues.This Dropcam HD really only deserves one star.  I'm rating it with two stars, however, becuase I think it has such great potential for reasonably priced real-time streaming video for amatures with a temporary need for surveilance or monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Be careful
Reviews.Author: Timothy Kiernan
Reviews.Content: I bought this and I was impressed until my free trial was over.  I bought the DVR package about 10 days ago and I can still not see recent events.  Angry!

Reviews.Title: Easy setup countered by low quality images and poor features
Reviews.Author: Robert O. Rieder
Reviews.Content: The ease of setup for this unit is it's draw. It a very technical world, the setup of this camera was a breeze and it has good features (night vision/2-way audio/email motion alarms). However, there are many alternatives in this category that are far superior in image quality and function (pan/tilt/zoom). Although the alternatives are a little more complicated to get hooked into your WiFi and ultimately Web enabled.Without naming brands, there are far superior products with full features (pan/tilt/zoom/night vision/2-way audio/email alarms/ftp recording/web & WiFi enabled) that are cost competitive, if not less expensive. Do a bit of homework on alternatives. Do not be dissuaded by a possibly complex installation - give it a shot and you will figure it out. Installations to enable WiFi and Web access are a bit tricky, but resources are available (your ISP most notably).

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive monitoring
Reviews.Author: anthony scoppettone
Reviews.Content: Cloud based wifi cameras.  Easy quick setup.  Plug and go.  Great cameras for the price.  Would defiantly recommend for small businesses.

Reviews.Title: very cool camera
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: I can see everything in my phone and it does text you when there are movement, very easy to use, love it

Reviews.Title: Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera
Reviews.Author: Golf4fun42 "Golf4fun42"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely like this product.  Took 5 minutes to set up and worked out of the box.Video quality is good.  There is a bit of lag time, but that is expected.  It does not bother me for my monitoring purposes.

Reviews.Title: A potentially good product, held back by its poor (Android) app
Reviews.Author: Jared Wilbanks
Reviews.Content: 1st impressions:Packaging - A lot of thought went into it. Seemed like I was unboxing an Apple product.Setup - This was a breeze. Super easy and fast, as advertised.Build - Simple and sturdy. Feels very high-quality.Web Interface - Easy to navigate. Very user-friendly. Easy access to settings. Well-polished.Video Quality - Here's where I have to ding Dropcam. Quality is quite Impressive when viewed through a browser, but quite undesirable when viewed via the Android app. There's no point in making an HD camera if you aren't able to view the stream in HD. The pixelation is such that you can't even make out a person's facial features. I have found a workaround by logging into my camera via my tablet's browser (as I type this, this method is not currently working, so don't rely on it), but this shouldn't have to happen. I'll also point out that you need Flash to view the stream, so if you're on an iPad (I'm using the Asus Transformer Prime), you're out of luck. My guess is that the quality of the video via the iPad app is decent, and all focus was put into making that app, while Android got 2nd fiddle (as usual). One more thing I'd like to point out about the Android app is that there are no options to talk or zoom like the website offers. Don't know if these features are available on the iPad app or not.In conclusion, I'd probably be inclined to give Dropcam 5 stars if it weren't for the poor quality of video and lack of features in regards to the Android app. I don't know about other Dropcam users, but I rarely use a laptop or desktop computer as I always have either my tablet and/or phone with me, which is how I'll be viewing my Dropcam footage. So, unless the app gets a serious overhaul within my return window, I won't be keeping the camera.

Reviews.Title: Messed up my router, just plain did not work!
Reviews.Author: Jayjaj
Reviews.Content: My response after writing them to let them know I want to send it back. They asked if they could fix the problem first. These cameras actually scare me.Thank you.I'm afraid to try to connect this camera again for fear it will mess up my router again. By disappear, I mean just that... it made the router simply go away, not able to find it with searching for any networks to connect to.. just gone. I followed the directions for reinstalling the camera to get it to attach to my network, and the status light would not even come on, and searching for a network showed all the local ones around me, but mine was totally gone. Lost internet connection to the laptop, my other computers, and even my iPhones, no network to connect to. I rebooted, reinstalled the router, and I still  could not connect to any of my peripherals and my network wouldn't show in any network search. My router is from 2009, so I decided I could get a new router, so I went and got a new router, installed it, all's well, went to install the drop cam, everything worked, it found my new network, I got to use it for about 30 min.... then I went and did something else like eat lunch, came back to the dropcam web page, and it said my camera was not connected again! The yellow status light was blinking on and off, I went to check the networks, and my new one was now gone!!! Panic... I rebooted my new router and thank goodness it did come back and now all is well... 50 dollars less a new router.  If you think you know what is wrong, I may ask if you could exchange for a different camera, but I'm afraid it might do the same thing. It has been a big headache and pretty much consumed my whole day. I was to buy a new bike today, but that got shot down because the internet is too important for me to have due to it is used for my partners business, which was down three hours today because of this fiasco... :(
